On the weekends it's full of peeps, but spaced out. Sunday night caused the grounds to empty and left us alone with just a few other campers. You can still have fires here as of July 2014-but I expect them to ban them shorty with how dry and crispy it is out there. 

Site # 25 is a good location that's mostly shaded and near the water, but downwind from the bathrooms. This campground is the 3rd one along Paradise Road and more spacious than the others. 

#gourcamping2014 ended up being just ok, kinda like this campground. Next year we might just pitch a tent next to the patio here in SD and call it good-but who knows? The adventure bug might bite me again. Just like the mosquitoes from this weekend. 

PS: those who know me IRL, ask me about the harrowing night #2 titled "Almost Dying In The Forest"

I've been coming to Nashville a lot for work, and wanted to try a new hot chicken place besides the good OG Hattie Bs. So I tried Bolton's recommended by a friend. It was DELICIOUS! 
I'm not sure if the chicken is better, I'd say it's on par or equal to, however the side items are way better! The Mac n cheese was amazing, the slaw is seriously the best slaw I ever ever had in Nashville, and the baked beans were really good. You HAVE TO GET THE SLAW!! It's so delicious. It's chopped really fine, and it's creamy, instead of being the long stringy kind. And it's perfect to absorb the spices of the chicken, cause your mouth will be on fire! 

Bolton's spice level is higher than other hot chicken I've tried.  The mild is actually very spicy. It was perfect for me (I usually order medium at hattie Bs for comparison).  The medium at Bolton's was too spicy for me! If you're a wuss with spice, they also have no spice or extra mild. But the mild was perfect for me. 

The prices are Right... cheaper than other hot chicken places around. But, the atmosphere isn't the greatest, it's kind of run down which is ok, but I really would love a beer with my chicken, but they don't serve alcohol. I wonder if I can BYO? But, Overall, delicious. I never had the fish so I can't comment on that, but I love the tenders and the side items!

Loved it loved it loved it.  Parking was way easier than I thought it would be. And the surroundings are beautiful. Inside are tons of food options and a decent amount of seating (though not enough, but I'm guessing it's spread out to ensure social distance). There a shop to pick up some local goods too. 
I do wish there were easier ways to see all the menues at the food stalls.  None were easy to see with the crowds.  
There is a bar to get a drink and fun stuff to check out.  It's definitely worth it to check it out.

This is a brand new Residence Inn by Marriott. It's located across the street from the beach and is beautifully decorated with a full kitchen all of the usual amenities. Pets are welcome at this hotel. 

The Residence Inn is connected to a SpringHill Suites with a shared lobby in the middle of both resorts. The breakfast area is spacious and offers about 8 waffle makers. This speeds up the morning process for those who love a do it yourself experience. The staff is amazing and readily available.

Crispy, delicious wings for a great price. I love the Bayou Hot Boy sauce, and my spice-averse girlfriend gets the Steen's Cane Honey BBQ sauce. Get onion rings, not fries. Quick and reliable take out service. There are only two tables at the actual establishment- both outside.

OK - let me say I love El Vez, and have been a fan since they converted it over from Pasion years back. Unfortunately, this old lady is starting to show her grey hair and really needs some retooling. 

Blood Orange margaritas have been the sad draw here forever. Heck even Copa has like a dozen these days, how about rotating a few new flavors. Great on the new Guacamole selections, but it shouldn't have been at the expense of the salsa. Manchego still rules, but the cactus and crab is way too oily, and the citrus tuna one was unavailable last time I was in (seriously - unavailable? someone forgot to shop?) 

The other downturn is with the fajitas. The old presentation sent them out to the table steaming and sputtering. A lot of show? Of course, but that smell. I'd order them and in five minutes three others would too. These day's they're tasty, but the mystique of that lovely sizzli smoke is nowhere to be found. 

Yeah, they have lots of tequila. Yay. I'm a Negro Modela man myself, so I'm content there. Black bass taco's and Mahi-Mahi tacos shouldn't be missed - simply delicious. 

But not a lot to rave about. It's the same old concept with retreaded salsa, and not a whole bunch like they used to have, with a few new guacamole's. I agree if it's broke don't fix it, but come on guys - you're a Starr joint, run some seasonal offerings through or some new specials or something. You're food's good, we're just bored with the same old dishes! 

And telling us you can't get the sizzling grills is just absurd. I can google them up on the net in about 4.3 seconds - spend some cash and get the right ones back in!

I normally don't hang out on Broadway too often, but I must say, Robert's is a huge draw. I L-O-V-E the house band Brazil Billy, they mix up country with a little bit of rockabilly, to end up with the perfect dancing concoction. They play some Cash covers, with tons of style. Pretty much everyone can go here and have a good time, regardless of whether you consider yourself a fan of country music or not. I always bring out of town visitors here on saturday nights, and I have heard nothing but praise from everyone. The bar itself is narrow but long, and it has an upstairs. It gets fairly crowded, but never too crowded to do a little dancing and meet nice folks. I love this bar!

We had stopped by here for my cousin's birthday a few weeks ago. The place was pretty packed on a Tuesday night and we managed to order food and beers at the bar before snagging a table. The Chris Casello trio was playing the majority of the night and I absolutely loved them! They are such an amazing and talented band! My cousin had a great time for her birthday and her man even got the band and the bar to sing happy birthday for her. Also, the cheeseburger with chips I ordered was very tasty and delicious, I'd come back just for the food alone but everything about this place was awesome. Being from Seattle, I was definitely out of my element, but the people and the environment are so dang inviting, it's hard not to start stomping your boots around after just a short time! I'd love to come back!

In true foody fashion, after I went and grubbed out on a Village Whiskey foie gras burger, I had to come here and get ... another burger. Because why? Because I LOVE Shake Shack!

I didn't even know they had Shake Shack in Philly, so when I passed by it after dinner I had to go in. I dragged my entire entourage of now 8 people to come with me, and also convinced them to have burgers because they had never tried it before even though they live in Philly.

O.M.G.

Sorry but I love Shake Shack. I think it's way better than In n' Out (I might get massively flamed for this ... ) and I loved it here with no exceptions. Just talking about it makes me miss it :(!

Wow! Love this spot. Came because I had a free entree (everyone can get this when you download the app!), and I was so pleasantly surprised! I was greeted by a clean environment and very friendly staff! The person who fulfilled my order was awesome and gave me good suggestions as it was my first visit.

I went with the rice bowl, half chicken half pork, spring veggie mix, pickled onions, cucumber and tomato mix. I couldn't decide between sauces so the woman gave me the roasted red pepper and spicy cilantro to try on the side. I loved the roasted red pepper sauce!! Soo good. Next time I probably won't get the cucumber tomato mix in my bowl, but on the side. Loved it but just not with everything else in the bowl.

I will definitely be back! I have enough for lunch tomorrow, and for $8.75 (what I would have paid if it wasn't free), that's worth it to me! And it was DELICIOUS!

I love this place! It's unique, simple in its concept but complex in the options you can have. It's also VERY yummy. 

Food: Delicious! Many options inspired by several types of cuisines. Bowls based on the mediterranean, the pacific, and asia all in one place. You can pick healthy options from brown rice vs white to having no rice (spaghetti squash). I have been missing poke bowls since I left Hawaii and this place delivers!! Think of it as a fancy poke bowl...but not so fancy that it loses the point. 

Atmosphere: Bright, modern, fun, and clean. Outside seating on the walkway area around the strip mall. Dining room seating at casual places. Bar side seating with the casual bar feel. 

Service: Welcoming, friendly, and casual. We sat at the bar and had a very friendly and talkative bartender who was not only patient with us but was also enthusiastic about the place and all the options we could choose. She even went out of her way to get me an ingredient from the back for my poke bowl without acting annoyed at all. 

Bottom line: Go here to please everyone you are with and enjoy a fun time eating good food.

This meal competes with any super high end experience I've had anywhere.

11 courses for $85 is almost unbelievable. The menu is so creative, the execution was almost flawless (a few oversalted dishes), the experience at the kitchen/bar made it even better.

The standouts were the freeze dried foie gras, great texture and amazing quality of foie; aged ribeye was so tender, no knife needed; a dish consisting of broth, freeze dried rice, custard and caviar, it was so rich and flavorful; perfect combination of liquid-custard-crunch-salt-gelatin.

The drinks are also spectacular, they have a small bar to work with, but the execution (again) was awesome.

The flavors we experienced here are heavily asian, alot of ingredients you wouldn't experience with this type of food (seaweed, dashi, etc.). 

I love this place so much. do it.

Loved this little truck! 

It was located across from Draper James in the 12South neighborhood of Nashville. 

They have lots of flavors and the ice is real shaved ice. 

Grab a shaved ice and go take pics at the striped wall across the street or just lounge in one of the benches and enjoy it on a hot summer day!

Very simple and unassuming place, but the food is delish. The first time I went, I got the lunch special which is 1/2 po' boy + a soup/salad. I got a fish po'boy with the crab and corn bisque. Creamy, buttery perfection. My husband got the same thing but with seafood gumbo, it's not as memorable for me, but he seemed to love it. Oh, almost forgot to talk about the po'boy, the fish was perfectly seasoned, came out steaming hot, and definitely tasted fresh. So no complaints there!

Now the second time I went is what compelled me to write this review. I ordered the Uptown BBQ shrimp, which was peeled shrimp in Cajun spices and butter, and this was AMAZING. My pro tip here is to dip your po'boy into the buttery concoction after you're done with the shrimp. Thank me later!! So good, and the service is prompt and very courteous. The po'boy was just as good as the first time too, so now we know their food is consistent. 

The Catch's nearly perfect reviews is well worth it.

Another review summarized it well - they have fantastic food that is very cheap there. In addition, you can acquire all of your standard corner store food supplies there for basically the price you would expect.

As a Mississippian, I am used to being able to walk into neglected looking gas station and being able to obtain some of the finest food available to humanity. As someone who likes to travel, I have come to realize this is a luxury not afforded outside of my home state as much as I am used to. Hank's is a beacon of food and hope on the edge of the 8th and 9th wards.

I was led to this location by an old friend who has been living deeply immersed in New Orleans for a few years now. He has always had a strong NOLA network and knows the ins and outs of his side of town pretty well. I arrived at Hank's confident of it's pedigree.

Inside you find a reasonably large last station based market. Pick up a snack or a drink or a beer for your walk here - it's hot outside.

Where Hank's shines, however, is the cooked food. Again, I'll roll out my Mississippi roots. We produce something like 143% of the worlds catfish and consume an additional 276% of it. We know fried catfish. We love fried catfish. We bleed and breath the stuff. We will fight you over catfish. Hank can fry some damn good catfish. For basically no money, you can leave Hanks with a bag FULL of the stuff. I believe the price was $1 for 2 fillets. The catfish I had there was the softest, flakiest, butteriest catfish that has ever melted on my palate. You would be remiss not to stop by if you needed a snack!

I love this little bar! It is off the beaten path but not to missed! The cocktails they make here are top notch. When my husband and I are in the mood for a cocktail this is almost always where we end up going. Try their margaritas- you wont regret it.

My amazing stylist, Melissa called me one day and told me she was moving to a salon I've never heard of before, nonetheless ventured this far into Old City before; however, with that being said, Melissa's talent with hair, especially having me, someone who loved having long hair feel so much more confident in short hair now is worth even flying 50,000 miles for.

When I say Barnet Fair is possibly one of the most beautiful salons I've ever been to, it's the truth. With the beautiful exposed brick walls to how open the area is with the quirky decor, I think I fell in love the moment I stepped into the salon and walked out with a cute pin that a lovely receptionist told me I can have. 

Back to the hair goddess herself Melissa though -- Melissa has been styling my hair for two years now and she is the first and only stylist I've had that made me feel so much more beautiful when it comes to chopping off my usual dead, long, lifeless hair that went way pass my bum all the way up my shoulders. I used to have anxiety attacks when it came to even chopping an inch off my hair but when Melissa came along, I sat down in her chair and let her discover things about myself I never knew. Melissa is so open and friendly, also she listens to what you want rather than doing what she thinks you'd like, only to possibly have you cry. I showed Melissa a photo that I wanted to copy and without even taking another glance at it, she went to work on my hair and I was stunned at how beautiful and quickly her hands were. I would recommend anyone who's ready to make a huge change in their life go to Melissa. I honestly trust her with not only my hair but my confidence that expanded due to her.

Barnet Fair made an amazing decision to have another talented stylist on their team that I will not stop advertising!

So I've been here a couple of times and I've also had a try of their baked goods at corporate events a couple of times as well. Location wise, it's pretty good that's it's off Jasper Ave. & close to the legislature grounds. Parking wise, not that great, but most patrons are downtown workers who walk over. I like how there is outdoor seating, inside though, is pretty tight, it barely allows for traffic flow between prep station counter to tables. Seating does fill up rather quickly during the lunch hour too. I did see a washroom in the corner near the side entrance too. They have a chic shelving space with nice items to browse & a lovely display of baked goods while you wait in line, but it doesn't take too long to get your order in. I do wish pricing was listed on the baked goods on display. If you order just a drink, the service is a ton faster than ordering food. Mind you, the food is worth the extra 5-10 minute wait.  They even do drink art on your hot drink & there's a drink additions/waiting station with some seating to linger around while waiting for your order. If you order made-to-order food, you get a order number flag. I ordered takeout of a large chai latte & the today's special of mushroom, hollandaise & poached egg tartine. Came to just under $20 including tip...yes it's a pretty hefty price for a deconstructed sandwich & drink, but it was very delicious & not too heavy. Service wasn't too bad, a little bit slower with lunch rush. The server walked my food over to me rather than me having to pick up at counter. The baked goods are always a win here in my books and I'll probably be back here from time to time for a treat & a drink because my co-workers also like this place.

Words cannot express how much I love this place. I've been a faithful customer for about 5 years, now, and seriously cannot sing this thrift store's praises enough. 

Not only do they have a huge selection of used (and cheap!) costumes, but they also have a very extensive collection of accessories (used and new).  I recommend coming to this store if you have no idea what you want to be for Halloween- just because they have a ton of stuff to give you ideas. It's also a great store to go to for theme parties, because you can be sure you won't be spending a ton of money for a last-minute costume. 

The staff is always (and I mean always) helpful, and a few employees have gone out of their way to search for items, even if it took them 10 minutes. Also a big bonus over other costume stores: it's open year-round, and is consistently well stocked.

I have been to Alfano's  Italian Restaurant located at l1702 Clearwater Largo Road North, Clearwater, FL 33756 for lunch and dinner. It's a very lovely, family owned and run Italian Restaurant. It's a wonderful place to enjoy a quiet lunch with friends or a romantic dinner with your significant other. Nice dining rooms with linen tablecloths abound! Now the food. Just about any Italian dish one can think of, is available. Of course, I have tried their Eggplant Parmigiana, and It's very, very good. Their red sauce is very pleasant. Veal Scallopini and their Francaise dishes are wonderful too. Alfano's offers  a variety of fixe prix lunch dishes and early dinners that include select wines for an additional $5 . The meal offers a salad, entree and dessert. The lunch choices are $16 and the dinner $22. During the evening, the vibe is quite vibrant and lively. They usually have live music in the bar. Alfano's is a full service restaurant and also has a wonderful full service bar. They have a very extensive wine list and they make great cocktails too! The  decor is quite interesting, so if possible, try to spend a few minutes checking it out. By the way, Alfano's, in keeping with their love and respect for family, is closed on Sundays, unless otherwise announced.

I was out on a business trip and this was my first ever experience at a Korean BBQ restaurant. It was amazing!

Drinks - We ordered a bottle of the Chanti which was really good, and then a couple bottles of another drink that tasted like a blackberry wine. I am unsure of what it was called but it was really good!

Food - The main reason you come here, all the choices of meat! I didn't eat one bad thing, however the ones I loved the most was the bulgoki and I think the other was a teriyaki marinade! They were both full of flavor and absolutely delicious!

Service - It was slow and late at night. It took a while for us to get seated which was a little odd since it was so empty, but once we were seated the service was fantastic. They were constantly refilling our meat choices, refilling the ban chan and serving us drinks.

Overall - For a first time experience this was great! I left completely full and fully satisfied with the entire experience! I would gladly recommend this restaurant to any of my friends who end up visiting the area!

The pizza is so fresh and made right in front of you! Add a farm egg to your pizza, it's the best, you won't regret it! I also love the burnt taste of the crust, adds a unique flavor. The basil lemon soda was amazing, tart, bubbly, and not too sweet, just how I like it. My only complaint is the basket they serve the pizza in had a terrible smell (probably from being used over and over again, without washing or cleaning). I had to take my pizza out immediately and toss the basket aside.
Great beers and good atmosphere.  This was my first time in, I finally made it.  Loved it.  I want to go back and try more beers.

Double Knot is another fantastic concept by the wonderful chef Michael Schulson. Connected to Sampan, the top floor was crowded at the few tables and around the bar on a Friday night. Luckily, we had a reservation, and we were evaded the bustling upstairs and were seated at an table in the intimate basement level. Downstairs, it was equally as crowded, with patrons filling every table, and a very "weekend" vibe with the dim lighting and close quarters. 

Our server, Dustin, was a wonderful server! He suggested a wine for us, which we absolutely loved. He talked us through the menu, and let us mull over our options. We opted to do the tasting menu. For $60 a person, the table chooses ten dishes - 1 from each section of the menu, but 2 from the robatayaki - to share. While tasting dishes typically leave you hungry, this was the complete opposite. While some dishes were small, others came out in grandiose portions, and by the end of the meal, we were STUFFED. We didn't even finish the last few dishes, although everything was incredible!

TUNA RICE CRACKER - cold // This dish was full of flavor, but the textural contrast is what takes it to the next level. A brick of crispy rice, which is chewy on the inside, is topped with a cool dollop of spicy tuna, with a sweet glaze. The bite ranges from soft to crispy to chewy all at once, and is a textural party in your mouth!

SALMON - specialty sashimi // Thinly sliced pieces of fresh salmon, in a spicy ponzu sauce and topped with soy ginger + scallions. This dish lets the fresh salmon do the talking!

TOFU - crispy // Normally tofu goes unnoticed while on the table, if people even order it at all. But not this tofu! This tofu is fried until it is extremely crispy on the outside, but with a pillowy interior that disintegrates in your mouth. The tofu has two sauces: a pesto and a miso caramel, which both stand out against the mild tofu. Even those who were opposed to ordering tofu helped scarf down this crispy delicacy! 

EDAMAME DUMPLING - small // These little dumps were adorable! The dumplings had a smooth, mild filling made with ground edamame. The flavor was very mellow, yet intriguing. Apparently these are one of the best sellers at Double Knot.

CHICKEN BREAST - robatayaki // Probably the least impressive dish in the meal. The chicken was cooked well, but lacked an explosive flavor compared to the other dishes. 

RIB EYE SCALLION - robatayaki // This was INCREDIBLE, and this is coming from someone who doesn't even like steak. The rib eye was so incredibly tender and juicy, it just melted in the mouth after the first bite. It was topped with a green scallion sauce that was so dynamite, it could have bene paired with cardboard and I'd eat it. Definitely the robatayaki to get!

BEEF SHORT RIB - meat // This was MASSIVE. And so DELICIOUS. The short rib comes to the table whole, and is shredded in front of you. The meat is succulent in the flavorful miso sauce. It's served with lettuce cups and white rice to make lettuce wraps, or you can just jab it with your fork and shovel as much as you possibly can into your mouth.

BROILED SEABASS - fish // By the time this dish came, we were filling up, and I don't think it got the attention it deserved. The seabass was cooked to just past the point of being raw (aka perfect), with glistening insides and a truffle soy glaze on the plate. A simple, understated, perfectly cooked fish. 

CRISPY BRUSSEL SPROUTS - sides // These were good, but not great. The brussels are super crispy, which I loved, and served in a salty fish sauce. While I typically love brussels served like this, I felt the sauce was a bit too pungent or salty, and it made it hard to eat a lot of these.

SPICY TUNA ROLL - sushi // Standard, spicy tuna roll. Fresh fish. 

MOCHI // The tasing menu comes with complimentary mochi. We had two flavors: black sesame and strawberry. These mochi were on the bigger side, with a chewy exterior. The strawberry was a little too sweet for me, but the black sesame tasted like a more mild peanut butter. So delicious and unexpected!!

Double Knot is definitely a spot I will be back to. Will I need to do the tasting menu again? Perhaps, but it was a lot of food. If I were to do it again, I would let the chef choose the menu so I could try some dishes I wouldn't normally. There's tons to chose from the expansive menu, and it's perfect for a weekend dinner or a date night.

The place is fancy! Looks fancier on the inside than out. We were just walking around international mall and wanted to try a new place for dinner. I searched on google and saw that ocean prime was a really close one we hadn't been to before. We had to drive to it even though it's less than a mile from international mall, there's kind of no way to walk to it. There's outdoor self parking spaces and valet parking available. 

We didn't have a reservation but were seated immediately, we didn't mind whatever seating option became first available. They do have a main "dining" area with live music, a covered patio area and an area close to the patio area (which is where we sat). The temperature inside was VERY cold. Other than that it was nice. 

The staff is so friendly and service is amazing. Big thanks to our server Cristy, she was SO sweet, attentive, and knowledgeable. 

The food! I was surprised at how good everything tasted! Every single thing I tried was amazing. 

I tried the lobster bisque, it was so good. Love how they brought it out with just the lobster meat at first then poured the bisque on it. It was so smooth and creamy. Hearts of romaine salad was yummy too, but it was my least favorite out of all. 

Goat cheese ravioli was really unique, I'd definitely get it again. I like goat cheese in general but never had it in ravioli form. Also, I don't know what sauce it came with but it was really good. 

Calamari was nice and crispy. Filet minion was made perfectly, had a Smokey flavor, I didn't really like the presentation though. Black truffle Mac and cheese was heavenly cheesy goodness. 

The butter cake... no matter how I describe it, the description will never match the real thing. The warm softness of the most moist cake along with the cold creamy ice cream. Cake compliments of the chef since it was my moms birthday. 

All in all my favorites, in order:
Butter cake
Lobster bisque
Black truffle Mac and cheese
Goat cheese ravioli

I love Moe's Monday. So hate me. 

This Moe's is solid. It hits all of the check marks and performs consistently. I come here for lunch and every time has been a solid visit. The customer service is great, they're always well stocked and I've never had to wait for food restocking, the ingredients are always fresh, and the soda machine actually works here, and the salsa station is always well maintained and clean. They offered us refills while we were sitting there, which was new to me, while we were sitting at our table. 

This Moe's is definitely one of the better ones that I've been to. Thumbs up.

The Panera of Indian food - I love this place! Their lamb is so good and the naan is HUGE!! The cashiers are so helpful with new customers, that is much appreciated. My favorite part is the long tables that have little spice windows in them - such a cool thing to do to show what goes into your food. Parking is great too, they are in the towne center so you can park anywhere and walk. SO nice!!

Miller's is one of the better quick family restaurants. The service is always pretty good, and the food comes out quick and meets expectations. I personally love their zingers and their burgers are seriously good. They have pretty good late night specials as well.

I was super excited to see a Club Pilates come to Mass Ave because it is in walking distance to where I live and I love reformer. I did one of their free classes during their grand opening to check it out. It is a pretty small  place but in the actual pilates room, there was plenty of room. About 12 reformers and a bunch of other equipment and everything was brand new. 

The class itself was pretty good. Because it was a free class, I think it was more of an introductory class because everything was pretty basic and nothing was overly challenging. I would like to go back and try another class to see if it would be different. The instructor was great though! It was a bit distracting however, when people walk into the studio because you can see straight into the reception area. I think the only thing that would stop me from going is cost because it is pretty pricey. All in all, good experience and if you go  to check it out, make sure to bring your sticky socks!

This is a great place to catch a ballgame. I've been to several games over the past few years and had fun at all of them. They have a great general admission hill in the outfield that kids can run around on and have fun during the game. There are picnic tables in the outfield too. You can bring food and drinks into the game and have a picnic in the outfield. 

I love the backdrop of the buildings of Downtown Indy. The new hotel towers over the ballpark. There are a lot of downtown restaurants and bars near the ballpark too. 

I would recommend this stop to anyone visiting Indy.

Love love love this Fogo de Chao! This is probably one of the better locations that I have been to because of the service, seating, laid back nature of the Midwest(?) 

Fogo de Chao in general:

- The salad bar is pretty good 

- The bread is amazing

- Eat a small lunch (it's all you can eat)

- Wear appropriate clothes --- there's nothing more embarrassing than being on a date, standing up from the table, and having a food baby! 

- Unlike other Brazilian steakhouses they do not serve grilled pineapple. HOWEVER, they have a pineapple dessert that they torch (like creme brûlée) and serve with ice cream! DELISH! 

I hope you enjoy!!! 



If you are thinking about dining here I would advise you to have a small lunch! No matter how much I try, I never feel like

Ok, I would love to give this place a solid 5 stars, because the ribs just blew me away with their fantastic-ness (and I'm from NC, aka BBQ south). But the prices are ridiculously expensive ($5.50 per a single rib - make no mistake, not a rack. Aka $11 for two pieces of rib). Yep, you read that correctly.

Maybe they have on/off days based on the mixed reviews, but my order (via delivery) tasted incredible:

+ St. Louis ribs - the ribs in particular were just divine - rich in flavor, tender and not dry at all, perfectly crisped/charred outer skin, big bones & helping of meat on each rib. The smoked taste came through prominently but didn't overwhelm the delicious rib meat. On top of that, you can see the quality and artistry that went into butchering/prepping.

+ Burnt end baked beans - super flavorful, rich/caramelized flavor with a little bit of meat. Also A+

+ Bourbon pecan pie ($4) - good old-fashioned pecan pie. Can't really go wrong.

...the caveat is the PRICE, as mentioned. Ribs come w/ some equally amazing sauce and  decent rolls, but when I received my delivery I thought they had made a mistake when I unwrapped 2 paltry ribs for $11. Nope. Likewise for the other meats here I imagine. And it's especially astonishing, given how cheap and plentiful good BBQ is outside the state, granted maybe not as tasty by a margin. 

So as much as the food here amazed me, I can't really give it 5/5. I used a coupon via the new delivery service (UberEats, use eats-dianax for $10 off) so my meal ended up being ~$11, but as much as I'd like to have a taste of those ribs/beans again, my wallet would hate me.

Update (only on ramen): 

Edmonton's ramen race has begun. There's been an influx of ramen lately, from pop ups to storefronts and I could not ask for anything else for my hometown - ramen is my absolute favourite thing to eat. Hands down. Ohana Ya Japanese Restaurant in St. Albert is the latest to serve up ramen, an addition to their sushi centric menu. Unlike its competitor across the road with Saturday lunch-only ramen, Ohana Ya offers ramen during the weekdays for the lunch rush. Who would have thought that St. Albert would have a small ramen culture of their own!

Five kinds of ramen are offered, $11 a bowl: shio (salt), shoyu (soy sauce), miso (soy bean paste), tonkotsu (pork bone broth), and tan tan (spicy sesame minced pork with peanuts, $12). All bowls, except for the tan tan, are served with char siu, bamboo shoots, beansprouts, sweet corn, fungus, and a boiled egg. For an additional $2, you get two extra pieces of char siu, and for an extra $1, you can have an extra side item. I assume that means another egg.

Josh was my lunch date this time around, his (questionable) first time eating ramen! He ordered the tonkotsu ramen and paid extra for the char siu. The noodles aren't made in house but were wavy, good consistency, and one of the better noodles I've had in Edmonton and area. Ohana Ya at least is sourcing delicious noodles! A sip of the broth gave me a taste of creamy, rich, and salty pork bone broth. I understand that an "under-seasoned broth is a crime" (high-five to you, fellow ramen lover, if you know where that quote is from), but whoa. It was a touch harder to finish and drink the broth near the end.

I ordered the miso ramen, the fermented soy bean paste a favourite style of mine. The char siu was moist and very nicely done. I hate it when I get lean char siu in ramen. The half egg was medium-hard boiled and very lightly marinated. The menu pictured different bowls, one with a perfectly cooked soft-medium boiled egg, whereas the next photo showed a hard-boiled one. I'm going to assume that the kind of egg you get is a surprise! I really enjoyed my bowl, a good portion and loaded with toppings. I appreciated the two different kinds of seaweed.

I would have preferred for a slightly less salty broth to enjoy the bowl from start to finish, but otherwise it was a solid bowl of ramen for a good value. As they just started offering their ramen menu, hopefully this was just a part of the kinks that need to be ironed out. Comparing it to Yuzen's weekend ramen is a hard sell, seeing that you'll never have to choose between the two on a given day. Ramen is a labour intensive dish to make and I appreciate Ohana Ya Japanese Restaurant for serving it up daily, let alone offer five different kinds. Definitely a must visit when you're in the area or if you have a free weekday lunch. Try it out!

I absolutely love this place I almost wish I could work here so I could just hang out and look at all the neat things they have! 

Also, their poke is AMAZING. I definitely recommend. They're also so generous with the poke samples, you can actually get it yourself! Lol 

I've had their fruit smoothie which I loved, and today I had a spicy shrimp brown rice bowl ($8.99)which was delicious. They have an area similar to Whole Foods where you can make your own salad. They have SO much premade food, I want to try everything because it all looks so good! Also, their coffee is so strong. I don't even know if I could handle it again, my hearts been beating so fast all day from that latte!!! ($3.25) Oh and they don't charge you for using a different kind of milk which I love.

I somehow always end up at High Street on Market when I visit Philly.  It's like everyone of my friends invites me for breakfast there.  Which is good, because I like it.  Their service is outstanding.  I had this girl the other morning who couldn't tell me enough about how much she likes coffee.  She may have been wearing a coffee lover shirt for that matter?  Their coffee is good, not La Colombe, but I think it's Rival or Counter Culture which is very solid.  Their food is also really nice.  It changes fairly frequently but also perfectly portioned and cooked with the right ingredients.  This is a great place for a 2 or 3 person breakfast/lunch or alone if you can get the coffee girl to chat you up :)

Good morning my fellow Yelpers! I thought long and hard about this review so bare with me! So, I'm a woman of a "certain" age: (read 53) and besides going under the knife for a facelift (not there yet LOL, maybe another 10 years) I've tried every procedure you can imagine to tighten my skin, address my jowls and give my neck a little tightening refresh. You feel me ladies? I won't bore you with all the procedures I've tried. I will however, tell you what drives me batshit insane ( and has taken me years to realize because I guess I'm not that sharp). Is when you go for a cosmetic consultation and advise what is bothering you and what you really want some help with, again in my case (drooping skin around my cheeks, jowls and neck) and what they say will "absolutely work" for you is what they have in their office!!! Are you following me here? Not, oh sorry we 'd love to help you but this $500 chemical peel will solve the problem, or microdermasion is just what you need to lift those jowls. How about..... no sorry that's not a
good fit for you but I might have a solution for you to investigate. DONT sell me something I DONT want or need to line your pockets. I'm not rich! I work to save up for these procedures. I work hard for my money and the sad part is I would more than likely come back to you for that chemical peel or dermabrasion if you were just honest from the beginning!!!  Am I making sense here ladies (and gents) I don't expect miracles or to look 30 again (heavy sigh) but I do expect some form of straight up honesty and realistic expectations. Don't even get me started with Ultherapy. Very Painful and in my opinion waste of money. Maybe for other issues so I don't want to totally knock it but certainly not a success for me. (NOT cheap either)!  So with all that said LOL, I think I did some pretty intense research this time not only on the latest procedures but practitioners which is where Dr. Lisa at LaChele comes into the picture. My consultation was with Dr Espinoza. She took one look at me and knew what I needed. Facetite for my jowls and Morpheus 8 to treat fine lines and wrinkles. ( Read up on the procedures folks) BUT, it's not just the machine/apparatus you need an experienced practitioner who has a artists eye. I got that from Lisa right away. I was very nervous so I barely heard a word she said during the first consultation LOL. I must have called back 5 times and spoken with either Lisa or Melissa who ALWAYS called me back, didn't make me feel like a high maintenance pain in the ass and very directly set my expectations. Absolutely no hard sell here just a straight up assessment of what to expect. It was my decision to make. I had the procedure done this past Monday 1/11 because I needed some thing to boost my confidence and forget about 2020. I am very swollen ( to be expected) no bruising at all and I bruise easy. I'm not sure if that had to do with the MEND supplement they recommended (picture below) but I'm glad I bought it. In my package I have two more Morpheus sessions so I will set these up in the next few months. Oh, and one last thing the facetite was a breeze. Completely numbed, didn't feel a thing and the Xanax , well what can I say, Xanax fixes everything. My only constructive criticism would be to numb the face again next time before the Morpheus. That my friends was a little painful.  Next time I will ask for more numbing on the Morpheus but Lana was fantastic. Here are some pics (three days) after and a few prior to the procedure but for the first time I feel hopeful. Sit down before you see the price and take a deep breath.....$4,700. Yes, I know!!! I will certainly follow up in a few months to hopefully see it was worth it. Thank you, Lisa, Melissa and Lana. You guys are a GREAT CREW and I have high hopes. My very best, Kim Butner

Been here three times now, and 2 out of 3 were very good experiences (once during dinner we had a server that was really not in the mood, but the food was still good). Location is pretty strategic, restaurant area of the mall, and I can't really complain about how bad Brandon Mall parking and traffic is, that's not the restaurant's fault. They are located very near the parking lot so that's a plus. 

We were a party of 5 for lunch on a Friday and were seated outside. The server takes a bit of time but hey, it's lunchtime. We had calamari and coconut shrimp, both of which were fantastic. The dip for the coconut shrimp was very flavorful, sweet but has a little kick to it, reminds me a little of Thai sweet chili sauce made less spicy. For my drink, I got their Strawberry mojito, which I believe is a great choice for people with a sweet tooth (guilty). The seafood paella was next in my list, and I loved the flavor and texture of the rice. The serving was humongous so I had to take half home. I was happy about the proportion of rice to seafood, and the clams visually brought the dish together. 

And now to my main dish, dessert! I was very happy with the rum cake (had to, it is Rumtoberfest after all), and there was a little happy dance with every bite! 

I would recommend Bahama Breeze for a gathering of any sort. They have a wide selection of flavorful food and their drinks do not disappoint!

My wife and I stopped in here for lunch today, as we were spending the day downtown shopping and just hanging out.  I love the charm of the old-city industrial architecture, and the roll-open doors make the open air dining really pleasurable, especially if you don't want to sit in the sun outside.  As far as the food goes, I'm kind of on the fence.  I got their signature burger and fries, and it was just ok.  I prefer thinner burgers, rather than one that gets built up like a tower, and is hard to take a bite out of.  10 Barrel's burger was definitely of the tower variety.  The rationalization for the four-star-review was my wife's sandwich.  She ordered the Americano Sano, which was absolutely delicious.  She loved it, and the bite she shared with me was really really good!  The servers were friendly, but I wished they made the rounds a bit more often.  I was really wanting a water refill, and couldn't find someone to ask.  So this place would have likely been a typical 3-star brewspot with average pub food, but I'll give them the nod since my wife's sandwich was soooo good!  We'll probably come back, but I will definitely be trying other items on the menu.

[  They say that the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting different results.  I've been quoting that cliché for years, and it has never convinced anyone to change their mind.  ]

Tampa, FL: Last night I enjoyed a good meal at Ulele. Was it the best meal I've ever had? No. Did I enjoy the meal? Yes. Will I recommend the place? Probably.

We called to make a reservation for two yesterday. We were told we didn't need reservations but if we wanted to make a reservation, the only openings were at 7:00 pm and 8:45 pm. We took the 8:45 pm. We ended up finishing our tasks early and got to the restaurant at 7:45 pm. We were chastised - not joking - by the guy at the front, who told us we had arrived too early. We told him we understood and after calming down, the employee told us we could sit at the bar and sit get served food.

After a rude introduction, I enjoyed sitting at the bar. Our bartender/server, unlike the man at the front, was very sweet and extremely attentive - my water glass was never empty the entire meal. Though I didn't drink last night, I also enjoyed the look and energy of the bar, including the unique cocktails the bartenders concocted.

I ordered the Florida Pompano, complete with a creamy tomato sauce, fried carrot ribbons, mashed potatoes, and green beans. As an occasional pescatarian, eating meat is quite heavy on my stomach. That didn't stop me from scarfing down half of the pompano filet last night - the sauce was INCREDIBLE and everything, even the carrot ribbons, worked well together. Though I'd prefer a better presentation - having the carrots piled on one side of the plate wasn't particularly appealing visually - I didn't have any complaints about the taste and creativity of the entree.

I ended the meal with a slice of guava pie. The presentation was lovely, and the taste decent. I didn't mind the dessert ultimately, but I'm not going to be clambering to find another slice.

Ultimately, I liked this place. While I didn't care for the look of the place - it was a bit busy - the location off the park was unique and lovely. I didn't appreciate the employee at the front, and I think the price was a bit high for what I got. The creativity was refreshing though and I wouldn't hesitate to send people to Ulele. It's a "must try" restaurant at least once.

This burger joint has the juiciest burgers and I love that they allow you to pick the temperature of your burger.  They have a monthly special in addition to their set burger options. If you like potato chips on your burger, then this is the place for you! If you are on Atkins, then ask for your burger to be topless and it will come on top of a salad. You can get a milkshake, with alcohol and your choice of sweet potato fries, regular fries, and/or onion rings.
I'll update later with pictures.

This is my favorite salon in town. 
Not only because it's the best place to get my nails done, but now it's the only place l'll ever get my hair done!!! 
Gabbi's got my nails down, yet little did I know that this salon houses my new hair savior, Jeanne!!! 
She's an artist. A miracle worker. She took my long, thick, super straight hair, and cut and layered it to curl! Then after doing an outstanding job at cutting it, we discussed a highlight. She was excited because my hair was ...Virgin Hair lol! She found out there was no and hadn't been any color on my hair in many years. At least 4 or 5 I believe. An appointment was made and I couldn't wait!
Today I went in early, and gave my hair over once again to the master. 
What I like about Intrinsic the most, is that it feels like you're sitting at home talking to family while you're getting pampered...and I need that. This salon is 'the salon'... ya know, the one you see in movies where everyone knows each other and talks about their lives, their days. This is the perfect therapy session. 
After highlighting my hair, she styled it and my jaw dropped! I LOVE it!!!! She hand painted highlights into my hair, held in place with foil and brought it to the most beautiful color. It looks so natural and integrated into my super dark hair that it truly is a work of art! Jeanne, Gabbi, y'all are beautiful, intelligent and caring women. And Intrinsic is more than just a salon to me. It's a sanctuary.

Love this place. Decorations super adorable with all the colorful eggs and egg pictures and egg drawings. 

Food here has huge portion and taste pretty good too. I got the surfer girl omelette. Super bomb. They also give you a homemade muffin with it too. It is a little dry but definitely crunchy. 

Service is awesome. Our server Steve is super warm and gives great suggestion for what to get. 

They even have free WiFi. Overall great experience.

I have never eaten korean cuisine before, but had always wanted to try it.  Living just down the road from this new place, I was excited to try it out.  I went with a group of six people and upon arrival were the only larger table there.  We were there for 2 hours and as the night went on, two other larger tables arrived.  The three sisters who own the restaurant are the only 3 servers, so as they got busier, our service slowed way down.  It was difficult to flag someone down.  

The food however was delicious.  I loved getting all the different sides to try.  Everyone had a different favorite!  Be aware that they are sparing with refills.  You can only get one refill of rice and one refill on the sides without charge.  Also, they have alcohol listed on their menu, but they do not currently have a liquor license so you cannot order any right now.

This is not my first go round here and I haven't been disappointed yet. Not that I'm looking to. 

Always come in groups so that you can try each other's side dishes without having to order them all yourself :) With that being said, download the NoWait app and place yourself in line as you are looking for a parking spot because I've never seen this place empty and the wait can get long because everyone loves it here. Service is A1 and you are constantly being checked on.

Typically I'll order 1/4 chicken with mac & cheese and spoon bread. This go round I decided to share a 1/2 chicken with the same sides and another set of friends got the collards and mac& cheese. The collards came out in this smaller than normal container that did not look possible for 2 people to share let alone 4 people to try. Not sure how new that is.  Our table of 4 got 2 pitchers of Bourbon punch and boy were they both strong!

Tip 1: ask for bacon for the mac & cheese, you're welcome.
Tip 2: pour the spicy honey sauce on the chicken & spoon bread.
Tip 3: What are you waiting on? GO!

We went for lunch on a Tuesday and were pretty much the only customers. Which is a shame because Tamarind is spacious and distanced, very clean, and tastefully decorated. Everything is in new condition, including the stylish bar and comfortable patio with outdoor fireplace. 

A lunch menu would be a nice alternative to the lunch buffet, which is currently closed to minimize COVID risk. 

We ordered chicken Hyderbadi 65 ($15), which is an appetizer-sized portion of marinated tandoor chicken garnished with red onion, cilantro and curry leaves. The chicken itself was a little on the dry side. But the marinade was very flavorful with a nice slow, medium heat (as requested). And the curry leaves imparted a nice balance overall. The portion size is small relative to the price. So I probably would try something else on the appetizer list next-time. 

Lamb Masala ($15). *Delicious.* The lamb was tender but not mushy, very well seasoned, and didn't disappear into the gravy like many lesser quality places. The gravy was layered with hints of turmeric, cardamom, coriander, cumin and clove. Not a lot of heat. But wonderful in balance. 

Garlic Naan ($3.5). Very good texture, with a bit of crisp on the bottom and a nice hint of garlic. Not overly buttered or greasy. Delicious. 

Overall, Tamarind is wonderful. It's priced a little higher than some other places. But with the clean and stylish decor, and the wonderfully prepared food, it's definitely worth it. 

Please give it a try.

Ok, so it's been 2 years since my children and I went to the Arch and I have had another kid since then too. Hear me out though. I wasn't on Yelp :) My dad and I took my 3 kids to St Louis in the summer of 2015. It was my kids first vacation. We stayed in a hotel downtown, about a 10 min walk from the arch. First of all...we were there during the Little People Convention, so it was much busier than usual. We were also there with they were doing some major construction on the area, but that didn't take away from the arch whatsoever. 

I believe it was $10 bucks a person when we went, which was well worth it. I am terrified of enclosed spaces and heights, so going up this thing was definitely for my kids at first and NOT me. 

We got there super early and didn't wait long at all to get into a pod. The 5 of us (my dad, me and 3 kids) all fit into the pod comfortably. I was happy there was a window to look out as we went up vertically then sideways almost like a Ferris wheel once we got to the curve of the arch. Truthfully, it was terrifying for me lol but my kids loved it!!!!! As you go up, you can see all the pulleys and gears buried deep within the arch. If I hadn't been so scared, I would have enjoyed looking at that along the way up much more. 

Once we got up, i felt like I was walking into a blast from the past with all the carpeted walls. The windows were pretty small, but still offered amazing views. If someone tells you the arch sways in the breeze - they are not joking. It wasn't terribly windy out, but it still moved some. Terrifying for this girl. Kids loved it. It was pretty small up top honestly, but still plenty of room to look out the windows and get some great photos!!!!

By far, the BEST sushi in the area. When customers ask me about good sushi places, I always direct them here. 

I came here for my birthday in July because I could not stop talking about sushi. I have always been in love with sushi, since I grew up in a primarily Asian area in Southern California. That being said, I hold my sushi standards fairly high. Boy this place did not disappoint. Another family run business, with the sweetest and nicest people running it. 

This is where my boyfriend found out about the fried California roll, which became a new favorite of his. The prices for dinner combos are great and the katsu don was perfect. I plan to come here multiple times.

Awesome little hole in the wall, if that's what you can call it. It was hidden in a shopping center, but it was nice and clean inside. I knew it would be authentic since most people inside the restaurant were Bosnian I'm assuming. 

If you are looking for something unique, fresh, delicious, with great service, look no further. I ordered the sausage sandwich. They had a large portion size and small portion size option, so I ordered the small portion size. Ordered some fries on the side, and was brought out an entire basket of fries!
Medina, our adorable and helpful server, asked what sauce I wanted, and since I'm from Utah, I naturally asked for fry sauce and she was kind enough to mix me up some! The fries were perfectly cooked. No complaints whatsoever.

My sausage sandwich had a white and red sauce and they did not skimp on the sausages inside either. I will note that if you don't love uncooked onions, this may not be the dish for you. 
This was unlike anything I've ever really eaten before, so nothing to compare it to but was very delicious.
My eating partner ordered the lamb gyro which should she said was also very delicious. 

If you have little children, they have a kids menu option with a burger option, Nutella sandwic onh, and something else I can't remember what. But it is a place that will accommodate whatever kind of eaters you have in your party. 

We paid $10 for each of our meals, which included fries and my drink, so that is very reasonable. I would say they could charge more and I would have not complained for how much food we received. 

If I ever find myself back in this area, I will definitely stop by again!

Went to RAD Brewery tonight and loved the new sign and tap handles!! They were busy with a Doodle Dog Romp event, loved seeing all the dogs having fun on the patio.  I was amazed how well the bartender handled all the orders with great customer service.  I actually had a customer asks me what I thought about the new name and rebranding.  I said I love the mission of RAD brewery to help children in sports and to support a community.  I feel you should give every change a chance!

I was less than happy with this place in the past. It was a bit shabby and slow even producing the most basic menu items. During the bulk of covid they wouldn't let people, even gloved and masked, walk into the lobby requiring you to use the drive through and the drive through was SLOW. Too damn slow to bother with. Something BK has admitted at a corporate level as an overall issue.

I was pretty much resolved 'that's it never again.' Then this weekend they announce it was the anniversary of the Whopper and they would be selling at $0.37, their original price, all weekend.

OK, I thought, the corporation knows they are losing market share and they're willing to make this really great offer.  The world is clawing its way out of the shut down, I'm willing to give them a chance. Maybe it has improved.

uh-no. in fact it's worse. Remember BK was advertising $0.37/whopper all weekend. This was just before noon on a Saturday and they were charging full price. when i asked about it the kid behind the counter mumbled something about 'it's not working' and would only repeat that.

"What" wasn't working? The cash register? nope they took the money. When i challenged him that it was supposed to run all weekend and they couldn't even make it to noon on a Saturday?  "It's not working" and not even a 'sorry.' 

So the place is still shabby, and slow and NOW they are clearly not willing to honor the deals put out by the chain and lack even the common curtesy to say 'sorry.' I tried to report the incident on Burger King's site but they were having error's with their complaints board. Guess they don't care either. 

BK as a business is losing market share badly and not only is it no longer challenging McDonald's, they've fallen behind Wendy's. There's a Wendy's right across the street where the staff is perfectly friendly. Let this BK join the rest of its chain and sink out of sight.

Been here several times. Service was excellent. They have really good guacamole. That is a must-try!

I always love their chips and salsa, as well as the queso dip. My daughter ordered the chicken fingers and fries and she loved it. I ordered Quesadilla Rellena. The Arroz con Pollo, which was what my mom ordered  was absolutely delicious. Next time, I'm gonna order that for myself! Lol

For dessert, we had churros. It was light, delicate, and just the right amount of sweetness to end our meal. Next time, I'll probably order extra chocolate to dip the churros in. 

Salsa Fresca is our reliable go-to Mexican restaurant.

The little Italian food truck. That girl is living the dream. I think she is one man shop. I did not peak in, but it was fast and very good.
 
They have subs, Chicken and Eggplant parmesan and Meatball. All maybe a plate which comes with a salad and pasta and Italian bread. 

My lunch partners had the meatballs and said they were very tasty. I am hoping to try them soon. I had the eggplant parmesan and loved it. The bread and salad were fresh too. 

They have Italian sodas, very nice touch and also cannoli. She even has the pregnant cannoli you can order online. It is a giant cannoli shells filled with 48 little baby cannoli for $100.  Per her website, great for parties, showers, offices, birthdays, holidays or just your normal Wednesday night at home! Add more cannoli for $24/dozen. 

She keeps her schedule updated monthly and also caters. Living the dream and keeping lunch time people in a food coma. Awesome Italian!

Tucson, AZ (Rita Ranch): fantastic!

Awesome service and delicious food. We were seated immediately, arriving just before HH ended. When my House Margarita arrived in blended form instead of "over the rocks", the serving staff apologized, removed the erroneous drink, and promptly returned with my proper order, a simple but well composed drink where I could taste the tequila not in slushy form. Complimentary, house made chips, light and crispy, and salsa with a bit of kick, made for a great  start to our meal.

FOOD
Green Chili Pork Burrito w/rice & beans
Shredded Chicken Taco w/ rice & beans
Off menu Chorizo con Huevo 
Shredded Beef Chimichanga w/rice & beans

I was surprised at seeing just a 3.5 star rating. This was our friends' favorite Mexican restaurant. We had to agree it was good. The rice was savory and moist. The refried beans were creamy and topped with melted cheese. Hubby thoroughly enjoyed his breakfast for dinner, his chorizo con huevo (sausage with eggs). My chimichanga shell was crispy and the generous shredded beef filling very tender and flavorful. Both our friends' taco and burrito did not disappoint. Our server stopped by at least three times after our food arrived to see how we were doing, and even brought out a second bowl of chips. The water glasses and iced tea were continually refilled.There is a bar and Happy Hour (2-5pm every day) is also served in the dining room. Two separate non-gender specific restrooms. Excellent service, delicious food, located in a strip mall with a small lot, accessed from southbound Houghton, south of Rita. Would love to come back to try more of their menu.

Everybody loves a fresh donut. And this place has some of the best. They are delicious and soft. The selection here is great. They have everything from donut holes to bear claws to donuts bigger than your face. There were some cute Halloween ones with spider webs, skulls, and bats there this season. My favorite, of course, is the maple bar. You can order fresh coffee to sip with your donut, and eat at a table or take it to go. They have a super convenient drive thru, but I enjoy the experience of going in and looking at the variety they have available. This Doughboy is in a prime location by the super Walmart, so they get pretty busy on the weekend. The staff is super friendly and quick. The price is great. They sell donuts individually or whatever quantities you would like. Thumbs up from me.

Had a great dinner here recently & loved the beachside location!

We got there on a Saturday night around 5:45pm with no reservations, but got seated within minutes of arriving. We did try to call ahead to find out a wait time, but they don't do call ahead seating and it's first come first serve according to the lady I spoke to on the phone. Like I said, we had no issues getting seated as a table of two with a great view of the beach, but it's something to keep in mind for larger parties or wanting preferred seating.

My boyfriend and I split an order of chips and queso with an side of salsa too, and he got the blackened chicken sandwich while I got the peel & eat shrimp (an appetizer) for my entree. The queso was advertised as spicy, but it really wasn't; the salsa actually had more of a kick to it than the queso. He loved his blackened chicken, but they do season it with some spices that might burn a bit. He poured some of the leftover queso on the chicken sandwich though & absolutely loved it! I had the peel & eat shrimp which was quite filling despite being an appetizer. 

We finished up just before the sun started to set, so we used the convenient beachside location to go walk the sand & enjoy the sunset. As we were leaving the restaurant, we saw people setting up for live music so we were sad to miss that, but excited to catch it next time since we'll definitely be back!

We came here on a recent visit to Nola, we came upon it wandering around after riding the streetcar. And what a gem we found! This is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at in Nola. I did not realize at the time but it's listed as one of the top 50 restaurants in America. I can see why. The outside of the restaurant is what caught our attention. Tables outside, beautiful top balcony with very nice plants. We were seated at a cozy table inside and were immediately greeted by our phenomenal server Rene. Impeccable service from start to finish. He helped us pick out a great bottle of wine from their very extensive wine menu, which was at least 7 pages! We were overwhelmed by all the choices. We enjoyed a bottle of Bordeaux called    Diem. They have wines from all over the world here. I never seen a wine list quite like this one. The menu is just as amazing. Unique selections. For starters we shared a seasonal green salad that had feta, cucumbers, croutons and the most delicious buttermilk scallion dressing. Excellent! We loved the flavor combinations. We also shared a small plate of the beef short rib. Fall off the bone tender, with a wonderful salsa verde and horseradish cream sauce. For the main entrees we ordered the crispy goat which came with curried cauliflower, black beans and yogurt. It was presented in a large bowl. It was delicious! Similar to a curry but had large tender pieces of goat. Wonderful flavors and the perfect blend of spices. Incredible choice. My entree was a grilled Zabuton steak with French fries. The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare. Beautifully marbled cut of meat. Tender and perfect. The fries were served with a nice sauce as well. We loved this place so much. We passed on dessert because we were so full. The ambiance, food, and service were simply phenomenal. The prices are very fair and not overpriced. Highly recommend eating here.

In a few words: community staple, affordable, fresh, and healthy.

Lovely outdoor produce market in Webster Groves. We live in the city and therefore go pretty far out of our way to shop here. We typically go at the beginning of every week, either Monday or Tuesday, and it's never busy! Better yet, they are open 7 days a week and all year round. I imagine it's a little more crowded on Saturday and Sunday.

Their produce is local whenever possible. So, when you buy here, you're supporting big and small local farms... who wouldn't want to be a part of that? They are across the street from Webster University, so they provide affordable and healthy options for students, staff, and visitors. 

Not only do they have fresh produce, but depending on the season, they have different plants, flowers, and herbs. During the holiday season they have live trees you can take home to adorn your living room!

On top of all of these offerings and availability, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. They always know where their food comes from and are readily willing to share that information. Rogers has been open for 40 years and counting. They have the perfect thing going to keep their regulars and grow their business.

Cute, modern with its own style kinda vibe.

Depending on your level of stylist will depend on the price you pay, which seems to be the typical way salons are going nowadays.

Mine was a bit pricier than usual, closer to over $80 (and I have straight thin hair), but I knew what I was getting into prior to arrival, as the lovely attendant on the phone informs you.

I loved that he cut my hair similar to how they cut it in a salon in Paris (which I must say, still is the best haircut of my life to this day). He took close to an hour, even with my simple haircut demands, so I appreciate the stretching out to make it worth it. 

No pushy sales at the end, which YAY!

I really have grown to love this place. The food is great! I have had the Gulf Coaster Burrito more times than I can count. This burrito has seasoned gulf shrimp, rice, beans, bacon, caramelized onion, baby spinach, cheddar and jack cheese, and an amazing pesto on top! I definitely can't stop ordering this! I also ordered a salad which was huge! I wasn't expected it to be so large, but it did not disappoint. 
The food is great, my only pet peeve about this restaurant is the location. It's located in a building containing 5-6 other restaurants. Parking can be a headache since its so close to downtown and often these spots are blocked off for those who are going downtown to park all day. This parking headache tends to make me avoid eating there and just ordering for pickup. Check it out!

This Bread Co isn't the biggest or fanciest one in town, but it gets the job done. The ladies know me and my order, and are always so friendly. Bread Cos are always consistent. My fave is the fuji apple chicken salad, minus the chicken - YUM! I also like the mac n' cheese. I wish they had another veggie sandwich here, because I don't care for the one they have. They used to have one I liked, but now they don't. It's ok though because I love their salads and they are healthier.

And can I say BAGELS? I love their asiago, toasted with cream cheese. YUM! 

Their drinks are good as well - I like the mochas (and I'm not a coffee drinker), chai, and smoothies.

I love their rewards program - it's fun getting random rewards and being able to cash them in. I wish they had different rewards more. I've only gotten bagels, baked goods and drinks (no sandwiches, etc)

The downside is that parking is a small alley way or the street - don't even think about parking in Straub's lot unless you go in there to buy something (which I sometimes do if I don't feel like parallel parking!). They will cut you if you do! No really, once I got a note on my car when I parked around the side when I didn't go in. So just don't do it.

Good coffee.  But not great.  Just...decent.

I love the space...very bright, welcoming and modern.  The display of coffee-related items is intriguing; makes me wish I could afford to be fancy.  

Their pastry selection is small, but again, it's a coffee shop, not a restaurant.  I'll probably be back because it's near Barnes and Noble and I can just picture myself reading a recently purchased book here while I sip some mildly expensive coffee.

I love the Lincoln, but I'll only see a movie if it's playing in the main theater. The two theaters upstairs are very small and not sound proof. 

The main theater on the other hand is perfect. I love the seating. I love the aesthetics. I love when the organ player is here. I feel like I'm seeing a movie in an old playhouse. In my opinion, the Lincoln also has the best popcorn I. The metro east area! 

Make sure to join the rewards program for extra concession stand discounts.

My company had a private dining event here in their private room and everything was phenomenal - the drinks, service, food, and atmosphere! Parker was our server and he was the best. Great service and he gave the best recommendations!

Seafood tower: phenomenal seafood and very fresh variety - lobster, crab salad, oysters, poke 

Low country bbq shrimp: shrimp with toasted focaccia dipped in a creamy sauce. This was my favorite dish. The sauce was so flavorful and went so well with the shrimp and bread. 

Catch of the day: sea bass was cooked well with the pork belly and fingerling potatoes and the sauce was very flavorful 


Buttermilk cake: one of the highlight of the evening - butter milk cake with fig, mascarpone, earl grey fluff. Light and not too sweet. Great end to the night. 

Drinks were phenomenal - flavorful Craft cocktails. 
Flying High: my favorite. This is for the gin lovers. It's a nice purple color and light, kind of a floral lavender taste. 
Viper : very refreshing, strong cucumber taste with a hint of chili sprinkled on top but not too overbearing
Moment of clarity: great tequila /peach drink with a hint of eucalyptus.

My husband and I shared the shredded beef nachos yesterday while Fiesta Bowls was parked at Mastry's Brewing. They were super tasty and the perfect pairing with a few beers! 

I loved how the toppings were unlimited (with the exception of guacamole which is only $1 extra), so we loaded it up with everything. The chips were crispy and salty and the beef was so tender. For $8 the bowl of nachos was HUGE and more than enough for my husband and I to share. Nothing got soggy, but maybe that's because we scarfed it down in 5 seconds flat because it tasted so good! 

Some of the best nachos I've had in a while, and next time I'd love to try one of the tacos or rice bowls.

I love everything visual about this place. The building itself, the tables, The bar everything is just awesome. I really just wish the food was half as interesting. Not saying the food is bad I'm just saying for the money you can get much better food, atmosphere they have in spades but I feel like I've had most of the dishes they offer here over at Flamestone in Oldsmar. Not really a surprise since Chief Eric was the executive chef over there as well but seems a large step up in price point for the "same food". Now if you want a nice place to Wow visitors from out of town this would be a great place to start but again IMO the atmosphere and location will wow them more than the food. Oh and they brew their own beer, nothing I had on the beer menu really excited me. I think its great that they are trying but there's just so much better beer in Tampa.

Located directly across the Bird Refuge, Stella Mare's is this sort of shabby-chic--meets-a-greenhouse-meets-your-rich-aunt's-Santa-Barbara-living-room restaurant.

I got the grilled salmon club sandwich (with Canadian bacon, avocado, tomato, and a lemon horseradish aioli). It didn't blow my mind, but it was pretty tasty. The Tuesday & Sunday bistro menu sounds pretty enticing, and at $29 for a starter, entree, dessert, and a drink, it's a steal!

Warning: parking's a motherlover, and the place can be a bit awkward to locate.

Mmmm loved my bowl from BYB! The kids size was plenty for me and honestly I could have even split that. Wished there were more kids size bowl options, but not a big deal. They absolutely don't skimp on the fruit toppings here and the acai was really tasty, not too sweat. Overall I think this is a great acai bowl place!

Oh I love this place! Not pretentious, good food, and considerable amount. The ham is melt in your mouth and flavorful. I got the Mae's Omelette. It was good and the grits with lots of butter were very good. The biscuits were AWESOME, especially with some of the blueberry compote on them! 

Our friends got the pancakes, side of ham, and the breakfast special. No one was hungry afterwards. 

My only complaint was the small coffee was $2.75. I will gladly go back and just drink water.

Literally the best Mexican food I've ever had! The shrimp tacos are amazing and their rice is seriously delicious and my daughter even loves the cheese quesadilla and rice and she is so picky! We need one in Pittsburgh! Will definitely be back when we come to Philadelphia for my daughters doctors!!

Well, I can knock this one off my Reno Bucket List. Came in on a busy Saturday night and luckily, my friends thought enough ahead to call and make reservations for us.  We were seated immediately, so I had time to see the old school charm of this place in all its fake bunch of grape glory. But one cannot judge a restaurant on its decorations alone!  

I couldn't decide on what to order, so I opted for the combination meatballs and ravioli with spaghetti ($15). The marinara sauce was thick and salty and just a bit tart and oh so good.  This is not your off the shelf jarred sweet Ragu sauce. I didn't think I could finish it, but I did (sadly) and NO REGRETS.

We enjoyed people watching the bar (lots of regulars, it seems) and the mix of friends and family gathering. But the cutest thing was seeing a high school couple have dinner in all their prom finery, holding hands and being all lovey dovey.  Oh, young love!  If the parking lot is full, park across the street and don't get run over.

You all know Rosa J. loves her coffee.  The Nashville musician cousin recommended "Crema," out of many local coffee destinations.  

"Crema" is located near the Ascend Amphitheater, where the Tennessee Titans play.  When our group arrived at the Sunday morning at around 10am, this place was PACKED.  "Crema" has its own parking lot, beautifully-decorated outdoor patio, and comfortable indoor seating.  I was truly impressed by this wonderful piece of real estate and definitely looking forward to trying the coffee made by their in-house roasted beans.  

Since hubby and I were planning on getting back to Chicago as early as we could, we had our drinks to-go.  The staff seemed to know how to deal with the crowd; the team worked quite efficiently together.  One of the baristas was exclusively responsible for making the pour-over, while others shared other tasks to ensure all the orders were fulfilled in a timely fashion.  

By the way, they have an extensive pour-over menu.  Unfortunately I didn't think I had much time to wait for the coffee (10-15 min).  

I, therefore, opted for the iced Cuban, latte with sweetened condensed milk.  Unless you absolutely reject anything sweetened in a beverage, give this one a try because the sweetness was very subtle and sophisticated.  

Hubby, on the other hand, had the "coffee soda."  It essentially is carbonated coffee, mixed with Demerara sugar, and topped with orange peel.  I wouldn't say it was particularly tasty; it was rather interesting since it had an unexplainable "bitterness" when I had the first sip.  It was similar to drinking iced black coffee with a "punch."  

I could easily see why "Crema" is a popular hangout joint for the locals and visitors.  I also gave this place a high praise and hopefully will make it back at some point.

I don't know what took me so long to write a review! I absolutely love Urban Farmer, the atmosphere, service and food are all top notch. 

Obviously The Logan isn't the average hotel with crappy bars and bland menus. The Urban Farmer is above and beyond in every aspect.

I've been here on dates, business dinners and happy hour with friends. It's good for all occasions. Happy hour is solid, their menus are diverse and the servers make you feel welcome. 

I've definitely had the best steak of my life here (wagyu ribeye AND the dry aged ribeye) and I would suggest ordering a steak since it is mainly a farm to table steak house but I've also had the scallops and a fish dish which were excellent. 

The bill can add up easily since you need to order sides along with your steaks..I'd suggest the mushrooms everytime (ohhh the mushrooms are fantastic) really any of the sides compliment! Oh and don't forget they have an in-house cheese monger who is super knowledgable and very talented in the up-sell lol

We loved our visit. This is a cool gourmet butcher shop and eatery with bigtime sandwiches, charcuterie, and other specialties. House made pork rinds. 

Nice decor. Comfy bar seating and some tables. High quality meats. The charcuterie plate is served on wood and is gorgeous. Very Instragrammable and tasty.

Friendly peeps. Go whole hog.

I love the consistency found at Waffle House. This one is convenient to grab some food before or after getting off the plane at Nashville International Airport. Great service to be had here and the prices can't be beat. There are so many combinations of choices for breakfast. Go ahead and get the waffle - you know you want to!

My great friend Jonny recently told me that Monk's was recently rated the #3 bar in the country by Beer Advocate magazine. Having a bar THAT good in my city, is phenomenal. On top of that, the prices are such that Monk's is accessible to most people who are going out to eat. Monk's really is an excellent bar, so it's hard to find much wrong with it.

I must start with the beer. When I visited on 3/20, the tap list was pretty disappointing. There wasn't anything that was interesting that I had not already tried. I was with my good friend Quinn, and our server didn't tell us anything about the tap list at the back bar. The bottle list is quite extensive, so much so that I was a bit overwhelmed by it. Our server, Maggie, actually did a great job helping me find a beer that I wanted to try without seeming impatient or condescending. When people know a lot about beer, they sometimes seem to operate with an informational advantage. Monk's beer might seem expensive, but for what you are getting, everything is reasonable.

I'm not great at describing beers, but here's a short list. The beers I had were:
1) Aventinus wheat doppelbock - I have never had this, and I know it's a pretty standard and widely enjoyed beer. it was a bit malty, but still easy drinking. It went well with my food.
