2) Jolly Pumpkin Bam Beir - A light and slightly sour saison. It was really different than I was expecting from a saison. Decnet, but I wouldn't have it again.
3) Chimay Grand Reserve - Finished the night with a classic beer.

As expected, the fries at Monk's are bangin' (mussels and fries are Belgium's national dish). I continued my search for the most delicious burger in Philadelphia by ordering the Antwerp burger, beef with truffle cheese and shitaki mushrooms. While being an excellent burger, it's not the best in the city (but is not too far off either), nor the best item on the menu. If you like cultural dining, or seafood, the mussels are the way to go. I've had them before, and with the right sauce, you have a near perfect meal.

Monk's does not accept reservations and get extremely crowded. Quinn and I didn't have to wait for a table, but after we finished our food there was an hour wait. We sat at our table for almost an hour just drinking and didn't recieve any pressure to hurry up or move to the bar. I love that. The atmosphere at Monk's cosy and inviting, especially in the front room.  Lastly, the music selection was awesome all night.  I was jamming.

Overall, Monk's is great. It might not be my favorite bar ever, but I'm glad to have it in my city. Each day I realize a little bit more how beer-rich Philadelphia is.

Came here on the insistence of my sister. The first time I came around 7/7:30pm on a Friday and there was already a wait, so I headed to Shake Shack instead. The next day I knew to get there early and immediately snagged a seat for 1 around 6pm.

Of course, I had to get the tuna dumplings. I've never eaten THAT much tuna with THAT much avocado, but man it was good. I loved the spicy kick of the volcano roll, but wasn't that impressed by the yellow dragon roll (eel with mango).

It was cool to sit at the bar and have them make the sushi right in front of you, but you can't see much due to all the things in the way blocking the view. They also took a really long time to get me a cup of water, which was a bit frustrating. But for the food, there was really fast service and I'd come back for those dumplings.

I love this Capital Grille! The service is always outstanding, the food is always delicious. My usual favorites are always done well here, and I really miss living in Philadelphia because the Pittsburgh location isn't nearly as fantastic. Ah well.

I always have to get a stoli doli when I come here. Think house-infused pineapple vodka with fresh pineapple. Yum!! This is CG's signature cocktail, and it is really quite memorable.

I love the spinach salad as the hot bacon dressing is simply divine. I am a filet girl, but will branch out at times and try different rubs. The porcini and kona rubs are my favorites. 

The lobster mac and cheese is absolutely out of this world, so I try my best to stay away from it. Though it is heavy due to the cream, the cream does not overpower the sweetness of the lobster. 

The coconut cream pie is one of my favorite desserts anywhere, and the creme brulee is also a go to.

I love both Well Coffeehouse locations, but I think I like the downtown spot a tad better. More spaces to sit and stronger wifi. 

I got a cold brew and went to work on my laptop. The cold brew was good, but tasted watered down like it was maybe a day or two old? They do offer a handful of food options and those festive holiday focused drinks right now! 

This venue is great for working, but it does get loud in here with all the conversations and the in-house music. Need silence, They have a sound proof working booth with a stool and laptop shelf if you need to hop on the phone. I wanted to try it, but it was occupied during my visit. 

The parking here is awesome! There's a huge garage    right behind the venue with a ton of free parking with an on duty security guard.

I can not comploment this company enough. I love them! I still go to them for regualr maintenance like oil changes, etc. I also go to the dealership every now and then to get routine check ups.

Recently, the dealership told me my car needed a repair that was going to cost in the 4 digits. It was normal wear and tear. I thought there is no way it should cost that much! The part itself was nearly $200. So I took the car back to GT and they quoted so much  less than the dealership. 

Guess where I'm going to get the work done? GT automotive!

I could eat one of these salads every few days. Crushed Red makes me want to make better salads at home.  The salads are the shining star at Crushed Red.  Flatbreads could be better.  

Ordering at Crushed Red takes work.  First flatbread orders are taken if you are getting one. After you place a flatbread order you walk to the salad station.  The mini salad is a lot more filling than it looks.  If you are getting a flatbread, appetizer, or soup...only get a mini salad.  If you are eating the salad as your meal, go for the regular.  The salad choppers will build you a salad of your dreams...just tell them what you want.  I always ask for my dressing on the side.  I love ordering the Create Your Own Salad which comes with four toppings.    

Then you go sit down...Parmsean Cheese?  Roasted Garlic?  Red Pepper Flakes?  Jump up and walk towards the front door.  You will see a small station with these items and small cups.

Super fast, ultra-casual.  Quality ingredients.  On-line ordering now available.

I love visiting Eckerts! Weather is spring summer or fall Eckerts has it all! I have been to Akers for strawberry picking blackberry picking, peach picking, apple picking, and pumpkin picking. I love the family atmosphere of Eckerts because there is so much to do when you visit the main location in Belleville. The remodel that they have done over the last decade is phenomenal and it truly is a destination place! When you visit you not only have to do pick your own picking and take a ride on the tractor pool wagons but you also need to visit the country store, A well-stocked grocery store with a full bakery a great deli counter, wines and ciders, jams, jellies, salsas, and chowchow, and of course all of the fresh produce that Eckert's has to offer.
They also have great country inspired gifts and souvenirs and they also have a garden area as well. Within the country store area they also have a full demo kitchen for demonstration and cooking classes although I don't think they are doing too much of that during the pandemic. You also have to visit the restaurant which is a local version of aCracker Barrel. They have a great static menu as well as rotating seasonal drinks and food specials throughout the year. I love the fried biscuits and apple butter they serve at the table with every meal, and make sure you try their seasonal sweet teas and lemonades. During the peak of their picking seasons they usually have family friendly events on the weekends for kids like carnival rides petting zoo etc. In the summer and early fall they also have their custard shop open, so you can enjoy a scoop of house churned custard while enjoying the views.

I've been to Absolutli Goosed a few times before for apps and drinks but today Yelp's School of Booze drug me through the door.

It was a great time with fellow Elites and Robin our personal mixologist and owner of AG.  We experimented with 3 delicious drinks; Elite Status (in honor of the Elites) which was a lightly sweet, citrusy mix consisting of Gin & Moscato.  Second we concocted The Kentucky Hug (my fav) and I'm not even a Bourbon fan but this was superb!  I love Merlot mixing fresh Cherries, Simle Syrup and Bourbon made this drink similar to an adult Capri Sun (less sugary though) .  Lastly, we sipped a traditional Sangria.  Delicious but more of a heavy taste with Dry Red Wine, Ginger Ale and Brandy.

This was a great afternoon lesson; can't wait to get Goosed again.

What a fun little cafe! I was meeting a friend for brunch on a Saturday morning and this is the spot we settled on. 

Our server was great, fun and friendly. I had the eggs florentine and bourbon milk punch. Super yummy and so filling. I didn't need to eat again for hours. 

Love the decor and that they have a full bar. Great spot!

A group of 6 of us went here for the Champagne brunch prior to boating. The brunch was $17.95/pp and included 2 mimosas and coffee or tea. There was a decent spread of options for brunch. I had the eggs benedict which was okay, but not great, due to the fact that it had been sitting under the warmer for a while. I also had grilled potatoes that were good, waffle and seafood mac & cheese - just okay, but another member of my party loved it. Others had the omelets made fresh, biscuits and gravy and the smoked salmon. Was told it was the best smoked salmon ever. They had a small dessert bar with a chocolate fountain that you could dip strawberries, marshmallows or rice krispie treats in.  Even though our server didn't have to bring us food, I felt he was a bit slow at clearing away our dirty plates.  Overall pretty good and a nice little place for decent brunch if you're in Ruskin but I wouldn't drive back over from St. Pete just for brunch.

Mass Ave. Video I heart you!

Not that I miss your videos or your late fees. But I miss the people that you can see in that place. I miss the nice owner at the counter who always has something good for you to rent that turns out to be very very strange.

I miss your gigantious gay porn selection in the basement, not because I like gay porn as much as I love watching all the interesting characters heading down the stairs of sin!

My sister and I wandered over to Falls Taproom for an after dinner drink on Friday night. The downstairs bar was packed but we grabbed two newly opened seats at the bar upstairs. I love the dark wood and old timey light bulbs. Didn't really love/understand the TVs with black and white movies, which were on silent. I say sports or nothing! 

The cocktail menu is interesting and I was immediately drawn to the hot apple cider with rum. My sister opted for another boozy concoction but she switched over to the apple cider for her second round. I loved the cracked clove on top; it made the drink very fragrant. This is the perfect beverage for a chilly fall night. 

Our bartender was nice and we enjoyed chatting with him. We're already talking about our next visit!

First time at PDQ... was hoping for a bit more. Ordered a Classic Crispy Salad with Bleu Cheese dressing, and a order of tenders since I wanted to try them. Asked for two sauces, the creamy garlic and the buffalo bleu.

What I got was the salad as ordered, the tenders, and three tubs of Bleu Cheese dressing. No big deal.. I like bleu cheese dressing. And yes... I could have gotten up and wandered over to the counter, and asked for the other sauces... and I am sure they would have been happy to give me some. But I didn't...

Salad was ok... crispy tenders in the salad were ok. Dressing was ok.  Tenders were ok. 

I would eat here again... although if a slightly less healthy fried chicken competitor was closer... I would probably eat there instead.

One thing I did love was the Cheerwine Cherry soda they have.. that was GOOD!

Staff was friendly. Location was clean. A bit noisy, but that was the other diners... so not unexpected.

Ok... not spectacular... 3 stars

The new chef, Paola, is AMAZING. Her cooking brings life to this restaurant. Prices are a bit high and the decor is a little dated, but the food is great and the portions are huge! I loved the Calamari Fritti!! The male staff dresses okay but I have a problem with the females wearing workout clothes to work....

5 Stars for the Shrimp Pad Thai alone.  This is easily one of the best Pad Thai dishes I've had in AZ - the noodles are the perfect texture and sauced just right.  The tang of the sauce is excellent and they can adjust the heat levels for you.  There is a good amount of shrimp in the dish as well.  It is a massive portion - I cannot finish it and my husband ate some but there were still leftovers.

As the sister restaurant of my beloved Miss Saigon on Speedway, their pho is just as good.  This location offers a full bar, and they have a list of cocktails that are STRONG.  

I recommend this location if you want a full sit down, date type of ambiance.  They have full booths you can sit at and it doesn't feel quite as rushed as the Speedway location (people in and out so quickly, take out, etc).  

Service is typical - not horribly attentive but you aren't left stranded looking to get your waters refilled.

I always want to try more of their menu but get stuck on the pho and the pad thai.

So sorry, now at 3 stars!
This is my second experience where the service or lack thereof, ruined a lovely meal. I didn't review that other experience and think I should have. Our order on that visit was never put into the kitchen and so there we sat as all others around are promptly served with their meals. We were beyond patient and didn't want to be negative but it became absurd and then found out the waiter forgot our order????? This time, we were a party of three, it was about 1:30 pm, after enjoying a movie, we decided to walk across the street to Campo. There were two other people in the restaurant when we arrived. We ordered and waited. The meals were wonderful but the lack of service reached a new low. We are now the only people in the restaurant. We saw every chef as they walked past our table, lots of staff walked past our table but our waiter was pretty much gone. We needed to order our favorite Budino treat. A man, I assume was the manager on duty, came by, after seeing us peering out of our booth trying to get some help, we explained our waiter had not been seen in a long time and we wanted to order our Budino. He said not a problem, will take care of that for you. Perhaps a solid 15 mins later we are amazed, as no sign of the budino, no sign of the waiter. Now the budinos are premade so made no sense. Next our waiter does show up and asks if we would like a dessert. !!!!! We explained at this point we have waited 20 mins for a non appearing budino, so off he goes. Yes, he comes back with the treat, no apologies, just a big smile as if he has been amazing all this time. 
This is the second time service has been a huge issue. for no good reason. I shall think twice before going here again. Love their food but negative experiences such as this have consequences. Yes, they did charge me the $8.00 for that long awaited budino.

We loved the goodies here!  We always get our family to bring it to us when they come visit!  We had the following:

- Vietnamese Coffee - delicious and strong, a little too sweet for my liking though

- Fruit tart, almond tart, tiramisu, pineapple meringue, and cinnamon roll - everything was good except for the cinnamon roll, which was somewhat hard

We always enjoy our goodies here!

Ok, so I'm super sad to say I didn't get to go through the actual museum part and I am really bummed that I didn't.
The company I work for had an event there, and the food and drinks were mediocre but the VIEW. It was ridiculously amazing. As you're eating the stage in front of you backs up to full glass windows from the length of the floor to the ceiling and what is on the other side of the windows in clear view, the beautiful lit up batman building (ATT building).  It's gorgeous. Great cameo pics.  So let's discuss the food, it seemed to be all high ticket items, like steak and the normal nice steak house sides, potatoes, etc. Nothing tasted that great. It was really bland and it wasn't necessarily HOT coming to us straight out of the oven. I wasn't impressed.  The drinks, I stuck with wine and I feel like they tasted skimpy on the pour for the price and a touch watered-down. I know, how is that even possible?  I love that you can walk here while you're inside the OMNI hotel. Perfect!! The band that was playing was pretty good and they played a variety of music, which was another perk to the night.

My friend and I were wanting some seafood on our little trip to New orleans before our cruise so I searched YELP and came across this place. It was close to where we were staying and the reviews seemed to praise the food.

I can't say I hated it but I can't say I loved it either. The crab/cheese dip was really good as our appetizer. My entree of catfish was really bad though. It was fried in a flour type batter and some may love it this way but I was looking for more of a crunch and a more corn meal crust. It also tasted VERY muddy. Just seemed like it wasn't clean..yuck. The bread pudding is good but really it just tasted like a cinnamon roll. We did have a good waiter so that was a plus but all in all I would have to say that I wouldn't go back. I was dieing for some crab legs and they didnt have any =( Oh well, live and learn.

Okay, so if you've been to one sushi/asian food buffet, you've been to them all basically.  So I was bracing myself to be disappointed, but it was so much better than I expected!  I mean, the crepes aren't exactly straight from Paris or anything, but I thought it was awesome they even had a crepe station.  The sushi selection is really great, and even though I happened to go on the day their A/C wasn't working, the food was still really delicious, and I can't wait to go back!

Oh, and since I love tuna, I was a huge fan of their big bowl full of tuna so that I could eat a bunch of tuna without worrying about the rice it normally comes on.  yay!

First Review of the new year, this feels absolutely amazing. So here goes nothing. My MOTHER is in town everyone, my beautiful goddess of a vegetarian (technically (pescatarian)mother is in town. This is an important intro because Novio wanted to eat some sushi and mom loves sushi so we went straight to Sushi Maru.

Quick Pause, guys when you roll into this lil mini mall the sushi place looks like a laundromat from the outside so if you think you're going to a dingy lil asian place you are in the right spot. I was arguing from the moment Novio parked the car till we opened the restaurant door. Boy was I wrong about this place. The decoration is extremely chic and they treat you with a significant amount of respect. 

We were seated at a comfortable corner booth in front of the bar. Our server Kyler, gave us such great recommendations of food, but Novio and I could not keep our eyes off our neighboors plates. We were so ecstatic to find out they had a KOREAN SECTION. Additionally they have a weekday sushi happy hour from 5pm to 8pm ( the listed rolls are $10) and its a very inclusive list. 

Mom and fer ordered the st Patrick's roll and usf roll (in accordance to Kyle's recommendation). Fer and I then ordered the bimbimbap. Oh my gosh how delicious was everything that they gave us. The bimbimbap was enormous (there is a picture attacbed of this meal). We took enough food home for lunch and dinner. Oh and they have a button to call the server, don't do it cause I think it may give them an electric shock, which is probably why sevrice is so quick. 

Things to take away from this review: delicious KOREAN section, weekday sushi happy hower ($10 a roll), they shock their staff with electric buttons so service is really quick (I'm kidding they probably don't harm their staff) and they have a 2 for one happy hour with really cheap drink a as well.

First time sitting in the bar area..

We were able to get our favorite server/bartender Heather.

First time ordering off the lounge menu..

Calamari steak-totally delish.. loved the nice cream sauce-

Combo flatbread- pepperoni and olives very good- but I like my crust crispier..

Shrimp cocktail- yum yum!

Dessert- sundae.. totally worth it..

You can also sit at the dining area and ask for the lounge menu..

I feel bad that most of me tea reviews are super short but, when tea is good and the atmosphere is good it's all good :).  I am a huge fan of the strawberry fresh tea here it has climbed to my top 3 favorite teas and I get it extra sweet bc who doesn't love sugar!?!? Oh you don't? Ok well get it with no sugar !!! And unfollow me... just kidding!!! 
Seriously though the service here is top notch and the tea is always good.
100% recommend!

Love love love this place! Every part of our experience here was great. Starting with the staff that seated us quickly and timely for our reservation. The waitress was great she helped us pick from some of the best menu options. 

The food was amazing! I had the Mahi Mahi dinner with coconut rice. The fish was cooked perfect and the rice was soft and sweet which complimented the fish nicely. My friend had the steak frites with bone marrow on the side. She loved the dish and said the steak was cooked with the perfect medium center. Her boyfriend ordered a burger which was cooked perfect while mine ordered the pork chop that was both sweet and savory. 

This is a great place to go with a group or on a date night. They have indoor and outdoor seating (covered).

This is a must try if you live or are visiting Tampa.

I walked in here on a random Friday morning way too early to eat anything of substance, and magic happened. Or should I say Magica- because it was a Hispanic explosion of flavor in my mouth. I tried to go soft core with a chicken soup so early in the morning, but the bowl that emerged from the kitchen was anything BUT soft core. It took me a couple of tries to eat it after my visit, and it reminded me of Mom's. My man had a real breakfast and had a face-melting egg n chorizo sammich that I could only hope to attempt to eat that early in the morning. Can't wait to go back. Hate Puerto Rican food? That's ok, I wouldn't  pigeonhole this place as PR food anyway, you'll love it, or you're a Communist!

Food is bit more than OK.

The service is just excellent

Loved the tandoori chicken - 4.75/5
Saag Chicken - 3.5/5

Years ago when I worked in Maryland Farms, I came here all the time and thought it was fantastic. It's slipped a bit but still is about average for a restaurant like this. I love the fluffy rice. The gyro meat, hummus, and falafel were pretty good. The spanakopita was soggy, the pita bread was hard and crusty. The cucumber sauce was runny and obviously had been sitting in a cup for too long, because gunk had formed around the surface. Service was adequate.

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!

I have been going to Wawa my whole life (I used to live in Maryland). I love Wawa! Their coffee drinks can beat Starbucks any day, both on price and flavor. Their Sizzli sandwiches are so good. Baked things so good. Everything so good. 

If I could sum up this review in one word, it would be: GO.

I like Boca...I don't like everything I have eaten here, but what I do like, I LOVE. For instance, I wasn't crazy about their brunch menu on our midday Saturday visit, or their version of a Cuban sandwich, or the flavor of their french fries (probably my least favorite thing on the menu), but on their lunch menu,  I absolutely love their flat breads (every one I've tried...try the flatbread!!!), their OMG burger (it was tall, juicy, and very tasty) their fried green tomatoes, and the oysters Rockefeller. You can't go wrong with any of these...

This place boasts itself as farm to table eatery serving seasonal fresh, local ingredients in and a very cozy and comfortable atmosphere/environment.They have a wall of various lettuces/greens growing in the middle of the restaurant, and fresh herbs for center pieces on each table. I'd love to duplicate this in my kitchen at home!!

I have only been here for lunch so far, on three separate occasions, and each time I was greeted by a wonderful aroma (oh yeas, and host), seated quickly (never very busy on my visits), and waited on by pleasant and knowledgeable staff. The parking lot adjacent the building is very small (3-4 spaces?), but there is additional parking on the next block. My best recommendation for lunch would be to try one of their affordable $9.00 combos (half a flatbread and a soup or a salad).

We must have gone to this TJ's about 10 times during our weekend stay in Tucson. We were in an AirBnB in the Catalina Foothills, and made this our go-to for breakfasts and hiking snacks before heading out to Saguaro National Park. 

I've been in dozens of Trader Joe's' in my life, and this is easily one of the nicest. Great folks running the place, plenty of food in stock, and a airy, spacious layout so you're not constantly running into other shoppers. 

Parking is decent, but a little crowded, but the location of this store can't be beat. Love it!

Pagano's has the worst Cheesesteak in Philly! I don't know how it got such a great reputation. Why is it so awful you ask? Well let me break it down for you. They use a very cheap grade of meat and when they cook it, they chop it up so fine that it becomes pulverised till it's like the consistency of baby food. It's chopped and grilled to death! Pagno's gives you a lot of meat-which is what the budget-minded consumer loves, hence the reputation. But again it's a cheap grade of meat so I'm definitely not feeling it. Then they use a regular Amoroso roll! And any Philly sandwich aficionado will tell you that this roll will not stand up to a lot of cheap meat. The result is a sloppy, gooey, smelly hot mess. I ripped it, so skip it!

Fishtown's sorta out of the way, so I never really made it out there for any of the shows; until I saw Pissed Jeans was playing (amazing live).
I'm really glad I made the trek out there.
I showed up early so I sat at the bar for a while. They have a really nice selection of beers (but no PBR!) and food. The place is surprisingly big, with table seating towards the back. The bartenders were all really sweet and cute, too. Johnny Brenda's also has THE CLEANEST BAR BATHROOM I HAVE EVER PEED IN! So happy. Check out the jukebox, it will not disappoint. 

The venue upstairs was the absolute best. It's very cozy and intimate. The stage is just big enough to fit a 4 piece band and only stands about 3 feet high. There's another small bar upstairs with some very heavy handed bartenders so beware. The sound was phenomenal.  Everything sounded clean and perfect. I could actually hear the singer over the instruments. I went to bed that night without horrible ringing in my ears.
I usually avoid R5 shows nowadays since the average age of the crowd is 16, but this place has rekindled my love for live music.
Awesome place that lacks the douche-baggery that some other bars carry.
(But let's keep it that way, ok?)

My teenage son, who just happens to have special needs, would bowl every day if he could.  When I moved to Brownsburg, I was still taking him to the bowling alley we were used to on the West side of Indianapolis.  When my husband told me to save some driving time and check out the bowling alley in town, I was skeptical.  

It wasn't until we'd gone bowling two weekend nights with great success that we noticed the Monday bowling special.  Now, along with the occasional weekend night, we bowl almost every Monday.  

They have been very accommodating where my son's special needs are concerned and that means the world to this Mama.  When we bring our toddler grandson along, they accept our little corner of controlled chaos, always giving us a little space between our lane and the next one being used.  I'm sure the other patrons appreciate that as well.  But, if you need a non-crowded atmosphere, Monday is the day to go.  The two hour bowling special paired with a pizza and drink special is perfect for the budget conscientious.  We've tried a few other menu selections (I love the Chicken Tenders), but we always get a pizza while we're there. 

As I mentioned, the staff has been very accommodating and helpful where my son is concerned.  It took them a minute to appreciate him and heed our small requests, but now I would absolutely recommend Brownsburg Bowl to fellow parents of children with special needs.  

Although the tiny toddler size 7 bowling shoes make my heart swell from the cuteness, the adult shoes are a bit worn, uncomfortable and sometimes painful.  But, they do seem to have a huge selection of bowling balls in many different sizes. 

The weekend cosmic bowling is more expensive and more crowded, but a very good time with strobe lights and fun music.  

Bottom line, Brownsburg Bowl is a great place to spend time and have fun whether alone, with friends or with family.   Enjoy!
MMM Fresh juice! This place is fast and you can mix any juice you want. They juice it fresh! Love this place.

Green Goddess is a teensy bit hard to find, as it's tucked away in a quiet alley in the French Quarter that feels very removed from the carousing crowds. There's limited indoor seating and some outdoor tables, and the space is friendly with a hippie vibe --  this restaurant is imbued with lots of love and care, and the staff are all incredibly friendly and sweet.

I came here on a Sunday evening for a cleansing experience after a weekend of gluttonous meat eating, and Green Goddess gave me exactly what I needed. It's not fancy or pretentious food, and everything, I would say, has a pretty earthy vibe. Also, note to all you hardcore vegans out there, there is plenty of meat on this menu.

I got the beet hummus, the mushroom pate, and the freekeh salad. The first two came with a nice selection of crudites and crispy bread rounds, and the salad was nicely composed with greens, grains, and dressing. Everything had pretty good flavor and great texture, though I wouldn't necessarily say that it was super rich with flavor dimension, and I left feeling full and satisfied with just those three small plates. This is a great option if you have special dietary needs or if you just need a break from the heavier regional food styles around here.

What a great experience at this lovely Italian restaurant in Santa Barbara. It's a smaller quaint place with about a dozen or so tables. They have a wonderful wine selection of Italian and California wines. 

The menu is quite extensive with many specials offered and fresh fish and homemade pasta to choose from. They had a variety of antipasta and salad options, appetizers and main courses. The portions are fairly large and you can ask to split any meal also. 

Our server, Estaban, was very nice and pleasant and was very patient with us as we were taking some time to select our wine and food. We needed up opening up 3 bottles of wine before finding the one we liked and did split an entre- the ink squid risotto- which was amazingly delicious. 

I had the salmon special and couldn't finish it because it was a large portion, with mashed potatoes and asparagus. My husband had the veal scaloppini, which he enjoyed very much. We didn't have room for dessert, but saw a few go by our table and they looked delicious. 

From one Sicilian to another, it was a true authentic Italian restaurant - and we'll be back!  Thank you for an amazing experience!!

Came here the other day around dinner time and was greeted immediately while entering. The two waitresses were extremely nice and sat us down very quickly. My friend and I ordered the Mapo Tofu, chicken gizzards with pickled pepper and brown sugar jelly. The mapo tofu and chicken gizzards definitely had an authentic taste and I loved how it was actually spicy compared to other restaurants that sell the dish. Only con to this place is that the water tastes absolutely disgusting! I don't know if it's because it was sitting in a pitcher all day, but I noticed that it had weird flakes in the glass and tasted worse than tap water. Other than that, the food was pretty good. Definitely recommend the chicken gizzards with picked pepper!

I love Crazy Bowls! I have always gotten a Teriyaki Bowl and it is so yummy however this time I also tried a Buffalo Chicken Wrap! It was so worth it! I'm not sure which one I like more! 

I also enjoy their hibiscus tea! Yum!

Came here on a nice Sunday morning. Parked across street easily in a loading zone. Ordered two breakfast sammies and 2 rainbow bagels to go for the week. As well as a matcha latte. I won't say it was cheap but it was what you'd expect. It all cost about $30. The matcha latte was a treat, perfectly sweet and very very good and had oat milk. Loved it (I make my own at home but this was a special treat for me to pair with my rainbow bagel). I got my sandwich on a rainbow bagel as wel and loved it. So glad there's a place in philly that's From NYC that serves rainbow bagels. Wooo!! We didn't think the bagels and sammies were 10/10 but they were definitely very good and exciting to get. I liked this place more for a plain bagel with cream cheese honestly. But the Sammy was also fine just perhaps not worth the $8 plus tax. I loved their variety of spreads available. I'll be back for more rainbow bagels - which the cafe is currently donating $1 each of sales to philly  ASIAN queer org. I'm an Asian woman and really really love this and am very impressed bc everyone seems to forget that we are also people of color and a minority who deserve equality and respect. So that was also a plus. Thanks for the GREAT service and lovely food.

The IHOP on Carrollton never disappoints. The service is A1 and the food is hot and fresh. I love coming on Saturday. The restaurant is always clean and the turnover is great, so you're never waiting for more than 5 minutes.

Affordable and delicious. I have only been to The Old Spaghetti Factory twice, but I have been pleased each time. For under $15, I could have a salad, bread, huge serving of pasta and a dessert to top it off. I recently learned that they don't take reservations, which could be a blessing or a curse. In my most recent case, a friend and I wanted to go to dinner on Valentine's Day and we knew - for a fact - that most restaurants would be packed. Thankfully we were able to get into the Spaghetti Factory immediately. We chose to sit in the bar area upstairs, which turned out to be equally as nice as the regular seating below. 

I actually told me family today that this would be a great place for us to go - considering we're a family of six and no matter what, going out to eat is pricey. This way, we can have a good meal downtown and not feel like we broke the bank. 

My only downfall was the service. Everyone was super nice - so that's great. The issue was that they really didn't seem on top of their game. Some forgetfulness was observed, but hey - everyone's human. All in all, I really enjoy this place and let's be honest - who doesn't love pasta?

We arrived at Anderson Orchard and were greeted by a parking attendant. Parking was easy and convenient and free! We went to the playground which was nice and clean. Plenty of swings for the big kids and babies! The playground equipment was nice and well maintained. 

Plenty of photo ops w pumpkins and flowers. Very beautiful grounds. The hayride was fabulous- long and worth the $3. This was a weekend where the Fall Festival was going on and I was pleased with how cheap it was as they don't charge admission!(unlike other costly fall festivals we have been too). The staff was helpful and friendly!

We will definitely come here again! Great selection of cider, baked goods, and fresh produce in the market. Loved our adventure here today!

I wanted something Original, Local and Authentic. I found the Columbia Restaurant in Ybor city and insisted that we go for dinner. 

I love to cook and eat Latin food, so I really looked forward to trying it their way. They have in fact been open since 1905, with the recipes influenced by Cuban, Spanish, European, etc. I loved the stories behind the dishes in the menu. 

The Sangia is a must, the only question is which one to get. We went with the suggestion by our bartender and ordered the Red Sangria made from Imported wine, fruit and brandy. It's got a kick to it, but smooth enough to keep drinking. 

I was told by several people and saw in several reviews to try the 1905 salad. We ordered a side salad and split it. It was pretty big. The salad is pretty damn good and left us thinking why was it so damn good, was it the dressing or the olives, the cheese? I need the recipe. 

We ordered a Cubano to split, which was HUGE. It was very good and served with plantain chips. The bread was sweet, yet toasted and it was very filling.

We also ordered the Gambas Al Ajo which were these huge shrimp sautéed in garlic and chiles and served in a clay dish. This was served with fresh hot Cuban bread and butter. 

Although we only ordered a small salad, one sandwich and a tapa plate, we were stuffed. I loved the restaurant, the food, the service and would most definitely come back. 

Places like this need to stay around, so that newer generations can appreciate the Original, Local and Authentic food and establishments  that built Ybor City and Tampa Bay.

If you're as old as I am you know the movie Rocky.  If you're not as old as me you would know Rocky starred as that old main guy from the Expendables.  

Anyway one of the best parts of this classic movie is when Rocky is training and he ends up running up a large set of stairs and puts his hands up while a panoramic view of the Philadelphia skyline shows in the back with this inspirational music.

So this is the place made famous by Rocky who happens to have a statue just around the corner by the way... This is the Philadelphia Museum of Art and faces towards city hall along Ben Franklin Parkway and towards Logan Square.

You will always see people coming here and taking photos with their arms in the air and in case you didn't know why, now you know.  

This place is a wonderful place to get a photo of the skyline of Philadelphia also by the way and at the other end of this road that leads towards city hall is a JFK park where the "Love" sign is that is also good for a photo opportunity looking towards the museum.

WOW! My mom was not lying when she said these were the best donut she has ever had! Now I am in love these donuts. I didn't have the chance to go inside Duck Donuts I made my husband go in and grab two donuts since we were in a rush. He said the process was cool and there was so many to choose from. 

But I can say that I have walked passed duck donuts and it always smells like heaven!! My husband ordered the mint donut and lime. WOW WOW! they were so hot when I bit into it but it was so worth it. The donut itself was so taste and moist and melted in my mouth. I will definitely be back to get more! 

This location is also great there are so many restaurants around that this is a good place to grab dessert or even better breakfast.

I admit, I didn't participate in the ropes course.  However, the middle school kids loved it!  This was their second time here... first time was in the day, this time was in the dark on the lit up course.  No one had a negative thing to say.  We will definitely be back.  The staff was great.

My girlfriend and I were here for at least 2 1/2 hours, and I always appreciate when the server doesn't make you feel rushed. She was great.
It's in the heart of downtown Kirkwood and has a beautiful patio. Inside, their copper ceiling is gorgeous, even though it's the food that counts for me - and I wasn't disappointed. 
I got their house salad. Not very big, and it included some iceberg lettuce that I would have pitched, but the provel and their house dressing would have otherwise made it a 10.
The Italian bread probably comes from the Hill - loved it. 
Their desserts come from the Blue Owl. I got the carrot cake which was phenomenal (it's all about the icing!). But it was HUGE. It was too big... from a person who prefers generous-sized desserts. But if my sweet tooth can't finish it, it just seems wasteful.

Härth is a fine dining establishment on the ground floor of the new Hilton in Green Hills. It's where Crestmoor makes a sharp curve and becomes Cleghorn. There is complimentary valet and plenty of garage parking once you turn in the Hilton's circle drive. 
They just opened and it smells and feels new. The artwork in the lobby and restaurant is amazing! We were immediately seated upon entering the restaurant. Our server was excellent and we were given menus and waters to start off. 
I ordered the red fish with risotto and carrots and broccoli. My husband ordered the prime rib. Both of our meals were fabulous and the presentation was beautiful! Their chef is from Italy and makes everything from scratch! 
I love that Green Hills is getting more restaurant variety!! Please come check out this lovely place.

Unsurprising to anyone, Goldie is a great spot. I appreciate a falafel place with few choices, and the sandwiches come fully loaded unless you say otherwise -- when I don't feel like doing my own toppings combo, this is perfect.

As you probably figured out, Goldie is from the same people as Zahav, with great falafel/everything as a result. When you're ordering, there are only a few choices (plus a couple on an "off-menu" board, for a change of pace) -- for falafel sandwich, you choose the flavor of falafel (plain, harissa, amba, or shug, I tend to get harissa because I forget what the others are). Fries are a cool $3 but super tasty ... you can probably share an order (small bag) with someone if you're like me, but I can also clear a bag myself pretty easily.

Tahini shakes are so great but I have to have room for it -- so rich! In general though, I love that they're on the limited menu, and I love that coming to Goldie is uncomplicated. There're places to sit down and eat in (with a pretty nice atmosphere for a sandwich shop), and in the warmer season, it's great to pick up and walk to Rittenhouse with your food. Thanks for being so great Goldie!

"Oh my God, we're so happy for you!!"

This is what they said to us when we decided to order the December pie for dessert... and they genuinely meant it.  They were actually happy that our night was about to be made SO much better by ordering this pie.

In short, Love & Honey is true to their name.  Delicious food served with a lot of love, and some honey.

The fried chicken was outrageously good.  Crisp, well seasoned skin, and moist on the inside.  The cornbread was superb as well.  And the pie, well I already covered that but it was gone so fast that there was no time for a picture.

Best fried chicken in Philly hands down.
I went here today with a coworker we both got the chicken Sharma plate.  It was delicious.  I love the different spices in the chicken.  should add feta to the salad.  Will be back soon!

My husband and I went here tonight on a Friday night. We had a reservation for restaurant week  but came early for our reservation but they were able to seat us anyway. The service is top notch. My water glass did not get empty. We got the three course meal and started with burrata and fried artichokes. The fried artichokes were abundant and the burrata was soft and delicious. For the entree we got the fish of the day which was sword fish and I got the braised beef short rib. The fish was good but nothing compared to the short riv that was buttery soft and I didn't even need a knife to cut it. My husband wished he ordered the short rib as well. For dessert we got tiramisu and the flourless brownie. I loved the tiramisu, it was delicious and it came with a small biscotti with pistachios in it. The flourless brownie was more fudge like and if you like that kind of thing the  brownie was for you. Also it came with espresso gelato and it was very coffee tasting. If you like coffee, you'd definitely enjoy it. I'm not a coffee person but still enjoyed the tiramisu. Definitely would come again!

Drink: 5
Service: 5
Value: 5

Their signature coffees are great with lots of flavor and the right amount of sweetness to start your day off in a fun way. They had so many options for their signature options and all pretty much centering around chocolate. If you're a chocolate lover, you'll love this place since they have so many different combinations that make it fun to drink their coffee! I'm not a coffee drinker, but love it black if I ever drink so never get flavorings, but here it was GREAT! Do yourself a favor and make a stop here as opposed to the "easy" mainstream coffee locations and enjoy some local flavor and a great layout inside too if you need to get any work done. Also great music as a plus!

I've been going to Luna Salon for a long time now, Marti being the main reason. I'm a big believer in letting professionals do their thing and every time I give Marti the reigns, she produces a stylish cut. Also, if I get my bangs cut, she always mentions that I can get a free bang trim any time I need it- which is awesome!

I also love the B&B products sold here and even though they don't get a commission for sales of the products, Marti always lets me know which one will boost my hair on days I need it (like w/the thickening spray!). 

They're prices are steeper than I'm used to, but I usually go for a cut that will look okay growing out, so NBD. It's worth it!

I am obsessed. I have been a long and fiercely loyal member of that 'other' coffee spot...and I kept hearing about this place on Yelp, so I came by with my husband and not only did we LOVE our bagel breakfast sandwiches...more about those later...but, the iced coffee???? I thought I'd died and gone to Nicaraguan coffee bean field heaven. 

I started making up reasons to drive to that area, which, to be totally honest, I have ALWAYS avoided before because of the weird strip center in and out and the lack of parking. Well...let me tell you, I found a work around!  and it's a secret...so, SHHHH!!!! Go Kennedy to Lois, south one block to Cleveland and turn left, follow it ALMOST to the dreaded Dale Mabry but turn left on Roland and it's at the end of the road RIGHT BEFORE KENNEDY! There's a strip center on the right that has room to turn around and go back the same way, then you never have to deal with the Kennedy/Dale Mabry intersection! 

Like I said, it's a secret. Oh! And there's parking for Original Brooklyn Bagel back there, TOO!! 

Now...back to the coffee...yes, they have hot coffee, but the iced coffee is where it's at! They have COFFEE ICE CUBES!! Then, about 12 flavor pumps, then 3 types of iced coffee from flavored to medium to dark, THEN several flavors of cream!! Seriously. It's heaven. 

And the bagels are made as you watch. All different flavors and I'm typically an everything girl, but I've gotten hooked on-get this, Maple brown sugar!? Who'da thunk it?? 

The sandwiches are huge and super yummy!!! Gotta go-but, leave the back parking for me!!

My kids loved watching them make the product..From there it is a HUGE NO!


Waiting in line we kept getting dripped on....Look up to the the cieling and there is a huge bubble of water dripping onto customers.

Get to the counter....No "Hi!" just a blank stare...Having never been to a place like this before I wasn't sure what to do so I just said "May we have strawberry ice cream with chocolate chips." 

He explains strawberries are extra....OK, that's fine.

He explains chocolate chips are extra..OK, also fine...

"next"

The woman making the product was similar...No interaction. 

(Kids loved this part)

Checking out...No "thankyou" just "here is your total."

Seriously does everyone hate their job?

Husband and kiddos shared a "small." When did smalls become larges?
Husband said- this doesn't taste like anything
Kids said - its cold but doesn't taste very tasty.

Won't go back.

Most of the staff members here are cranky...I feel like I have to apologize after bothering them with my order. 
Coming from a girl who is perfectly content with Dunkin, I come here when I want to splurge and enjoy a very quality cup of coffee. Very rich and bold taste that I love. 

It's crowded on weekends and you have to come early if you want an everything bagel!! But still a nice place to study (when they aren't playing angsty grunge music too loudly).

I love this little Metairie, Louisiana pizza joint.  

I'm in town for a couple months on business, got some cold/stale Pizza Hut, some cold/stale Domino's, decided I'd branch out and gamble with a local spot, tried a few, nobody would deliver to me, found these people and haven't gone anywhere else since.  I've probably ordered from them a half-dozen times in three weeks.  

The pizza is good.  Like, really good in my opinion.  Damn tasty!  My girlfriend came to visit, we ordered it, and she loved it too.  I mean, we've had some of the best pizza in the country and I'm not saying it's on par with Pizzeria Bianco in Phoenix or Giordano's or any of the other Chicago joints or anything like that but, for this area, yeah . . . solid pizza.

And the delivery guy is FAST and very friendly.  Where Pizza Hut and Domino's took over an hour and brought me cold/stale pizza, this guy always brings it by super fast and the pizza is always hot.  

Oh, and they must appreciate the frequency in which I order because my last pizza came with some free cheesecake bites that were absolutely delicious.  (Or maybe there was a language barrier since they are Asian with thick accents and charged me for that dessert -- or maybe they just screwed up the order -- at any rate, I'm gonna assume it was a gift for being a repeat customer).  

I dig this place.  A solid four stars from me but I'll bump it to a 5 on this review to help raise their score.

I, too, was troubled by the pictures as somehow they didn't mesh with the fancy decor - especially considering the field workers made in a month...the cost of my meal.  

But being that I'm from SF and we have the projects/million-dollar dichotomy going on all over the place, I got over it.

Drinks were very good (loved the pama spritz & sangria).  The guac & chips is a must-order.  Mmmh.

Dinner was a mixed trio of ceviche, scallops and sea bass?  Plus a hefty pitcher of sangria.  The food was excellent - but to be quite honest, by the time we were seated, my palate was probably not as "refined".  I know I gobbled everything up.  The little round bread ball things are also very good.  

Service was good except they were over-attentive as in they kept trying to take my plate (politely, of course).  We were too stuffed for dessert  and I thanked my lucky stars for not tumbling, post-sangria, down the flight of stairs.

El Bar is a cool dive with plenty of endless possibilities. I mean what other bar out there lets you pick up a happy meal that includes 2 hot dogs, a PBR pounder, and a toy for 5 bucks?

The PBR and shot specials flow endlessly throughout this chill spot that lies under the El. But they also have a rotating Beer of the Month specials and a variety of drinks that go well above the average dive. 

But the best part of the El Bar is the eclectic offerings that you'll come across on any given night. Its small stage showcases plenty of random punk rock shows throughout the night. Foo Truck has started showing up on special nightly occasions giving you a chance to enjoy delicious yet healthy wraps and veggie offerings. With a table top Mrs. Pac Man, random arcade games, and ample -PINBALL ALERT- it provides some good drunken video game moments. And you'll find plenty of subtle perks like a decent happy hour, and a cool outdoor courtyard.

So when it comes down to it, El Bar is clearly a dive that gives you more to love!

I first tried this place five years ago and did not love my experience, but recently saw the great reviews and updated business name, so decided to try again.  I love that I could make my appointment online for the same day, and even pick what technician I wanted.

I made an appointment with Heather for both a pedicure and gel manicure.  When I arrived, I was told that someone else would do my pedicure, which turned out fine because while I was sat with Nancy at my toes, Heather started the gel removal process on my fingernails.

Heather was very friendly and chatty, and I could tell that she had a lot of regular clients in her salon, as she greeted many people by name.  Nancy did a great job on my toes, and I was pleased with the job Heather did on my nails.  Prices were comparable to other salons in the area, and I will definitely return here.

This is one of the po' boy and beer places I love. Unpretentious good food. The staff can be kind of grumpily, but honestly that's part of the charm. They have a pretty extensive menu, but Mother's for me is a po' boy spot. They are huge and fantastic. Their signature sandwiches are the ones with the "debris" which I think is that ity bity porky goodness. I can't remember which one, but the BF got one with ham, a couple other meats and the debris. It was lip smackin'! I almost always get a shrimp or oyster and shrimp po'boy, and this time was no exception. There's something about Mother's po'boy that just tastes better than any of the others I've had.  They have a host of sides, one of which is a boiled cabbage...it might not it sound it but I love it! I get it every time! 
The set-up of the restaurant is interesting because you wait in line, place your food and drink order- kind of like at a hospital cafeteria- but then you go sit down and waitresses bring you your food and refill your drinks. Because of this, they have a no tipping policy, which lets you choose if you want to tip or not. It's really kind of weird, but it's not a high paying job, so...please tip:)!

I only been in here once, and this was my first time!  From what I can tell, the restaurant has got to be something good, the patrons did not mind waiting for minutes to get a seat, not one of them that came to the door said forget it.  They all said I will wait, at least from my observation.

We had a bit of a wait as they only have 6 tables, but they do have two bars one being very small.  It is a small dining room also, but it almost makes you think of home.  The prices are right, the food is good.  

Don't be surprised if the people you sit next to decides to have a conversation with you.  There is a nice laid back older crowd that patronizes here, which is what I love!  The only thing about it is, they have limited space, so there is a need to get you serviced, fed and out the door as they have people waiting to come in.  If you could come in and eat and take your time socializing, you would never go home probably as you would want to stay and talk to all the interesting people.  I felt like you could get to know someone here, and make some friends.

I ordered the Farmers omelet, it looked great, nice appeal.  In addition to that I swapped out the toast for the pancake, they give you 1 pancake instead of the toast if you want it swapped.  The pancake looked nice, good appeal lightly golden, it was one of those soft buttermilk type pancakes a bit doughy to me but thin and good, not great!  I had hash browns...oh boy did those hash brown ever have eye appeal,  they looked just like the one I would want my hash browns to look always.  The only problem is, no tabasco sauce...I cannot do hash browns right without tabasco sauce.  They have hot sauce but you know that has more of a sour taste than a spicy hot taste, not what I am looking for on my hash browns.  I also had a cup of coffee, well I drink Starbucks it was not as strong as theirs but tasted good.

The Farmers omelet had a fresh, clean delicious flavor to it.  You could actually enjoy the eggs and taste the different components of the omelet.  No one thing simply overwhelmed the other, they all married together to make it a delicious omelet almost made me think it was healthy.  It was not a greasy omelet like most diners may serve, this had some love on it.

The hash browns taste were the same way, clean, fresh, delicious not greasy or artery clogging.  They were quite good, but could have been awesome...lol...with tabasco sauce!

The coffee was good, however, it was weak but good.  I am saying that because I drink my coffee on the strong side, with cream and sugar.  If you like it black this may be perfect for you!  

I enjoyed my breakfast overall and I plan to go back there for lunch and more.  This is a clean establishment and they take care of this place; it is small, however, that may be what makes it so special.

This is one of my favorite restaurants ever! Sister restaurant to the original Frenchy's, this restaurant is much bigger but still turns out the same delicious food. We usually come here when the wait for Frenchy's is too long .No visit for my family and I is complete without their mouth watering fish spread. It's so good that since trying it so many years ago for the first time, every fish spread I've ever had since then as been compared to Frenchy's. They have a full menu complete with chicken dishes and burgers for the non-seafood lovers but the seafood is really where it's at. My personal favorite is their original grouper sandwich, I can't even begin to describe how delicious it is. They also have daily specials on weekdays. Drinks here are really reasonable and made really well.  No trip to Clearwater Beach is complete without a visit to Frenchy's or one of their  other three restaurants on Clearwater Beach. Dont miss it, believe me, you'll thank me!

Today, I went to Love & Honey around 2:00pm. When we got there, all but 4 of the seats were taken, but everyone was eating. I ordered the chicken tenders with buttermilk ranch. My boyfriend ordered the half chicken with potato salad, as well as a slice of the lemon cream pie. After I sat down, I found out he also ordered the OG chicken sandwich to try. While we waited for our food, everyone else cleared out. Two women were leaving and asked if we wanted their side of pickles because they didn't eat them. We gladly took them, and tried those as well. The pickles were delicious! Sweet and sour at the same time.

Our food came out after about 10 minutes, and everything smelled delicious. The chicken was drizzled with honey, which I didn't realize would happen. The taste was amazing. Also, the buttermilk rank was so good. I ended up buying a side of the honey mustard as well, which is a little more mustardy than I prefer, but it was also yummy. We tried the OG sandwich, and it had a spicy slaw, which I wasn't expecting. I preferred the chicken tenders to the sandwich, but I think that's because the chicken is so good on its own! The potato salad was also delicious. It has a pickle relish in it, and it doesn't have onions (that we could taste), which was perfect for my boyfriend who doesn't like onions. The woman taking our order let us try to potato salad before ordering it, which was very helpful! We saved the half chicken to take home and eat for dinner, but we did eat the cornbread that came with it. It was dangerously good. The honey butter that came with it wasn't too sweet, so it had a perfect balance. Finally, the lemon cream pie was very good. The graham crust was crumbly, but held the pie together. 

We can't wait to go back in the future!

This is a wonderfully beautiful park along the Hillsborough River in Temple Terrace. Gorgeous. Cypress trees grow in the river and along the shore. There's a boat launch and wooden dock. Lovely areas of shade and a playground. There are also a lovely boardwalk path along the shore, tennis courts and a gazebo.

There is a cross commemorating the one erected by Spanish explorers in the area in the 1750s. A historical marker is nearby.

There was pink goop at the base of the cypress trees along the shore and I found out they are apple snail egg deposits. There were also muscovy ducks, ibis, and some other birds in the area including some pretty "friendly" one that I think must get fed..

This is a terrific Tampa gem and great place to escape and relax or go for a walk.

Sheesh. Ordered two large pizzas after reading all of the stellar reviews and man, the crust was terrible. Neither crispy nor chewy. Just dry, thickish, bready and tasteless. The sauce was characterless and the toppings were average. There is no art in this pie.

Clearly the Indy locals have a different standard of what constitutes *great* pizza. To my surprise, my sister and brother-in-law love this place as well as the WB pizza place on the same block. I don't understand it. Proximity, maybe? They live 3 blocks away.

(I also tried the WB pizza place and was even more disappointed. A dry, thickish, very bready and tasteless crust as well.)

The pictures say it all.

I have lived in Indy for almost 10 years and have never been to Sahm's Place.  I'm glad I finally did!  

I met friends there in the bar side.  They have a great tap beer selection.  I can't wait until the Oktoberfest beers are gone, so I can see what they put in their place.  
The decor was fresh and modern, pretty hip, actually.  
My favorite part was the Two Twenty-Two specials.  Small plates at $2.22 each!  I loved it.  I wasn't hungry, so I only had their slider of the day.  Yummy.  It was roast beef with carmelized onions and swiss.  Again, yummy.  

I'm told they make their own bread there, and I believe it!  

I am going back soon, probably on Wednesdays when they have $3.50 pint specials!

It's like a walk in the park! Literally.

Love the combination of nature, gardens, flora, cubism, modern, adventure and a lapse back in history. And if you, like me, cannot walk for the entire day, there's even a café or two(?) to sit down for a coffee and ice cream or just some people watching.

Came here in early fall and it was gorgeous! Almost felt like Alice in Wonderland.

Was not expecting the R-rated sculptures in some areas. There are warning signs, however, so watch out for those if you have kids.

My husband and I are Texans and Mexican food is a way of life here. So, when we got to Asheville for vacation we vowed "no mexican food." But...after a few drinks at Burial Brewing, tacos were exactly what we wanted, so we broke our vow for Bartaco. I am so glad we did.

I loved that everything was small and you needed to order multiple things to make a meal. I am one of those people who wants to try everything on the menu, so this makes me happy. 

The food was excellent. We had guac, tuna poke, a tuna taco, a fish taco, and spicy cucumber salad. Everything was so fresh and flavorful. I loved that you could sub out lettuce for the taco shell. I have no doubt that this place would survive here, even in an oversaturated taco market such as Austin, TX.

Also, the prices were so dang reasonable. We were fatigued from paying $50 a meal in downtown Asheville and got away for under $40 for more/better food. The atmosphere was great - we loved dining on the patio.

I wish we would have come earlier in our trip, because we definitely wanted to go back. You have something special, Bartaco!

Hello Yelpers.   Yes, it's me again.   So today I decided to take a late lunch to one of my favorite Mexican restaurants.  After my last experience I decided to give them another try.  Why?  Well, for those of you who read my reviews you know that cleanliness and customer service are VERY IMPORTANT to me.  Not only did I get an apology from the manager but I was given a 20.00 gift card to make up for the experience.   Now that us customer service! !!

So, first the customer service for today .   This place never seems to let me down.   The are always so friendly and welcoming.   Got to love it!

Now, the food.  I placed my order to go at 2:20 and I got my food at 2:28.  Not bad!!  The only thing that went wrong was that I ordered my chimmychunga on white and the put it on wheat.  No biggie.  Wheat is healther.  They did offer to make it over and for this I am grateful. 

Great job Tijuana  syaff!!  It is because of your genuine concern for your customers that I keep coming back.

On a mission to indulge the cravings... 

I haven't seen a Twistee Treat in a long while.  I love their soft ice cream. 
This time I tried the Pistachio yogurt on a cake cone.
As expected - totally deeeelish!

I love Fifendekel, this is a place to go for a lunch, to order some sandwiches or wraps for your meetings or for your parties or just to grab a coffee and pie.
They have a good selection of breads and topings.
You can choose between white bread, wheat, multi-grain, rye or sunflower - btw this is my favorite one, the bread is fresh, the flavor is perfect and every bite invite you to another one ^_^ 
Basic fillings are tomato, lettuce or sprouts and more. You can decide between: Turkey, roast beef, ham, black forest ham, chicken salad, egg salad, Montreal smoked, tuna salad or mix them if you prefer.
They offer also soups, salads, cookies and pies.
Fifendekel has a wide selection of goodies so pick your favorite one!

The service is always good, the girls at this location are really friendly and they have the patience to guide you through your sandwich adventure!
There is parking available but it's shared with other stores in that business area.
This place is packed between 11:45am to 12:30pm weekdays, so If you are on a rush try to get here early.

If you want to try their catering service, please keep in mind the following:
*Orders for delivery must be placed by 2:30 PM the weekday prior. 
*Delivery is only available when ordering from the catering menu, $5 delivery charge.

Loved the name, but wasn't too sure what to expect. 
 
 Ambiance - Lots of space on the inside and even some outside. The outside smelled really bad though bc it was right next to the trash. 
 
 Service - Efficient and friendly. You order at the counter and they bring the food to you. 
 
 Food - Philly cheesesteak was mediocre, but the wings were actually fairly decent. 
 
 Overall, not bad if you're looking for a quick bite, but food was mediocre and there are much better options out there.

Back again, and I still love this place.
I had the Korean wings again. They're awesome. Ate some in the restaurant, and brought the rest home for later. I ended up having them for lunch the next day, and they were still just as crispy and delicious as they were in the restaurant. That says a lot! Usually, leftover wings tend to get soggy and kind of unappetizing. Not these! They were just as good the next day! 
I also tried the spicy pork bulgogi this time around. Spicy at about a level 3, which is good. Not so spicy that you can't taste anything but heat, but not too mild, either. Delicious. It was basically a home run, as is everything that I've had here. 
The appetizers that they put out are delicious, too. The kimchi in this place is so good that we bought a half-pint container to take home with us.
I don't know if I mentioned it before, but the staff in this place is great. Friendly, attentive, and patient.
Dolsot House is a hidden gem. Try it, trust me!

For all you faithful Yelp friends who read my reviews, you know that I am a lover of high quality stationery, paper, pen and ink shops like this.  So like a moth to a flame, I was drawn into this beautiful shop in downtown New Orleans which also happens to be on one of my favorite streets in the French Quarter.

Let me start by saying that the owners are wonderful people.  This becomes almost immediately apparent upon entering.
They are welcoming, helpful and kind. 
Their store is irresistable and so lovely with eye-catching items everywhere you look.  There are beautiful writing implements, inks and ink wells, exquisite European stationery, wrapping papers, calligraphy sets, gorgeously bound journals and the like.

As I browsed around, I suddenly espied the sealing wax and seals.  Oh my.  Years ago when I was in junior high and high school in NYC, the ancient practice of affixing one's seal into a pool of colored wax on the outside of envelopes had been resurrected.
Seals and sealing wax were readily found in shops everywhere.
 
I still have my original initial seal that I used back then.  Nary an envelope left my hand for years without my seal across the flap.

The use of seals on letters and documents can be traced back to the Old Testament and I've always thought it a lovely way to close an envelope with a personal logo, totem or initial. 

Here, I found an array of Italian-made seals along with an assortment of richly colored waxes.  I fell hard once again.   
All things considered, given the things that I love and that interest me, I should have been born a few hundred years ago. 

Both the owners showed me some new sealing techniques which include using both wax and ink stamps.  I walked out with two new seals, an assortment of inks and quality wax sticks and I'm all set now to emblazon the envelopes on my soon to be written out Christmas cards and envelopes.   

If you're into beautiful pens and good inks as my husband is, this too is your place.
There is a wide variety from which to choose of both.
There are many things here that would make wonderful and unique gifts.

If you can't get to Royal Street in New Orleans any time soon, check out the website.
This is a small, local shop and any questions you might have I'm certain would be readily answered via phone call as well.

Stopping in this pretty shop can't help but remind us of the art and beauty of writing by hand and creating something lovely with quality materials.

One of my favorite breweries I've ever been to, and that's saying a lot considering I am NOT a fan of traditional IPA's! The atmosphere is cool and laid back, yet has a vintage and classy charm. The bartenders were very informative and friendly when it came to beer selection and recommendations. The beer was also quite delicious, I loved the Homestyle IPA and the coffee stout they were serving at the time. BIG fan!

I am confused and kind of horrified that this place doesn't have a solid 5 star rating.  Who doesn't like Cheekwood?!  This place is beautiful, the people working here are so sweet, and the exhibits are lovely.  What's not to love?!

I went here for the Chihuly glass exhibit in 2010 and have gone the past two years for the Scarecrow exhibits.  Local groups (middle school classes, non-profits, etc) make fun scarecrows and I make it my mission to find them all.  I missed the treehouse exhibit (to my eternal shame, really) but the Walden house was still up and it was so perfectly done that it made me madder that I missed the whole exhibit.  I saw their trains exhibit (more for the kiddies but they had to-scale landmarks from around Nashville around the tracks which were amaing in themselves).  The fall, to me, is the best time to come here, with the changes leaves, the mums, and the scarecrows.  It's fun to find them all, scattered around the gardens.  You can have a picnic here if you want, or enjoy their Pineapple Room.  This is a GREAT place to spend a Saturday taking pictures and walking around with friends.  Dress appropriately, because there are lots of hills (welcome to Nashville!) and it can get warm or cool depending on the day in October.  Spring is another good time to come, but fall is my favorite.

Weat comfy boots, bring your camera and a picnic basket, and explore this beautiful place.  And give it 5 starts because, come on, this place more than deserves all the accolades it gets!!  It's pure magic, an oasis of unspoiled beauty and art, and a real Nashville treasure.

Ok don't let the decor fool you into believing this is not a good restaurant...I was hesitant when I first walked in but glad we stayed. We had the bacon-wrapped jalapeño poppers and lunch special (half salad and mini pizza). The caprese salad was fresh and I loved the pizza. The crust was cracker thin and had a nice light flavor. The texture is very appealing. The service was excellent as well! To top it all off they offered a military discount which was much appreciated!

I'm not gonna lie; after reading all of the other (mostly bad) reviews about Poptions, I wasn't looking forward to my visit. Bad service? Mediocre popcorn? Did I mention that I'm not a huge popcorn fan to begin with? Gahh!!

But I had a Groupon that was about to expire, so I headed up on a Sunday afternoon to see what it was all about.

I walked in and was immediately greeted by a super friendly girl working the counter. Hmm, not bad. I took some time to study the menu and see what they had to offer. 

Wow -- they had a TON of varieties of popcorn! It was actually a bit overwhelming. The girl told me I could sample as much as I wanted. Nice. Not wanting to be greedy, I just asked for a sample of the gooey butter cake popcorn. It was deliciously sweet and really did taste like gooey butter cake! Yum. 

I went with the Over the Top popcorn (caramel popcorn topped with dark and white chocolate) and the specialty flavor of the day, which was some sort of praline popcorn (caramel popcorn mixed with sweet pralines and some other goodies that I don't remember!)

Two small-ish bags of the stuff came to about $15. Yeah. Not cheap at all. Thank God for my Groupon! :)

I paid for my order and received a 'frequent flyers' punch card; buy 10 bags of popcorn, get one free. Cool. I also received a coupon for a free scoop of Serendipity ice cream (yes, they serve that here as well!) with a $10 order. Next time! 

Anyway, I walked back to the car with my goodies and immediately opened the bags to sample my purchases. 

OH. MY. GOSH. This popcorn was absolutely amazing. And this is coming from someone who really isn't crazy about popcorn. The Over the Top popcorn was SO good. Like, eyes rolling in the back of your head good. I haven't felt that sort of ecstasy since...well, we won't get into that. But it was GOOD. And the praline popcorn was just as delicious. 

So after a few bites of each flavor, I knew I had to go back for more. Now. I rushed back into the store and ordered two more bags; this time, a bag of caramel and a bag of caramel cheddar mix. Both were amazing. 

And then I drove all the way to my grandmother's house to drop off all four bags of popcorn. Because if there's one person who knows their popcorn, it's her! 

She loved it. LOVED it. And she's now the proud owner of four decadent bags of specialty popcorn. Because there's NO WAY I would be able to control myself around that crack...err...popcorn. 

BOTTOM LINE -- This popcorn is amazing. The service was fine while I was there. Yes, it's expensive, but you shouldn't be eating this popcorn everyday, anyway. It's well worth the price, in my opinion. This is one of those 'once a year' treats. 

Go here. GO GO GO GO GO.

I'm officially obsessed. I joined this gym a few weeks ago after trying them out during Yelp's In It to Thin It. My old gym (Weston Fitness, see review update) had lost it's luster and began charging extra for my favourite class, so we parted ways after 2 years of having a really good thing going. It felt serious.

Anyways, I never think about Weston anymore because Unite has totally swept me off my feet. The class format keeps things moving and helps you challenge yourself in manageable increments. I'm still sore after every class and constantly looking for more time in my schedule where I can squeeze in another class here and there. I can't get enough. I've done classes with Bill and Juliet and they are both incredible. I always end up dripping sweat and I'm not much of a sweaty person so that really takes a lot of effort for me. They are positive and motivational and great teachers.

Can't speak to the locker facilities much because I always go home beforehand to change and then go back home afterward, but they have lockers available with locks so I don't have to schlep my padlock anymore. Love that.

alright, let me give it to you this way... i LOVE steak! i LOVE meat, in general. so i was totally looking forward to bob's steak house as it is known as one of the best steak joints in tucson. my personal opinion, it's definitely not the best steak i have ever had in my life. my hubby and i still talk about how disappointed we are. we paid the same as other high end steak houses yet left feeling just not satisfied. 

overall, staff were nice. very courteous! food came out at a great pace. would i come back? no, as i have personally had better flavorful steak in my lifetime. i am however very thankful that they allowed us to bring our daughter with us. they also allowed us to be seated earlier than our reservation.

ordered:
*Lobster tail-tasted a bit fishy to me. Definitely had an after taste after every bite. 
*Cream corn- not very sweet. There really wasn't much flavor to it. I felt like I needed to add something to it to give it that omph factor. 
*Sautéed mushrooms- huge mushroom pieces. 
*Kids chicken tenders- came with a drink a side. Which we got fruits. 
*crab cakes- fell apart very easily. Not the typical crab cake I've had in the past. This was the best tasting item I've tried here. 
*cote de beouf bone in 22oz-$55 made perfectly medium. Lacked in flavor. I ended up dipping it in ketchup to make it go down. a good piece of seasoned meat should not need me to add any additional flavoring to it.

Free bread- holy cow us this thing humongous! It's like where do I even begin! Now eating it would result in one of the following: it won't look cool anymore, guilt as I ate way too much bread, guilt I didn't finish it and now they're gonna toss it and I am being wasteful. Either way a lose lose situation for me. 

bob, you are definitely a solid 3 stars. thanks for your hospitality! 

Tips:
* free self parking. 
*reservations accepted. 
*cash and credit card accepted 
*they have high chairs. 
*they have kids menu.
*restroom is available.
*dimmed lighting.
*full bar is available. 
*located on the golf course.

My boyfriend took me here for birthday dinner when we were in town. We were both disappointed.

Our server was very lovely, but the food was just worth the cost. The ambience is pretty, but they played basic club music the whole time which does not match the decor. For food we both ordered fish and were told there was no"starch" left to make. On a Friday? No biggie, but both his trout and my grouper were bland and boring! Even the free dessert of almond cake they brought out was forgettable. There are much better places in Nashville, especially at this price point, so I'd skip here.

More like a 4.5. I had the steak and al pastor tacos, and they were very tasty. Particularly the chipotle sauce (I think that was the best part). It was delicious, and the tomatillo salsa on the side was good, too. I love the mercado (one of my favorite spots in Tucson) and the line for this place can definitely get long around meal times. I think it's best to try to catch this place sometime when it's a lil less crowded. Lots of outdoor seating in the courtyard!

This little hotel is divine. There are no big hotel chain rewards, but come here for an enjoyable getaway, or business trip stay over. Free valet parking. The furnishings are elegant and clean. The location cannot be beat with many choices of cool places to eat out. Fitness centre, free wine tasting from 5.30-6.30, and breakfast included. It's boutiquey and cute, I loved it.

I love this place.. I've been frequently stopping in 2-3x a week for lunch depending on whether or not I packed my own homemade lunch that morning.. I've tried a variety of things here so far.. from their wraps, salads, daily specials, and desserts

Salads: My favorites include the contents in their ying and yang salad *minus the noodles on top.. I really didnt like the texture of those* their vibe alive salad *minus the dressing I will sub that for something else.. since I really hate sweet dressings

Wraps: Their taco wrap is delicious and so are their rainbow wraps. 

Desserts: Their brownies are baked w/ applesauce.. super moist and delicious. Not traditionally sweet.. so they are my top favorite baked goods here.
