Their lemon bar w/ strawberry sauce was good although it was just a little too "flour-y" for me.. of course their coconut/mango/papaya pudding... my favorite

Smoothies/and drinks Their vanilly willy smoothie is my top favorite.. I substitute protein powder w/ dates though, and their vegan 8 is super delicious although sadly I finish that drink off way to quickly... 

Funky Munkey sub coconut milk w/ coffee = hyper monkey = =D =D =D 

Specials that vary: Their specials are what keep me on my toes, today their lentil loaf w/ spicy kale + brown rice pilaf was exceptional.. and so was their mango carrot chai smoothie .... sooo delicious and so filling, but in a good way. I can seriously eat bucketfuls of their sauteed spicy kale. I also liked the lasagna they offered sometime last week... 

I never ever feel weighed down after eating lunch from Urban Fresh. 
Thanks to Kathy and the staff here for always being so friendly, flexible and helping me make great healthy food choices in such a delicious easy way!

I love this place. There are some really cool displays in the store including a Gatling gun. They definitely have the cheapest gas in the Nashville area. I had one of their breakfast burritos and it was fantastic. However what impressed me the most was the caring attitudes of the employees that work here. While I was in the store a homeless man came into the store looking for food. I was expecting for them to kick him out. Instead they fed this man and got him a ride to a homeless shelter. Absolutely above and beyond. If you're in the area I 100% recommend giving theses guys your business. All politics aside this place really restored my faith in this country.

I came here with my family after graduation, and every single one of us was impressed with The Dandelion. My mom doesn't eat meat and my grandmother has an aversion to salty foods, and our waiter spent a couple minutes with each of them as he went over the menu and tried to find something that would fit their needs. Superb service! The food was also delicious. We started with some shareable items (think Olives and other small dishes) and they were well portioned and tasty. I'd also note that The Dandelion has a great drink menu and some worthwhile cocktails.

For meals, we varied from fish to steak to burgers. Everyone was satisfied with their food and my typically picky grandmother (who admittedly did send her first dish back) found something that she really enjoyed. After trying everything my family ordered, I'm convinced that you can't go wrong with any dish here. So my suggestion would be to chat with your waiter or waitress and work to figure out exactly what you're in the mood for. I'm sure you'll love what they bring out for you.

M is a lovely, unique restaurant with creative concepts and *almost there* execution.  

The duck prosciutto is a great example of what I mean by this.  A long strip of delicate, thinly-sliced duck was served alongside house-made hay butter, a raw, farm-fresh egg still in its shell, and a hot skillet.  Our server cracked the egg into the skillet tableside and told us to begin eating when we thought the egg was done.  Inventive and fun, +1 M.  The problem was, the skillet wasn't hot enough to cook the egg whites all the way through, and we were starving... so after about a minute of staring longingly at our appetizer, we just dipped our prosciutto into raw egg.  It was still flavorful, but probably not as good as it would have been if our egg had actually been cooked. 

Our main courses, the barramundi and short rib, were also plated beautifully, and were better executed than the appetizer and really enjoyable.  The short rib was the clear favorite - it was flavorful and rich without being fatty.  The barramundi was a little dry, but was helped tremendously by its accompaniments.

In terms of ambiance, head to M on a nice night and sit in the garden.  It was rainy the day we visited so we sat inside.  It was still nice, but a walk through the garden told us M has the potential to be something special.

We have a membership and go when we want to purchase specific items in bulk. Mainly use for water, frozen foods, green tea. For some items they are cheaper than the grocery store but for other items they can run a bit expensive. Also have gas at typically lower prices than gas stations but you have to have the membership to get gas. Store is always crowded especially on the weekend. Better to go in the early morning hours or later in the evening. Love the samples they offer around lunch time. Live that they have self check out as well. Comes in handy when you have a few items and runs quicker than the other lines. They also have a food court area where you can get pizza, hot dogs, soda etc cheap. So you can eat after working up the appetite while shopping.....or eat before you shop so that you don't over purchase stuff because you're hunger shopping.

Keep coming back for the food and not service. Not trying to sound negative but it seems like every time we come in service gets worse. A huge pet peeve is that if you come in at 11am for lunch they will cram you in the back corner with everyone who comes in instead of utilizing the entire restaurant. Today we were given a broken glass to drink out of that was extremely sharp and they did not offer to bring us a new one.  The last time I was given a piece of shrapnel in my sandwich. I love the food here I hope this gets reviewed by upper management.

One of my favorite places to shop at. 
Pricing: 4 stars 
Most of the items are priced reasonably for a south tampa boutique. However, some of their items shouldn't be priced as expensively, such as the tank tops and some of their jewelry. With that said, high end boutiques (like this one) in South Tampa come with a big price tag lol, so expect it!

Parking: 3 stars. small parking lot located behind the store. Very narrow parking spots! 

Employees: 5+ stars! They're the best. So sweet and helpful. They've always helped me put together outfits and make suggestions. Love 'em!

Bright, clean & fairly new Save On.

Save On has a couple perks that keep me popping in like Daryl's Deal of the Week - think high end loss leader and often an excellent cut of meat from the butcher block.

Another lovely thing about Save On is that they will give kiddos a free piece of fruit in lieu of the standard bakery cookie - love this!

They have an Save On Rewards cats for deals and points accumulation that thankfully the cashier can lookup with your phone number once registered (one less card to carry around and lose).

You need to know your price points when shopping here - there are deals to be had but many, many items are $1, $2, or even $3 more than what you find at Superstore. 

The washrooms at this location are located up front next to customer service - and I had to chuckle because the ladies was long like a bowling lane & there was a change table for wee ones :-)

Two thumbs up :-)

PS If you're on the hut for Halo Top, you'll find it here.

I do love this gym for being affordable and also catering to all the various worlds of fitness. Some days you want to lift like Arnold, other days you want to hit the heavy bag like Tyson. You can do that here. World's truly collide, with the power lifting curl bros, with their Beats by Dre headphones and muscle tanks, standing across the Crossfit bros, hitting deadlifts in yoga pants and Reebok trainers. Interesting sight to behold for agnostics like me that don't subscribe to one Bible of fitness.  My only issues are the overall cleanliness and the lack of space.  Again, this is a very affordable gym, but just remember, you get what you pay for.

I've only been for group meetings so the menu is prefixed . It's hard to gauge a place when you don't have a lot of say so I'm your selection but I really do like what I've had here so far. 
The atmosphere is hip and lively and they have private rooms for parties. The parking is a little confusing but after hours you can just park on the lot because the gate is left up . 

It's very similar to Ruth's Chris so if you like that you will love it here 

Service is top notch and for a large group efficient. 
I would like to try it as a private diner

Awesome space.  The food court area looks delicious and I wished we had not eaten breakfast before we came.

Even though the growing season is waning, there was still a lot to choose from.  I loved that artists, potters, and others wares.

Most of the vendors were under cover when we were there but I'm told at the height of the season that there are booths everywhere.

Been here for dinner twice with my boyfriend. Once in September and another thanksgiving weekend. Very  Impressed especially since it is a newly opened restaurant . I believe it opened August 2020, a month after COVID reopenings. Has a large covered  outdoors picnic style lunch benches area attached to restaurant.  There are also several side walk tables . The bar area is small and very limited indoor seating. They do not take reservations last I went in November.  The first time we went , put our names down on the waiting list and about 45 mins to 1 hr wait on a Saturday around 7:30.  

DRINKS:
 A big fan of their margarita cocktails, "mezcalita" and the seasonal cranberry one we had over Thanksgiving weekend. I don't like mezcal but you can sub tequila same price.  Their "mezcalita" is essentially a  mezcal spicy margarita - fresh lime, agave , fresh pineapple, jalapeño,  cilantro, tajin (10 dollars). I tried the " jungle cat"  because I saw a lot of people ordering it and loving it. It was well made but too sweet for me. I like cocktails more on the tart or sour side.  Our server no problem subbed it out for another mezcalita when I expressed I didn't like the sweetness. 

STARTERS:
So sad they no longer had street corn on the menu when we visited in November. Corn, a summer vegetable, so that's probably why it was no longer offered because there is nooo way that was not a  crowd favorite.  My boyfriend and I looove street corn and this was done just the way we love it--1. on the cobb, 2. charrrred, 3. Lots of mayo/ aoili  and cotija cheese!   Being that it's fall, crispy brussels probably took its place. Brussels  were really good because they were charrrred and  all crispy.  We almost always order the  brussels if it's on a menu. Nice to see a  crispy brussels dish without the the usual cheese and  cripy bacon/ pork toppings. I loved the acidity of the accoutrements of jicama, pickle red onions , apple and touch of sweetness with the agave. Fritto misto (15 dollars)- aka fried vegetables and shrimp. What a smart way to get someone to eat their vegetables! Fried avocado yum! But  as a starter for two for us , just a little heavy since we planned on getting another starter along  with our own mains.  2nd  visit  we ordered the Jerk octopus and it didn't come til after we mentioned to  our server we were still waiting for it. It came out  after  the Brussels and we were  staring our entrees . We could tell it was rushed/ forgotten. The jerk seasoning gave it a lot of flavor but it was a little fishy and not crispy enough. What looks like char in the pictures is  the jerk marinade.  This is the third time we attempted to order octopus at a restaurant  and made us realized maybe octopus is not for us.
 
MAINS:
Our two mains we both loved were whole fried snapper fish and the snapper a la plancha filet with saffron rice. The whole snapper fish fried to perfection without being greasy.  Had it back in September when they made it with charred corn. Has some different accompaniments now.  Love the portion size of the fish in both dishes. The 2nd time  we went the snapper a la plancha dish was  somewhat different . I added both pictures below. There was no ginger scallion sauce, which after trying it the 2nd time without sauce, we unanimously agreed it  was what made the dish wow!   We loved the first version much better, although this version is also good, a sauce is needed since everything is so "dry" -not in a bad way dry. It's just that crispy skin fish, fried rice with chorizo needs some more moisture than  the drops of  romesco verde sauce can give to these components. This time it also had no mint, or summer squash. Our sever explained that they used seasonal ingredients and the menu items sometimes will have variations based on season for sourcing ingredients. Which I can appreciate.  I was just so excited from the first time we got it I didn't even bother reading description to notice it had changed. One kink I usually find with newly opened restaurants is customer service. But Wild Child both occasions  exceeds my customer service expectations. Because I expressed that the dish was different than last time I ordered and didn't realize it was different this time around, my server offered us a complimentary desert.  On our November visit I tried the pan seared  scallop (32 dollars) which was an asian flavor profile. We both loved it, because we tend to also order seared  scallops often and we can't recall having it with Asian flavors.  This version had bok choy, roasted Japanese sweet potatoes, oyster mushrooms, pickled shiitake relish, sweet potatoe apple purree. Scallops were big and juicy,  browned and seared to perfection.

All in all I'm excited to come back and I have been raving about it since my first visit. Two amazing dining experiences solidifies this  as a 5 star restaurant for me!

This retro art themed lodge is truly an oasis in the desert! It was just happenstance that I was lucky enough to find this hotel as I was driving back to Vegas. This old motel lodge turned retro artsy chique, is surly a treat if your an art lover and have an appreciation for independent local artists. 

So, I found this gem off Expedia because I was looking for a spur-of-the-moment overnight stay as I was not looking forward to pulling into an uncomfortable rest area on my way back home. As you know they offer bargain deals on such sites, and indeed it was! Even so, their usual rates are pretty low due to the fact that the establishment is still a baby and just opened last October. So, if you're in the area take advantage of the low rates, now!

When I pulled in, I was surprised because this place matched my vibe! I really didn't want to leave even though I was there for only a few hours, lol. Murals are all around on the outside and when walking in you're greeted with an art gallery full of local art. I also did not expect to be treated so nicely because it was 3 AM--and yet, I certainly was :) The gentleman at the front desk (didn't catch his name) was friendly, attentive, informative of the amenities, and made sure to let me know when the FREE breakfast would be served! Inside it's set up like art gallery to which all the art on display is also for sale and supports the local arts community. It has a retro trendy vibe with a super-cute bar top where they serve craft local beer and wine. They don't have any food service as of yet, however, they offer a free complimentary oatmeal bar with all the healthy toppings your happy heart desires, to kickstart your day :)) There's also a quaint, little gift shop which offers trendy logo T's, blankets, coffee,  and some gorgeous, artsy goodies made by local artists such as poetry, coloring books and children's books. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor areas to socialize, play games, relax at the pool, and enjoy life! Your stay also includes a very clean, retro-chique room with a big flat-screen, natural, glorious-smelling body products from Pharmacopia, an extremely comfy bed and overall very pleasant atmosphere. It's also very quiet even though you're right by the freeway. The best part of it all, it's pet friendly-complete with doggie areas outside which you can use while you admire the 20+ murals painted throughout the property. And believe me, it's also so tidy you won't even notice the doggie zones until you see dogs walking around lol.

As for the service, from the management to the staff--it's absolutely excellent! They also give you a token for a free beverage at the bar, so I used mine and had a nice chat with the lovely Jesse, who's also a local artist with her art on display! Hotel tidbit: I asked her how the old renovated lodge received its name, and she informed me that it's named after a mountain range in California (I think). The service is great and on top of that, they seem happy to work there :D It certainly shows--I'd love to work there too! It's a happy, welcoming atmosphere and surely I'll be back...next time it'll just be to chill and enjoy a longer stay!

I've been here three times on my trips to Tennessee and it never disappoints! I love the trendy atmosphere. Sometimes this restaurant can get extremely crowded, so make a reservation or go for a late lunch! The service is always excellent and the waiters are knowledgeable on the menu. This time that I went, our waitress Sam was very attentive and made our dining experience pleasurable! The sushi always tastes fresh and unique. My favorite roll so far here is the Havana roll!! If you're not a sushi fan, I recommend the basil chicken or Mongolian beef! The only drawback to this restaurant is that it's extremely loud inside once it starts to fill up!

I'm so glad that I got to visit this place a few days ago when I was passing through town! At lunch time on a Tuesday I managed to find a meter just on the next block. 

Upon entering I discovered that you place your order at the counter and they call your number when it comes out. There were only a few people in front of me, so the pressure was on to figure out what I needed to try. Luckily the guy at the counter was super helpful. In the end I went for a Burnt Cheeseburger with a Duck Patty and added bacon and a side of half Sweet Tots half Waffle Fries. 

Burger - Going with the Duck Patty was a solid choice! It definitely had that rich, buttery flavor that duck should. And I thought the burnt cheese was unique and had a deliciously sharp flavor. The bacon was thick cut and the pickles were obviously house made and fresh. Honestly, I'd probably just get this burger again on my next visit!

Tots and Fries - The tots had a mild sweetness, but you really do need a dipping sauce for them. The waffle fries had the perfect crunch and would be great on their own, but I loved dipping them in ranch. 

I also appreciated that this place doesn't up-charge you for everything. No extra charge for the fancy patty and no extra charge for any sauces. This place is great!!

This is the go to place for breakfast when you don't feel like cooking. Always consistent and inexpensive. I would suggest you call your order in on weekends bc it can be fairly busy and there is limited room where you wait. Although I love the pancake platter, sometimes I just stop in for a corn muffin toasted with butter.. Yum!

Ceol is an awesome little Irish pub downtown that I love for their daily (yes, even Saturday and Sunday) happy hour, dart board, and good selection of Irish brews. You could convince me to come here almost any day of the year, except for St. Patrick's Day when all the bar amateurs come out in force. 

During happy hour they have free popcorn for snacking, really awesome trivia on Thursdays, and live music on Fridays and Saturdays with no cover. It's just generally a nice place to kick back with friendly folks while sipping on a frosty beverage (or one of their many whiskys).

If you're not ordering an Irish brew, I'd taste it first. I think because it doesn't turn around as fast as some of the others they sometimes get a little off-flavor (I'm look at you, Great Basin Icky). 

Bartenders are always nice and I've even seen a dog or two in here when it's slow.

Ok, I took off a star because it is so darned expensive! Fortunately they have a deal where you can get an appetizer/soup/salad, an entree, and a glass of wine for $35 which isn't bad for the quality of food and service.

It's a small restaurant with a bar on the right as you enter, fine linens with fresh flowers and an open kitchen which is quite rare in fine dining joints. Our server Valerie was attentive but not overbearing.  I dined with three friends and we all got the special. First we had the hot sourdough rolls which were yummy and I love real butter! Then I ordered the crab cakes (which were yummy crab without breading-see my picture) and fried mirliton-delicious! One friend ordered the chargrilled oysters which I tasted and it was yummy, and another friend ordered the scallops which she enjoyed. For my main dish I ordered the tenderloin which had blue cheese on top and had shredded beef underneath. It came with snow pea pods (I think) and a potato side.it was tasty! My friends ordered the flounder and they enjoyed it. But dessert was the best with a creamy creme brûlée with whipped cream and fresh strawberries on the side-amazing! And we so had the flourless chocolate cake with strawberries and cream on the side which was good. I don't remember what kind of red wine my friends ordered but they all enjoyed it. And I liked the Pinot Grigio that I ordered as well.

It was a lovely experience and we closed the place out where they had to turn on the lights to kick us out! Hehe

Happy Dining!

Are you the parent of a busy family and tired of pizza or takeout on soccer/cheer/chess etc club nights?   Then please keep reading... because this family owned and operated business is a lifesaver.   I love crock pot meals.   I hate prep, yet I need easy and homemade-ish dinners.   Enter What A Crock at long last.

This place has been on my radar since they opened, but it's a hike from my house.   I finally went online to browse their website and found out they have both shipping and pickup for online ordering.   We ended up trying one of the meal packages, which was the best value.    You can either shop a la carte for meals or buy a pre-selected assortment for a lower price.    

Our only minor quibble is that most of the beef entree contain a lot of baby carrots that do not freeze and cook well.   Very weird texture.   Otherwise absolutely no complaints.  The loaded soup was insanely good.   Sausages and peppers were delicious.   No prep and really friendly Customer service on the phone when my promo code didn't work.   Just make sure you have the extra freezer space!

Winnie's. This is our go-to brunch/lunch spot in the Manayunk area. The crowds are always huge, but the lines go quickly. The food has been delicious every time we've gone. I think we've visited about 3-4 times already and everything has been spot on. 

Huevos Rancheros: I ordered the Huevos Rancheros without the cheese and sour cream (since I'm dairy-free). There were no issues when it arrived. It came out on a layer of corn tortillas, eggs, homemade and delicious salsa, as well as guacamole and scallions. The flavors really blended well together. The salsa was fresh, not overly spicy. I'm not sure why I never think about putting guacamole on eggs when I make them at home. It could be put on everything.

The "Cure": If this doesn't cure your hangover, you're doing it wrong. Holy smokes, it looked glorious. It would also have given me the worst stomach ache from all the deliciousness but I'm sure it would be worth it. Included in the dish was ham, bacon, peppers, onions, home fries, Swiss cheese, scrambled eggs topped with biscuits and turkey chorizo gravy. This just looked like comfort. I didn't take a picture, but damn it looked it. There were a ton of fresh veggies in the dish that seemed to brighten it up. He also mentioned that the gravy wasn't super heavy.

The atmosphere: The décor at Winnie's makes it seem like it's been around forever. I loved the wooden beams and skylights that really brightened the place up. I also really enjoyed that we were seated very quickly. It was prime time for brunch on Sunday, in addition to being the Kentucky Derby AND Cinco de Mayo. All personnel was really kind and courteous, and hustling their tails off.

Homemade drinks and biscuits:  You can really tell that the chefs really care about every little detail. We ordered a Bloody Maries and it was definitely made fresh. It had a good amount of heat (lots of horseradish) and blended well. It came with a bacon garnish too. In addition to the homemade Bloody Mary, the table was served a mini basket of pieces of bread. The cornbread is by far the best, and I would love an entire basket full of it. The basket also included French baguette pieces and raisin bread.

With any wait staff, our waitress wasn't super attentive to our table. Although it was super crowded (Cinco de Mayo, Kentucky Derby, AND Sunday brunch), she didn't ask us how our food was. It was delicious. I had an empty glass of water for quite some time. It would have been nice to be refilled.

My favorite new eatery in downtown Indy! Solid service (thanks Alexis!!!), food is delightful while also a terrific value, decor is adorable, seating is comfortable & spacious for the location. Our dinner during the soft open was perfect! 

Menu has all the staples, I steered clear of the raw food because I was craving fried food but I'll report back. Tonight my girlfriend and I ordered clam chowder, fried oysters  & a power burrito with fries. Everything was simple and well executed! The fried oysters retained their flavor through a nice crispy batter & the "awesome sauce" complemented spectacularly. My girlfriend loved the chowdah, and we both found the power burrito to be healthy & satisfying. The fries are nicely seasoned and they come with some awesomely heavy ketchup.

Pro tip- ask for a table in the front for solid people watching & ask for extra awesome sauce!

I love this little boutique! There is always fun and funky merchandise as well as fashion forward styles! Love that she caters to all sizes! The owner is just the sweetest person with a real passion for what she does. I find that very refreshing in small business! Great customer service! Always a stop of mine on Mass Ave!

Baby Babbbbby....Yes  Ma'am....  Say Amen....Hallelujah!! Express yourself in any manner you want!!!! This place is Slap yo Momma delicious and I love my momma! Its served fresh and hot. The waffle is cooked to perfection and the chicken is flavorful! Its looks a little dark but I'm going to blame it on the grease but it doesn't affect the flavor. This hole in the wall joint is not to be overlooked.

My Order:
RyRy's Way
Southern Fried Chicken on a Belgian Waffle
w/Pecans and Sweet Cream Butter
Topped with Honey Maple Sriracha Syrup  
 
This is a marriage made in Heaven! It's not a place with frills and you will hear some explicit music but you listen to that in the car anyway!! 

 Service is good...you order at the counter and dine in or take out. It's not very big so don't bring a large group if you want to dine in. Price is very reasonable for the portion  you get...$8.99. I'm greedy and I ate it all but you could have left overs. 

Located in the University Corners Strip Plaza next to the Smoke Shop. Get up and Get Out before you miss out!

I like going to Costco because they carry things that are different than Sam's Club or GFS. What I don't like is that you find something you love and when you go back they no longer carry it. I also feel that the prices have gone up on the food items over time. Buying at a warehouse and in bulk should be cheaper, but it's not. Many things in meat and produce is cheaper at Meijer and at Kroger. I know many people rant and rave about Costco, but now that I've come to my senses and see It as a store to get my money and not a huge overwhelming place, reality has struck. We all pay a yearly fee to shop and really I don't save anything. Today for the first time, and I have been a plus member for years, I had a very rude cashier. She was literally throwing my purchases down the conveyor belt. Maybe she works a second job at a bowling alley?

Maybe I went here on an off day... I got a soy latte and it tasted like something I can't write on here... Super sweet girl behind the counter so that's why I'm giving 2 stars and not 1! I hope they get their stuff together... They seem to have created a lovely vibe in the place but that doesn't matter if the coffee is sub par.

You really do get what you pay for.  This was one of my 1-3 times a year "dip into my savings/swipe my credit card" splurge on food.  It really is as good as everyone makes it out to be.  

Plan ahead: make reservations and you must be properly dressed, otherwise you can only eat in the lounge.  They start with a tour of the kitchen and the wine cellar (impressive), in small groups at a time.  After that, they seat you.  

We started with the tuna tartar.  I know what you're thinking...why order raw fish at a steak house?  You do not understand, I actually cannot help it.  I absolutely LOVE tuna tartar.  So, whenever I see it on the menu I must always order it.  I was skeptical and wondering "what did I get myself into?"  As soon as I saw the dish, I knew that I had nothing to worry about.  The fish was fresh, the presentation/plating was nice, and most importantly it was really good.  

They also tossed the salad for use tableside before the steak came out.  I can't remember which cut of steak I ordered and their website is down right now, so I can't access their menu.  It was similar to a Filet Mignon; I think it was the Chateaubriand.  We each had a different cut of steak and wine to pair, based on the waiter's recommendation.  My steak was perfectly cooked (I like it medium), tender, and nicely seasoned.  They were also attentive the entire time.

After we finished our meal, we were led to the dessert room, which is located upstairs.  A new server came over and took care of us.  Dessert was also yummy; we had bread pudding and the special of the day, a seasonal dessert.  However, I was more impressed by dinner; although I loved the decor and ambience of the dessert room better.  Semi-private booths (wood planks that extended from floor to ceiling, against an exposed brick wall and formed somewhat of a half-circle) filled the dessert room floor.  There was also an old telephone device mounted to the wall of each booth. We were able to change the music and switch between 6 "stations/channels."  There was also a button to call for your server.  The room was more dimly lit than downstairs.  I uploaded a few pictures so you can see.  

All in all, great experience, but I can't afford to dine like this very often.

Had this location bookmarked and figured since had the kids with me in NOLA we'd give it a try... kids love pizza...

Found it easy on St. Charles, parking was a breeze, found street parking right in front of St. Charles Tavern... when we walked in about 6ish on a Saturday just a couple of people at the bar but we were the only diners..

Lotta pizza for the price.... me and the boy split a medium Meat Lovers and it was plenty for a 16 year old boy with me, the Dad, not having to worry if he was gonna plow through the whole thing.... the baby girl wanted to try white pizza and I was happy that any pizza was offered by the slice... she went with a white slice with bacon and fresh basil and really loved it...

However, in my humble opinion, the kids really loved the Garlic Bread with Red Gravy appetizer...I was lucky to get one piece of that garlic bread! 

Our waitress, didn't get her name but she has 2 6-shooters tattooed on her upper chest, was excellent, friendly and timely... plus the Leinenkugel Summer Shandy they were offering on tap hit the spot! 

All in all one helluva enjoyable stop and meal and brought it in for a damn reasonable price!

Definitely a refreshing take on Indian food for Indy, and lunch buffet with unlimited chai is a steal at $6.99. Temperature of buffet items should have been a bit hotter, spice levels for many foods could have been increased, and amount of fried items seemed exorbitant... But nonetheless we enjoyed our lunch a lot!

Spice Nation specializes in South Indian vegetarian foods, mostly featuring Tamilian foods. (The cooks are from the Indian state of Tamil Nadu). Foods we sampled in the lunch buffet and also brought to table upon request included oothappam, chapatti, idly, dosa, rice, dal tadka, rasam, sambhar, eggplant curry, kidney bean and chickpea curry, vada, pickles, various chutneys, curd, mushroom manchurian, vegetable korma, bitter gourd curry, vegetable fried rice, and naan. The server said the lunch buffet changes daily. 

Some vegetarian items I would have loved to see included on the buffet: papads, more dosas, samosas, parotas, poori, a paneer dish or 2, a bhindi/okra curry, mango lassi. 

Also, I'd love to see some Indian foods from other southern regions!! Keralan vegetarian options, Goan vegetarian foods and some Chettinad vegetarian choices  would be tasty. Spice Nation you can do it!!

The server told us that the Friday night dinner buffet has more South Indian foods, Saturday night they do Indo-Chinese foods (gobi and mushroom manchurian, etc), and Sunday they feature chaats (snacks) like bhel puri, panni puri, etc.

Service was great - we asked if we could skip naan and get chapati instead and the server went to check. Recommend SN for those who seek vegetarian and vegan Indian food not generally found in Indy's India Garden/Shalimar type restaurants.

I have not been to this location in awhile. I did decide to go here to pick up muffins the other day. I picked up 6 muffins and they were delicious. My favorite part of Perkins is their dessert. I always look forward to it! They have a lot of new flavors like birthday cake and a chocolate peanut butter muffin (they used to have a peanut butter muffin that was delicious but they got rid of it and now they have a similar chocolate version) . The staff is friendly and the restaurant is clean. It is always a little dark in the restaurant which makes is not very pleasant when dining in. However I love getting bakes goods to go and also have never had a problem while eating in. Overall a decent Perkins restaurant! 
I will update my review when I eat in again!

Mercato is an excellent dining establishment. The food is absolutely lovely and BYOB (no corking fee) really pushes it into 5 star territory. We started with bread and prociotto which was delicious and got us started with the wine we brought. My spouse and I each had appetizers for our meals (the burrata toast and panzanella salad) and we were not disappointed with the size of our meals, which left enough room for desert. 

Our friends got two pasta dishes that they really loved. They were smart and couldn't decide what to get so they split and shared the sausage and broccoli rab Campanella and the pyramid pasta. 

We finished the meal with the blueberry cheesecake and the pistachio cannoli. The cannoli was outstanding. Im a bit of a NY cheesecake purist and Mercato's had a little lemon in it so that one was a little bit of a miss for me flavorwise. Check out the pictures because everything looked amazing!!

5/5 stars will definitely be back for date night!

Another terrific experience at La Choza. Top notch service from Maribel who took excellent care of us. I had the Seco de Chivo, (goat stew) with sweet plantains, yucca and a salad. The goat was very tender and the gravy was savory. The yucca was perfect for sopping up the gravy. Husband had the Parillada Mexicana and loved it. Grilled shrimp, Mexican sausage, chicken and beef sautéed with tomatoes, onions, mushrooms and peppers. They kicked it up a notch for him and added jalapeños. They also had a live singer who was honestly, supremely talented. We were surprised at his pipes. We love the food, decor and the staff and now, the entertainment. Can't wait to go back.

Impressive. We went to the Taste of Seminole Heights walking tour this past weekend, and it began here. We've never been before, so we stopped inside to utilize our tickets for two beers. However after we ordered two beers the bartender advised us that the sample size beers or outside and then we would have to pay for our beers. We took one sip and we were fine with that deal. We found some other people that we knew and gave them our sample beer tickets. I had a Funky Kolsch Medina, and loved it. Light, crisp and perfect for a warm day filled with walking. Sitting at the bar it took me a little while to figure out what was actually going on inside of this shop, I guess I'm just a little slow sometimes. There were all of these blue bins and I thought that it was just some of the supplies that they were using to brew their beer. To me it was interesting that they would just sort of be out in the open. After I got about halfway through my beer, I realized that this wasn't just a brewery, it was a place that sold supplies for people who make homebrew and wine. I know absolutely nothing about brewing beer or making wine but that didn't stop me from walking around and taking a look at the wares. I've got to tell you that I wasn't really sure about what half of the stuff was, but it looked pretty cool. There were cheese cloths, corks, tubing, live yeast, dry yeast and hops for days. There was a guy in there with a buscarte and long list of supplies that he needed, and it was cool to see him stocking up. Like I said, I don't know anything about making beer, but what I can tell you is that I've never actually seen a place that offers supplies for people who want to brew. For me, that makes this place very unique.

After we completed the Taste of Seminole Heights tour, we came back into Southern Brewing and had two more beers before heading home.

Loved the place, loved the staff and will definitely be back.

I've lived in the Tampa Bay area for about 1.5 years now and have heard many great things about the Columbia Restaurant and it's rich history.  It's definitely somewhere that I wanted to try and we finally got the chance.  
We called around 6 pm on a Sunday evening and made a reservation for 8pm.  We were seated just a few minutes after we arrived.  

The artwork and decor is beautiful and shows so much history. I'd love to tour the restaurant and hear all the history of it. 
The service was slow - they were quick to bring us bread, but took forever to get our initial water and refills. Drink refills were just as slow.  Our bread was pretty much gone before the waiter came back to take our orders. He just wasn't too attentive.
The menu's are OVERWHELMING!!!  There is a wine menu that looks like a textbook, it even has a table of contents. I would've loved to have time to read through it and pick something out, but wow ---overwhelming! As I skimmed,  I did see a bottle for $1400.  I like my wine, but am just not that much of a connoisseur! There was also a "wine tour" menu, which listed about 8 wines specifically being sold this month.  
And the actual menu...not overly huge, but the descriptions are so lengthy and detailed, it was just a lot to take in. There were definitely a lot of options.  We ordered the beef tenderloins and the stuffed grouper, both were very good. My wife asked for the asparagus as her side instead of the mixed veggies and was told it would be a charge for an additional side, okay, no problem. She just didn't want the mushrooms that came with the mixed veggies.  When the food came out, she got mixed veggies (mushrooms and all) but no asparagus. Fortunately we weren't charged for them either. Everyone else in our party ordered some type of sea food dish, which they all seemed to enjoy.  We also had the deviled crab appetizer that I'd heard so much about. I wasn't a fan but everyone else in our party enjoyed them. As for drinks, the guys ordered Mojitos and the girls ordered wine. By the end of the night, we all were drinking Mojitos. They were probably some of the best Mojitos we've ever had, not too minty and not too sweet.  

A nice touch to our meal was that in the month of September, Columbia donates 5% of each bill to the local charity organization of your choice.  

Overall, we enjoyed our dinner and drinks. This is the type of place you have to try once, or maybe take visitors to for the cultural history.  I just don't see it being somewhere I would go to regularly.   
For an appetizer, dinner and drinks for two people you can expect your bill to be close to $100 - give or take $20 both ways.

Visited last night because I NEEDED mussels. I've been craving them for a very long time and I have tried multiple places around Indy and have not been satisfied. 
We had to wait a short time, which is totally understandable. They had some seating in the main entrance so we made ourselves comfortable. The seating is very close quarters. If you have anxiety about being in a small, louder space, I would recommend sitting outside. The service was amazing! One of the things that will turn me off of a place immediately is poor service. Our server Joe was very polite and quick, and moved efficiently. I didn't know what flavor of mussels to choose and he gave great suggestions and didn't rush us. 
  
I ordered the Provencal Moules Frites, which is 2 lbs. of Prince Edward Island mussels and a cone of pommes frites (or, to simplify, the best fries you've ever had), and a large slice of French bread. My boyfriend ordered the Duck Confit Mitraillette, which is a large French bread sandwich that is BURIED in the decadent pommes frites. I was full for the rest of the night. I was very pleased the portions, I often order mussels and wish there were more, but with this meal I was full at the end and struggled a little to finish! My boyfriend loved the duck, it was perfectly cooked and he loved it so much he opened the sandwich and ate it by itself! My boyfriend is a very critical individual with a chef for a father, so this speaks volumes of how well the duck is prepared here. You get sauces with your fries and I loved the mustard and aoili. Overall loved the restaurant. We will definitely be back!

I have been coming to the Reef for a few years now, I love being able to sit outside in the wonderful atmosphere that they have. It is only open during the warmer days. The Drinks are amazing, and the food is pretty good too sometimes it does take longer to arrive to your table.
The best thing about this place is the concerts! It does get pretty crowded and I do suggest getting there a little early for a table before the concert starts.

I love to pop into QT for their amazing drink fountain and ice- yes, seriously, they have the best ice ever!

Today's visit wasnt as much of a fun run. Driving home from book club my car popped up a low tire warning. QT offers free air for these situations. I stopped in, checked the tires and found the low one. Tried to fill it up...tried again....i was doing something wrong because it was getting lower.

I went inside and asked for help and a friendly employee came outside and helped me with it. We were able to get the tire aired back up (the problem was user error- me as the user lol). I really appreciated the help - but dont think ot was just a good day at QT, thos is the standard service their employees provide. Absolutely check out this QT if you are in the area!

I come here often as the cranberry wine is one of my favorites (I love sweet wine!). Come a little early and do the wine tasting then stay for a dinner. I tend to stick to the barbecue chopped salad as it never disappoints. Coopers is just one of my tried and true restaurants.

Top notch little spot on the west end of town when you're wanting to indulge in a little diner fayre. 

I'm a huge fan of their burgers (being a giant burger fan to begin with). Easily the best pound for pound patty you'll find in the city for taste and price. Compared to the chains it actually costs you less for their bog standard burger with fries than it will for a combo meal at one of the "big chains". 

They're also a friendly choice for the smaller members of the family. I love the fact they have a PB n J sandwich option on the menu (for those days when a 2 year old is being particularly picky).  

I'll definitely be coming back for more visits!

I ate here for the 1st time tonight with my family for dinner. It was at the recommendation of my friend Johnathan, who works at Dawsons. He told me I would like it...well my family LOVED it, even the kids were happy!
I wanna eat here all the time....thanks to the owner Tony for making our first visit a happy one!

Good beer and even better pierogies. Came here for Luncha Wrestling match where all proceeds go to Charity for The Valley Youth House on a Friday night at at 7:30pm and the place was packed but not so much you couldn't come up to the very large open bar and get a drink astonishingly quickly. 

Tried the 7.0% Saison which was pretty spot on and had the Love City Lager 4.0% which I highly recommend for a nice crisp larger with terrific flavor to the beer. The crowd was overwhelmingly hippie or punkish which I am not judging actually jealous as they are choosing their own path with no regrets bravo!

Food Truck serving up greek food right in front of the brewery as you walked up was specializing in Piergies which were hands down best Pierogies I have ever had. Tried ordering Golaki, a Polish Cabbage Roll, however they were sold out when I tried to get one a little after 9PM. As mentioned in many of the other yelp reviews if I am back in this area I would definitely go directly across the street and check out the scene at Roy-Pitz as well.

For not being a deli/sandwich kinda gal, Yosh's really has my heart. They're locally owned and you can tell in the quality of their food and the diversity of their menu and specials.

It's VERY hard for me to deviate from their phenomenal gobbler sandwich - with lingonberries - but I am never disappointed with any of their sandwiches or their house salad. 

Speaking of... that house salad.... YUM. A full salad is incredibly filling and it's filled with all of the goods. One of my favorites for sure! It's also nice to have their half salad and half sandwich combo, it's the perfect amount of delicious food and it's very filling. 

I love yosh's!

I can not get over how good this place is. 
Seriously, I am looking for any excuse to come back and I've already messaged about 6 of my friends saying we need to come here.

Never have I ever had Korean BBQ until I came to Dolsot House and I am so disappointed in myself for never trying it earlier. My girlfriend and I came here because we wanted to try something different. Not having any idea what to order or expect we asked our awesome server for advice. 

Here is the break down of what we got:

10 piece wings- 2 flavors, honey sesame and Diablo. Both so incredibly delicious and flavorful. 
wings were crispy yet juicy- it seemed as though it had a breading to them that was fried perfectly.

Chicken Bulgogi Dolsot (chicken rice bowl)- we ordered the spicy chicken but you can order BBQ. Interestingly, it comes out in a clay bowl?! (no idea if its clay but its a cool looking bowl) and its super hot and it continues to cook once it comes out so be careful you don't burn the rice- burnt rice is something I love so I let it get crispy. Loaded with veggies and flavor this was amazing!!! So good in so many ways. Full of flavor, meat, and veggies. Spice level 3 but I would go higher next time, maybe a 4 or even a 5.

L.A Kalbi (beef short ribs) SOOOOOO good! Perfectly grilled, juicy, and flavorful but not dry or anything. Thin pieces and lots of them. I loved this dish.

Over all- this was a great experience and exceeded any expectations I had for this place. 
I am beyond happy that we tried DH; I cant wait to come back. 
ENJOY!! OH its BYOB too!

I booked a private party at this studio as a birthday celebration and it was so much fun. Beverly, the studio manager, helped me to coordinate an afrobeat/hip dance class as the theme for the evening, and everything turned out great! Lehla, one of their dance instructors, taught the class and incorporated some zumba moves as well as some African popular and traditional dance steps. Plus, the music was poppin! They were able to incorporate my song requests too! 

It was a workout (and pretty much nonstop), but it looked like my friends enjoyed themselves, and of course, I loved it! The moves were a good balance of challenging and basic, and I really felt liked I burned calories. It was quite a lot for over an hour of class, and we got there a little late (parking, ugh), which wound up cutting off about 15 minutes of dance instruction. Even still, it was a full, high-intensity class. That said, my dance theme was customized. I don't know if anyone else is as crazy as me to do the same kind of dance for a party, but just a word of warning, if you do, that it was intense. It wasn't a situation where breaks weren't allowed though and the atmosphere was relaxed.

A tip to be sure to bring water. I unfortunately did not bring enough for me and my friends, and there was no access to any there. Also, the studio is one floor, and this location wasn't very large. We had about 8 people and it was a good amount of space for us to spread out, but I'm sure it'd be a wee bit tight for larger groups. We also brought a little spread of fruit, cheeses and drinks (you can bring wine or champagne). It worked out great. I would just make sure if you bring snacks for a party that they are compact, since there isn't much space. We used the studio close to closing time, which meant we had to pack all the food up quickly.

Although I lived in the Nashville area most of my life, I now visit on occasion for work. This was my first time at Firebirds, and I was happy with my experience. I had a salad and a side of fries (I love my potatoes). The salad was a very good portion and the fries were great. Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. 

I rate it a 4 because my colleagues chicken (the carnivore) was dry. 

I would go back.

Super Cucas is definitely the place to go for breakfast burritos now in Isla Vista since The Cantina closed down.

I really love how they put the right amount of potatoes in their breakfast burritos, it makes it delicious. I always go for the classic Cucas Burrito, or their California burrito which is pretty good too.

The people working here are really nice. They'll get your order right and you just get an overall warm-good vibe from them. I recommend this place to everyone!

What a cute spot! I'm a frequent Flying Cupcake visitor, so I had to give The Lemon Bar a try. I visited for lunch with a few girlfriends, and it was the perfect place to catch up with a mid-afternoon treat. I ordered the waffle of the week. Holy moly. So good. The waffle batter was perfectly golden, light and fluffy. It was a Croque Monsieur waffle sandwich and you better believe I ate every bite. We also indulged in cocktails because it was our first visit and why not. Usually I don't order cocktails at 3pm, but the uniquely crafted menu was too tempting to turn down. I loved the side salad with the house vinaigrette. We tried the fries, too. Not my favorite. They were more potato-y than crispy. 

The drinks were not very big, and cost $9+. Not sure I'll get one again, but it was fun to try. My friend got the $13 Red Velvet Elvis milkshake complete with vanilla vodka. Man. It is a meal in itself and is not for the faint of heart. I gave it a try, and it was delicious. I was satisfied with a regular ol' (giant) Red Velvet Elvis cupcake. I do have to say, I was disappointed the desserts were limited to the cupcakes, larger cake versions, and only 2 lemon bar options. I was expecting more. 

There's street parking, which can get tight during busy weekends in Zionsville, but we didn't have any trouble mid-afternoon. There's a giant patio when it's warm for additional seating and garage doors that open up to the outside. There is also a bigger room behind the dessert counter that I imagine would accommodate groups.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS BAKERY. I had an extreme urge for some gourmet cupcakes at 5 pm after a long day at work and of course everywhere around me was closed. That's when I stumbled upon this bakery that happened to be open til 8 and I couldn't be more thankful that the places around me closed early. 

I couldn't decide which cupcake to choose so I decided to try 3? I figured that made sense. I also decided to give a mini cheesecake a try because it all looked so good! 

My rating for every sweet I stuffed my face with would be 11/10. The chocolate on chocolate was perfect! Satisfied my chocolatey craving and was super moist. I enjoyed every bite! The carrot cake was very sweet and had the perfect consistency. Not to mention that the icing was the perfect amount of sweet. My favorite cupcake was the red velvet. I'm a sucker for a moist cupcake with some quality cream cheese icing. 

I didn't expect to like the cheesecake all that much because I'm not exactly a huge fan but I was pleasantly surprised. The best part was the crust. IT WAS CRUNCHY AND CHOCOLATEY AND HAD CHOCOLATE CHIPS INSIDE!! I took one bite and knew I was doomed to never enjoy cheesecake from anywhere else ever again.

Such a neat experience. I brought my mom here because she is an ice cream lover... she loved it so much, she ordered a second ice cream. My favorite was the Oreo the hero (cookies n cream). I enjoyed watching the process, but I find there are better options for ice cream. I also prefer soft serve, and I find this ice cream extremely hard (frozen).  

I don't know if I'll come back, but I'm glad I tried it out.

So glad I randomly found this place before leaving PA.  We needed something quick to take to go for breakfast.  I ordered via phone and requested the foyager sandwich which is eggs, kale, oyster mushrooms, cheese on a bun.  I asked for them to cut it in half and add ketchup since they didn't have any packets to go.  I got there and decided to get a latte while I waited.  I loved the interior of this restaurant.  Not a lot of seating but very quaint.  I loved that the kitchen was right there where we can see everything they're doing.  They cut the sandwich in half but no ketchup however I wasn't disappointed.  The sandwich was packed with flavor.  I absolutely loved the added touch of the oyster mushrooms!

This place is great with the care of our dogs. Love the strong cast of lady-vets. However, every single time I'm there, without fail, I will stand at the desk for 10-15 minutes before being waited on while approximately four employees mill about behind the desk and ignore. No "give me a second." no "we'll be right with you." They aren't all putting out emergency fires. We're just ignored. When they get around to acknowledging you, they are polite and nice. But you will wait. And with three dogs, and my mother's fluctuating strength due to various health concerns, this is irritating. Their next check-up is in August, so she can't even take the pups to the car before waiting her required 15 Minutes of Being Ignored after the visit is over. This is definitely an area that could use improvement.

I'll keep this quick:

- Lovely little location, with an adorable patio area that provides more seating than the inside.
- You order at the counter, they give you a number, and will serve you at your seat
- Beignets were delicious, better than Cafe DuMonde, but... I think they could've been a little fresher (sightly sunken / denser by the time they arrived; yet, seriously - still better than CDM)
- Cafe au lait was delicious!
- Egg sandwich on a croissant requires a fork/knife; was rather tasty, but not the best I've had.

I will return, however, since it's got more charm that the tourist trap that is CDM, more food options, and better ones at that. The location is fairly central in the quarter, making for a nice stroll down Royal when you're done.

With Sinatra playing in the background, we grabbed a table early on a busy Saturday night for a little New York tomato pie. 

An institution in the City, Grimaldi's now has outposts in 14 states...including the most unlikely states of Alabama, Kansas and Idaho!

Florida, however, has so many transplanted New Yorkers that you just knew the Tampa restaurant would know how to put a nice pie together...and that they did. 

After trying the Caprese Salad, we loaded an 18" traditional w/ pepperoni, Italian sausage, onions, 'shrooms, green peppers and extra red sauce.  It came out of the brick oven smokin'. 

A really good pie with great service and low key New York ambience (love that omnipresent Sinatra).  I'm going all the way with 5 bright ones.
We had some nice sushi here!  The vegetable tempura was excellent!  Nice, quiet atmosphere.  Loved the green tea ice cream!  I would definitely go back the next time I'm in Tucson.

We left the suburbs where we had a great Asian fusion restaurant that we loved where we could get Chinese, Japanese, and Thai food. We tried this restaurant today and we were mildly happy.

There was only one other person in the restaurant when we arrived, which I'm not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing... The waiters were attentive enough, but not the best servers. The food was pretty good.

I had egg drop soup, which was really delicious--the best egg drop I've had in a while. The crab Rangoon was really good, too, although their duck sauce was kind of weird and red, rather than the usual orange I'm used to. I was super excited to try the cheesesteak egg roll, but it was gross--the meat was gray and it had no cheese and no good flavor. I had the drunken noodles with chicken and it was pretty good and flavorful--the noodles were cooked well. The serving was huge and I took most of it home. My wife had sushi and said she enjoyed it.

The place could've put the air conditioner on some more, though! It wasn't a particularly hot day, but it was really warm in the restaurant, which made it pretty uncomfortable. 

All in all, we would eat their food again, but probably would get take out. The prices are reasonable as well.

During these Covid times, it's hard not to be disappointed with take out food. By the time it arrives on your kitchen table, food gets cold, crispy bits get sodden and the quality just goes downhill. 

But Croce's food stays consistent. Our stand by order has been the tomato pie and I have decided their Italian hoagie is deliciously meaty and tasty. I love the banana peppers adding another layer of flavor. 

You know it's good when every Saturday morning there is fresh crisp bread options and a line of Italian grandpas with $100 bills for a wedge of parm  that they ask to be freshly grated, loaves of ciabatta and multiple orders of lasagne and ravioli for their family dinners.

We were sidetracked here and it was a pleasant dinner.

Here's the thing.. I don't think (..and usually not at all but with that I digress *ba dum ching*) higher end restaurants should over power you with any odor.   An over powering smell of fish greeted me at the door and stayed for the whole meal.  
My husband says "But it's a steak and seafood restaurant."  Then why doesn't Red Lobster(hush you) stink of fish?  I know fast food joints usually smell like a fried vat of whatever they cook but for nice seating and the pretty view I expected more. I hope it was just bad ventilation for the night.

The food was good.

Appetizer:
We had calamari appetizer, big shock there, and it was good. The first time I think my husband enjoyed it more then I did.
Wine:
Glass of the  "Cabernet Sauvignon ~ Mike Shannon Private Label 2006 Napa" of which was very tasty.  

Main Course & Sides:
I had a 8 oz fillet, of which I enjoyed very much!
We split a side mushrooms and a side of macaroni and cheese.
Both were good.
My husband had the strip and loved it.

Dessert:
The desert was the yummy "Chocolate Dome."  


They are priced as an upscale steakhouse should be but I think that the price doesn't equate to the quality expected for what is spent.  Certainly worth giving it try but I would not expect it to be better then other steakhouses within the downtown area.
I really love the seating with the huge windows that do not leave you feeling exposed but rather opens up the dining experience.  Smartly built.

TLDR: You can not go wrong with the steak.  Overall it was good but nothing that will floor you.  
If strong odors bother you, maybe have a glass of wine at the bar to test the mettle of the place before you head to the dining area.

Amazing. Great wine diversity; literally something for everyone. I love CC as it has a great location and the staff is really personable. I've been a member here for years. If you want an oaky chard or a crisp pino, or anything in between- this is the place. Check it out and tell Randy hello!

I. Am. A. Fan. :) 

I stopped in here after a group of us got Dim Sum a couple doors down and ICE NY hit the spot. I ordered the Mango Sticky Rice flavor and fell in love. They even include to balls of warm sticky rice on top and the warm vs. cold in the cup created a harmonizing experience for my taste buds. I'm ordering it again if I come back. My friend ordered the Ube and enjoyed it just as much as I enjoyed mine. I didn't taste it but she gave it two thumbs up. Definitely try this place and check into yelp for $1 off your cup.

The museum is beyond fantastic. I can not add to the other reviews really. I loved it all especially Tony and the architect tour. Now, I am not going to mark it down any stars but I noted my suggestions.

The Audio tour is off and outdated. They should update the program and also consider automatic chip reading headsets.

Docent tours need a microphone or a boom box voice. I could not hear one thing our tour guy said.

The cafe was a disaster today. Nowhere to sit because it was raining. Did they not get the memo that this museum is in Florida? There was an extremely rude worker giving dirty looks to customers. I was shocked especially since all of the other workers in the museum were fantastic. I will admit the food is very good though if you can wait out the horrendous service.The food I got was not what I thought it would be from visiting Spain.I had the Pan Con Tomato but it was delicious.The Cafe Con leche is very good too.However, If you know you might have 2,000 guests visiting your Museum why do you only have 3 people working the very small Cafe? It was a 30 to 40 minute wait just to order. I'd consider eating someplace else if this is typical and not just an off day. There are lots of places nearby to eat after your tour. 

I might add the admission Price is on the high end of museums but worth it for sure. 2 dollar teacher discount.

Ok so I am undecided about a 2 star or 4 star. So I picked the middle. I decided on a 3 because I love the food and drinks they have. So if it wasn't for the amazing food and drinks I would not go back to this place. I have been here a few time and the last two times I have gone in, the wait staff has not been very good with customer service. One visit my friend ordered a pizza, she took one piece and realized the bottom was really burnt. So we called the waitress over and told her about it. The waitress lifts up the pizza, rolls her eyes, and takes the pizza away, without a single word said. Then Saturday myself and another friend go there. It's an hour wait at 8:00 at night, no big deal we wait, because the food and drinks are amazing. Well we asked for first seating and it's outside. Again, that's fine, it was a cold night, but we had jeans and sweaters on so it's fine. We get our food and our drinks. The waitress ask if we need anything else. I said no just go ahead and bring the check so we can pay and leave when we are done. Again, it's cold outside and we didn't want to wait for the check. The waitress astually laughs and says " Yeah, I'll bringing in a  little while" Umm what, excuse me. I want the check on my terms not yours. We never eat all the food and didn't want any more to drink so there was not reason not to bring the check when we asked. We are the customers!!! I will give Ella's another chance only because of the food and drinks. However, if the service it still as bad as it has been I will go to another place. There is plenty more placed popping up on Florida Ave a street over, and even on Nebraska Ave that is similar to Ella's. The things is I have raved about this place and introduce much of my friends and co-workers to Ella's. However, again if the service does not improve I will no longer mention Ella's.

This is a tough review to write, but it's necessary. 

I LOVE the food at Han Dynasty, and I'm usually dining at the Old City location, so when we were wandering through Manayunk looking for a lunch spot and saw Han Dynasty it was a no brainer.

We knew that we wanted dan dan noodles, and some Taiwanese sausage. My fiance and I wanted to split the order of dan dan  as an appetizer and my friend wanted her own as her entree. 

Since we were splitting the dan dan we finished our bowl and my friend didn't finish hers (it is a huge portion for one person). The waitress comes over and comments how I finished the entire bowl by saying, "oh wow. you finished all of that?" and I explained that we split it, but followed up with, "But it would be okay if I did finish the entire bowl" - because, it's not her business how much I eat, and you'd think that a business would be thrilled that a patron loved the meal that much. Anyway- it took me aback a bit.

My fiance and I get our entrees and we realized that we ordered WAY too much. The waitress comes over and says, "Oh wow. You finished?" So if we eat all of it, she says something...we don't eat enough (according to her) she says something. So we get the massive plate of food wrapped up to go along with a few other things and they arrive at the table in a tied plastic bag. We don't think anything of it and head back to center city. The next day we go to dig into our leftovers and the restaurant only gave us 1/4 pint of food- when we literally had a HUGE plate of lo mein that we took 2 bites of. So they must have been upset with us for not finishing it, or thought we didn't need all of our leftovers- whatever the reason- we were sent home with a VERY small amount of food compared to what we wanted wrapped up. Essentially they stole from us. We paid for the full amount and only received a small fraction of it to take home. 

Luckily we don't frequent Manayunk, so we won't be back to this location to deal with the judgmental service and spotty doggie bags.

Oh my goodness. Calypso, my one true love.

Hearty, satisfying, delicious, guilt-free food. I've had just about everything on the menu now and I love it all! Be sure to try their fruit tea while you're there. Service is super fast, and it's so dang inexpensive!

And if the weather's nice, I suggest getting it to go and taking a short walk over to Centennial.

Corsair, you have redeemed yourself.  After the strange/disappointing experience last year it took us while to give them another try, but we finally did, and they seem to have their act together now! Yay! (and the website typos are gone!)

We called ahead for a tour, showed up and there was an actual tour! Good start! We had a beer in the taproom while we waited, and were encouraged to bring the rest with us once everyone was ready.  Our tour guide wasn't some college kid or retired person who had memorized a script like some other distillery/brewery tours I've been on (ahem, Budweiser).  He was just having a conversation with us and telling us what we wanted to know about his beloved business.  We got some dirt on local competitors and some behind the scenes info on new creations, failed creations and things in the works.  Once the actual tour was over we moved to the tasting room where we got to sample way more booze than I've ever had on a tour, especially for the low price!  We also each got to choose a glass to take home. 

The place is still not marked on the outside of the building, so you have to know where you're going to find it, but overall a 100% improvement from the first unorganized experience!

Love, love, LOVE this place. Though I don't live in Nashville, I make sure to stop here at the Puffy Muffin every time I come back.  

They are super busy for lunch. Try an off time. And they don't seat incomplete parties.  This go round I came on my own and sat at the bar (perfect for a solo traveller/diner).  Many times I come here with my girlfriends and their kids for a girly brunch. But don't let their scare you. They are guy friendly too!

I'm mildly obsessed the their fruit tea. I usually ask for a "to go" cup. Some of my favorites are the quiche, chicken salad on roll, frozen fruit salad, hash brown/potato casserole, and tortilla soup. 

Be sure to save room for dessert. Or just stop by for a baked good. Look at their cakes too! They are beautiful! 

Check out the cute store Hot Pink next door. Great for gifts.

If you are looking for high quality traditional food served to perfection in a comfortable atmosphere, this is the place. If you are looking for cutting edge trendy minimalist food, you may want to go somewhere else.

We had dinner here the other night before going to a concert at Pioneer Center. What a wonderful experience it was. We created very cordially by the lovely young hostess and as it was earning in the evening, were given a choice of seats - by the bar, by the fire, by the kitchen. We chose by the kitchen in close proximity to the fire. 

The space is warm and inviting with brick walls and comfy chairs and benches. The "divided light" windows across the front of the building add to the charm and beauty of the space.

We decided not to go with the Feast. It was more food then we felt we could eat, but is a good deal since the $75 includes a full five course meal with drinks. 

We ordered off the menu. I started with the amazing Pumpkin Bisque soup. It was spicy and peppery and lusciously smooth and creamy. It was sprinkled with cinnamon which also provided a wonderful aroma to the dish.

For my main course, I had salmon over risotto with a dill caper pan sauce. It was perfection on a plate. The Salmon was moist and flaky with a clean mild taste (really fresh). The risotto was just the way I like it - smooth and tender and rich. There was a side of broccolini with a nice touch of crunch, butter and garlic. 

We passed on dessert as we were quite full. 

Ken, the owner, took some time to visit with us. We felt like royalty. Our waitress was amazing and made sure that every part of our meal was to our liking. 

I am looking forward to returning and trying some of their other amazing offerings. Maybe, we will not eat for a few days and try "The Feast".

Stumbled upon this place after a day at the zoo! This is a quaint little Columbian restaurant that serves some spectacular food.

My wife and I ordered the corn pie as an appetizer, wow, what a great way to start our meal. I will admit the corn pie was not what I had expected, it was so much better! The corn pie has chorizo, chicarrons, queso, and maizitos. When this dish arrived at our table, we couldn't wait to dive in. We dove in and the dish was gone in no time, I highly recommend this as an appetizer.

For my entree, I ordered the shrimp Monserrate. this dish comes with a generous amount of shrimp in a garlic butter sauce. The meal comes with 2 sides, I chose the rice with pigeon peas and sweet plantains. I loved my meal, I found it to be very tasty and thought it was a great value.

My wife had the breaded steak, she happen to order the same sides as me. She said the steak was good but mentioned the oil used to fry the breading was either too hot or possibly needed to be changed. Otherwise, she found the dish and sides to be very good.

If we are in the area again we would definitely stop back in.

I consider myself to be a lover of all things brunch related and after hearing about the brunch buffet at Lana's, I couldn't have been more excited to try it out. I was expecting to be rolled out of there full and satisfied, too bad we left extremely underwhelmed and still hungry. Appearance alone, everything looked pre-packaged and picked over. As we walked down the buffet line, the options became less and less appetizing and most disappointingly everything -even the COFFEE, was cold. Soggy, flavorless "wild berry" waffles and nauseating sweet onion chicken were the stars of the show. Having to ask for everything from a spoon and sugar AND cream, to more napkins, to a new cup of coffee 15 minutes later after they'd promised to replace the old one, was annoying to say the least. To top it off, one of the 6 waiters we had dropped our card/receipt off at another table. Was expecting more from this place, considering it was Easter Sunday and they weren't packed. Should've taken that as a sign in itself. But if you like underwhelming, store bought, bland flavors, cold and picked over, definitely recommend.

I don't give out 5 stars normally but I really did not have anything to complain about this restaurant. I think you have to know what you want to order and go beyond the standard menu choices. It helps that I am Chinese-American and grew up in a Chinese restaurant family. My rule of thumb is, don't order what you would normally order at a Chinese take-out place. 

We made a reservation for Chinese New Year which was a smart idea since it was packed when we got there! We usually go to the original Yummy House location on Waters but we wanted to make sure we got a table so we decided to go with this location which is fancier and more modern than the original. 

Even though it was new years, luckily we got seated really quick (due to aforementioned reservation). We originally were going to have 5 people so they gave us a huge table meant for 8. But 1 person couldn't make it so we moved to a table for 4 but it would have been too small for all our food so we finally got a round table meant for 6 which was roomy enough for all of our dishes. 

The server was running around a little hectically but we got our drinks and orders in. I wish she would have slowed down a little bit though because she would run off right after we make one order. Overall service was good though. 

We started off with a order of their famous Salt & Pepper Calamari (must order!). Guaranteed, this dish is on almost every table in the restaurant! The spices and seasoning is so flavorful that I eat the extra seasoning with my rice! We also ordered pot stickers since that was the only dumpling dish on the menu. I got it purely for good luck for new years. Nothing special- just standard pot stickers with sauce. We also ordered their Salt & Pepper chicken wings which has the same seasoning as the calamari. The wings were extra crispy and had a hint of sweetness like maybe there was sugar caramelized on them. 

Entrees: Hong Kong style pan fried noodles- the best I've had in Tampa! The noodles were perfectly crispy and kept their texture even with the sauce and toppings. There was a lot of meat (chicken, roast pork) and seafood (calamari, shrimp, scallops), and vegetables (bok choy, mushrooms, carrots) . My Hong Kong mother would approve!

Honey walnut shrimp- this dish was done very well. The sauce was sweet and savory and the walnuts were good enough to eat by themselves. The shrimp was served on top of a bed of greens. Not too sticky of a sauce that some places make. Sometimes this dish can be a little too rich but their version was just right. We ate this dish up real quick. 

Mandarin Pork Chops- good sized pieces of pork chop in a red, sweet and sour-ish sticky sauce with onions. Standard but always good.

Steamed Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce- the broccoli pieces were huge! Although I did think it was a little expensive ($9.95) for greens. The server actually brought out the wrong dish (Chinese broccoli with garlic sauce) at first but quickly realized the mistake. We might actually get the garlic sauce version next time since it looked good!

House Fried Rice- this is not your average fried rice! It had a nice smoky-bbq flavor and it was really well balanced. I love fried rice and this was one of the better ones I've had. 

Overall: food was exceptional and authentic (for Tampa anyways). The portion sizes are generous. We ended up with 3 boxes of food to take home for the 4 of us. Prices were decent. Total for everything (8 dishes and 4 teas) was under $90.  Service was good. Ambiance and cleanliness was one point. Parking wasn't hard to find. It was a very nice evening. The owners of the Yummy House empire has done a nice job with this more upscale version. While I still personally prefer the old school Yummy House on waters, I can see myself coming here when I want a nicer atmosphere. I would take my mom here (and that means a lot since she is really picky when it comes to Chinese food).

Beer lovers rejoice!!! This place is so great for anyone trying to drink quality beer! NCBC has some of the best local brews in PA and it was well worth with the trip. I will say, however, bring a jacket. In the winter time, the main hall gets freezing and there are no heaters to be found! On the bright side, they have great food trucks posted outside that pair perfectly with your beer! I love the fact that the air hockey was free and holy nostalgia! they have the Simpsons arcade game! Definite field trip for you and your friends on a Saturday afternoon!

Tried this place out with co workers for delivery for lunch. I ordered the chicken tandoori. The chicken was dry. The saving grace was the lemon it was served with. Would not order that dish again. I did try a co workers dish (chicken tikka masala) which was delicious and had a perfect kick to it. The heat level was a "medium" and it had plenty of kick, especially for someone who loves heat. Next time I definitely would order that dish!

Always quick and always a good place to grab a work lunch .......... and of course the flavor of the month.
Love those fries!

As we drove up to this establishment, my first thought was to just keep on truckin'.  The curb appeal was less then appealing and the surroundings were as exciting as a dirty old strip mall can be.  Regardless, my wife said we should go for it.  I don't know if the owners like this description, but Kenner Seafood is the quintessential "hole in the wall" joint.  Awesome food, friendly service, and affordable prices.  'Nuff said, but I'll keep going....  

We loved it from the second we walked in.  We were first met by what appeared to be a small seafood market.  The restaurant and bar were just visible in the back.  This place was busy with the lunch rush, but we were lucky enough to find a decent sized booth.  So down we sat, the wife, baby and me.  

First and foremost, they have diet root beer here.  Oh yea, it's one of my favorites (next to real beer of course).  I started off with a half dozen chargrilled oysters.  I found them to be perfect in every way.  Size, seasoning and flavor.  These beat Dragos hands down.  

My wife and I decided to go the traditional route for lunch.  I went with the 9" fried shrimp po boy and she went with the fried catfish.  This is not to belittle their otherwise awesome menu.  They have an ample menu that I would love to pick through upon future visits, but my thoughts are if the can't make the most basic of NOLA fare, then they aren't worth another visit.  

The po boy was LOADED with fried shrimp that could've been considered a meal by themselves.  For $9, it was worth every penny.
