Antique middle eastern lights hung from the ceiling in various colors, proving just enough light to see, with tea candles flickering on each table for a pinch of romanticism.  You can see into the kitchen vaguely, and get the sense that it's only a couple people back there, doing what they do best. 

The menu is surprisingly large. So many options ranging from Zatter bread & babaghannough to gyros, Koshari, and Egyptian samosas - it was hard to choose! We settled on sharing 3 things, and made a deal on what we'll order the next time we dine (gyros, hummus, and Ouzi, for the record).  

To start we ordered babaghannough, which was sublime. Their menu described it as "eggplant dip will be the best you ever had" and, I gotta say, it was! The "generous dose of garlic" definitely tickled our tastebuds, but we're complete garlic lovers so it was right up our alley. Plus, the pita was served warm, always a good touch!

For our meal, we shared a salad with shrimp and kofta. Honestly the salad was "fine", totally good and shrimp was flavored well, but, it got lost in comparison to the kofta, that I hardly touched it.  

The kofta; omg. First of all, the meat itself was so packed with flavor that my taste buds were practically dancing! It was served with tahini and toumeaa (a garlic sauce); both of which were unlike anything I've tasted before.  They doctored up their tahini - it was bright and flavorful, almost zesty.  The toumeaa was unreal - the words "that's money" from a certain flame-wearing diner-visiting chef popped into my mind. It was like a kick in the pants, for my tastebuds - SO unbelievably garlicky, yet somehow I couldn't get enough.  The dish was served with yummy long grain rice, which I happily used to shovel more toumeaa into my mouth.  Let's just say, it's a good thing we both were eating the same thing - otherwise I would have had some SERIOUS garlic breath issues (I mean, I still had it - but at least we both did!)

The server was super friendly and hospitable, prompt without being pushy, but left us alone just the right amount! I legitimately cannot wait to go back and try more of this menu!!!

::Heads up, no reservations unless you have a party of 6+. You can do call ahead seating! We came around 9pm on Saturday and we're seated immediately, but the place was really full.
:: BYOB! Wahoo!

I like Home Depot.  It's HUGE, but organized and there are many assistants there to steer you in the right direction.  I mainly go there for plants and lawn goods as I am fixing up my front yard.  They have some beautiful roses, fruit trees, and indoor plants.  Love the patio furniture (sigh).  I am saving up for a pellet bbq.  Prices look pretty reasonable.  I have also bought lamp shades, screen doors, paint, electrical fixtures and have looked at the flooring there.  You name it, they've got it.  Home Deport is my "go to" place when I need to spruce up the house.

Tons of coffee options, and unique ones to boot, excellent bagel sandos, and mini muffins that my Bf said were "waaaay better than cupcakes!" Definitely worth a stop. This cozy midtown spot makes me remember what I love about Reno.

Butcher and is definitely the best steakhouse I have been to in Philadelphia. The ambiance and the decoration is amazing. The hostesses weren't great. They didn't come to check on us and make sure our party was there when it was time for us to be seated like they did for others waiting at the bar. So I had to walk over and check with them.

After that the the rest of the evening was pretty flawless. Me hike the restaurant week menu was limited, everything was still expertly prepared. The oysters Rockefeller and the potato leek soup were both delicious. I loved the sear on my filet. The crust was exactly what I look for in my steaks. The salmon was all perfectly cooked and seasoned. Dessert might have even been the best course. The chocolate and caramel tart an the bread pudding were flawless.

I want to go back sometime soon to have the Delmonico steak with a side of stuffed hash browns and the baked Alaska for dessert. I have had many people raving to me about these items, so hopefully I can go back soon and try them out!

I love this place, though it's a bit smokey.  Don't let the numerous occurrences of the word "hip" on this page frighten you off; Pin-Up is indeed trendilicious, but it's also got a very authentic feel.  Great place to go with a mixed group of drinkers and non-drinkers.

I love this place. I do not love the parking situation, but i am willing to forego the parking issues because the food is so good. Thin crust, fresh ingredients, ohhh my mouth is watering!

You can even call ahead and pre-order to pick up later that day. Worked perfectly, and I didn't have to wait at all! I prefer plain pepperoni or cheese pizza, so I'm easy. But we have also had veggie pizzas there, and they too were delicious. 

They are my go-to place when I want pizza, and I will continue going there because it is so great. Thank you!!

I recently went back to Rodizio Grill for a Yelp event, and I realized that I wasn't on Yelp back in 2013 when I first visited.  I did, however, blog about the experience, so I'm including that recap here, plus updates based on my visit this week (2016) below.

---2013 at Nashville's Rodizio---
One of my boyfriend's most favorite things in the whole wide world to eat is picanha, a Brazilian rump cap beef cut rubbed in butter and sea salt and cook on a spit.  Yes, it is as phenomenal as it sounds.

That is why he loves Brazilian steakhouses with all-you-can-eat concepts.  Since we weren't spending Thanksgiving together this year, we decided our "Couplesgiving" meal would be at the Rodizio Grill in downtown Nashville.  A win for me with no cooking required, and a win for boyfriend and his carnivorous cravings!  We took advantage of an e-mail we got that gave us a Buy One, Get One Half Off deal on our meal.  (Just sign up for e-mails on the website!)

We've never been to Rodizio before, but we have visited similar concepts.  I think Rodizio does an excellent job!  We were surprised by the price, which was about $10 less than other churrascaria chains we've been to.  We were seated right away, and we had very attentive service.  The only thing not included in your meal price is drinks and dessert.

They start you with a few appetizers, like tasty fried bananas and even polenta.  The "salad bar" (which is way more than just salad) was well-stocked, and enormous!  Everything from rice and soups to quail eggs and mozzarella salad.  I think a vegetarian could go to town on the variety offered.  They had four full sides of options on that buffet.

We put the "green" signal up when we were ready, and then we went to town.  The picanha guy knew that was our absolute favorite, so he gave us as much as we wanted whenever he came by.  We were pitched sausage, ham, brisket, lamb, fish, chicken, turkey, and even a DELICIOUS grilled pineapple.  Yum.

When you need the meat to stop coming, you just put the red signal up and they leave you alone.  But then you spot something juicy coming by and you're like, GREEN!  Let's just say we ate our fill.

---2016 at Nashville's Rodizio---
Now that boyfriend is my husband!  And he went back with me for a Yelp event and we loved it even more.   The picanha and grilled pineapple are still amazing, but I've noticed that they've added even MORE to the mix.  

There are some new additions to the buffet, which now boasts more than four sides with an additional line of food on the side.  There's an incredible macaroni and cheese and new meats (ribs!) that bring Tennessee flavors into the mix.  We learned the word "Rodizio" isn't synonymous with a churrascaria, but is more about eating in the round.  Brazilian food incorporates many cultures in its fusion and influence, so I think it's only fitting that Tennessee flavors (including local cheesecake) sneak their way into this place on 2nd Ave spot.

We also had a chance to start the meal with a Pinga con Mel shot (that honey rim is great!) and sample the caipirinhas.  We finished the meal with a deliciously smooth Amarula shot, which I recommend.  I had two.

We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the restaurant, including the hospitality of the staff and gauchos.  Loved it.  We will be back to feast again.

P.S.  There's an event space in the back, that I think would be great for corporate meetings, receptions, etc.  Love the exposed brick, private bar, etc.

Mahalo, Honu! What an incredible lunch we had with you on a September Saturday in 2021! We sat out back in the peaceful and relaxing tiki bar area. With the lush vegetation, vintage Polynesian-inspired decor, the tropical menu and the staff's warm and friendly vibe, it truly felt like we were far away on vacation... and that was before we started sampling the inventive craft cocktails. 

Opened in 2016, the restaurant is in a little green house, in downtown Dunedin, with a patio out front and the tiki bar out back. Inside, there's a lobby/front room area with a deep mid-century Polynesian vibe and a 20-seat private dining room. 

Out back, there's a large bar area, separate long counter seating and several tables with umbrellas. We were seated right away... and the four-legged member of our party was happily fawned over. They brought water to our good boy several times and there's even a dog menu! The rest of us ordered chicken sliders, a burger, one of the stacks and the coconut lime soup. Everyone loved everything! We also thoroughly enjoyed tropical drinks and a couple of champagne flights. They didn't mind us lingering three hours at the table. What a fun, chill and unique afternoon! I can't wait to go back and keep working my way through both the food and extensive drink menus... and take in some live music. 
 (there's a little stage in the tiki bar area)

There's parking available along nearby streets plus a small lot. Service was warm, friendly and easy-going and everything was just so comfy. It's good for head, heart and tummy. See you there!

We love Sauce on the Side it's our go to restaurant in St. Louis for 'pizza' (they only serve calzones). The food is so good we don't even order traditional pizza anymore! We were happy to see a location was opening in The Grove which is very convenient for us. We called in our order which was taken promptly over the phone by a very friendly girl. My husband went to pick it up 20 minutes later and the restaurant was pretty busy. He was frustrated that there wasn't a designated pick up area since there was a long line at the register and the bar area was full as well. He waited in line to pick up our food which was ready for us and delicious! We had the Five-O and the Roasty Toasty with added feta. Just need a designated area for pick up to make it more efficient.

We will be back and back and back to the Omoni Fresh Fast Korean Grill. It was our first visit and our first time enjoying Korean food. David was excellent in guiding us through how to order, allowing us to sample the kimchis, and giving us the family history. 

My taste buds were on fire after eating here in a GREAT way. I loved everything about my meal except maybe it was too hot (not spicy hot) but actually hot due to the stone bowls. 

We had very quick service, which was perfect for a weeknight quick dinner. I look forward to our next visit!

My childhood is filled with memories of enjoying the annual Philadelphia Flower Show and then walking to Vietnam for some lunch/dinner with my family.  This has happened more times than I can count, and each time its been wonderful.  It may not be the typical family tradition, but it's mine and I love it.  

Even now that I live in CO, any opportunity I have to come back to Vietnam is an exciting day indeed.

I've been to Vietnam more times than I can count and two things are guaranteed, my Mom and I order the Flaming Volcano for two, and the table shares the BBQ Platter.  If this is all you eat and drink at Vietnam you'll be in heaven.

The Flaming Volcano for two includes rum, vodka, gin, brandy, grenadine, Bacardi 151 and fruit juice.  This is a boozy beverage and will leave two people feeling the buzz as they suck down every drop.  And don't let them take the drink too soon, as the ice melts and mixes with the remaining booze and juice you can have a "second drink".  Don't forgot to blow out the flame and drink the rum from the center, it's a warm burn as it makes it's way slowly down your throat.  

The BBQ Platter includes, crispy spring rolls, beef stuffed grape leaves, char-grilled chicken, grilled meat balls, rice vermicelli, lettuce, and rice paper sprinkled with crushed peanuts.  They say this serves two people but I think this easily serves four to five people, especially if you're ordering entrees.  The crispy spring rolls are those addicting spring rolls that you dream about.  If I was on a desert island and could only have three things, I would want these spring rolls to be one of the three items.  In addition to the spring rolls, the grilled meatballs are delicious and I love taking the lettuce or the rice paper and making a wrap with the rice vermicelli, char-grilled chicken, pickled vegetables and topping the whole thing with some peanut sauce.  The BBQ Platter will feed the table and people will fight over the last bites.

I've tried multiple entree items and they have all been good, but nothing has the variety that the BBQ Platter offers.  The BBQ Platter gives you multiple items and a mixture of tastes that a single entree cannot offer.  Take my word for it, order the BBQ Platter!  And if you're feeling a bit crazy, the Flaming Volcano for two is the perfect accompaniment.

I like this little spot. It is probably not as hidden as it seems, but I like that it was not packed to the brim. Went in and you order at the bar; basically right when you walk in. The food is reasonable and the quality is good. They have TVs and a big bar for people to sit and watch the games/news/whatever is on. 

I had the burger, and it was good. Sometimes, a simple burger and fries is all that is needed to make your world happy again. My friend had seafood something, since she only sticks with fish. She also loved her food. I would definitely return here; it is to me somewhat of a hidden gem. I can definitely understand some reviews about rude / rushing bartenders, tho. She was curt but somewhat friendly when we ordered. Maybe that is just their brand? Not sure. I was just friendly and smiled and she seemed fine with me.

I may be somewhat biased, as this is my happy place, but I love the Dome. No matter the crowd, the line you'll encounter upon entering always moves fairly quickly, and the staff is helpful, efficient and friendly. It's like they hired die-hard Saints fans to staff the place and they're as excited as the Saints are in the house as we are. Visiting Champions Square pre-game can be fun.

My one criticism about our Dome is that the food quality doesn't really represent New Orleans. I don't expect to get the best of what we have to offer in a sports arena, but they could do better. I've noticed this season they got on board with Ochsners's Get Fit NOLA program, although I haven't tried the menu, so can't comment on the quality, and you can get top shelf mixed drinks at kiosks on the 200 level; it'll cost you, but if you're looking for a good hand made margarita, Bloody Mary or Old Fashioned, they got that. The club level food is sub par for our city, and, since we have so many visitors here every year, I wish they'd think about really bringing it. I usually go out for brunch ahead of the game and avoid the food altogether. 

Bring some extra green for the Team Fan Shop on level 100; this store will not disappoint. And when we get a little loud and chant "Who Dat!?!" In your faces, you'll forgive us, right?

What an awesome place to take our fur babies! Those who are dog parents, we know what our fur babies need! My pup autumn's breed are natural runners. She is a Rhodesian Ridgeback/pit mix. Rhodesians are lion hunting dogs, and my pup is the fastest out there! She loves the water, swimming and playing ball. This park has it all. At the parking lot there is the fences in dog park for them to run freely in a grassy area. Then walk a quarter mile down the sand trail to the beach and arrive at the off leash dog park! Autumn was so happy when she saw the water. She's been in lakes and at the gandy brag strip, but never On a beach with big waves. She didn't know what to think of the waves....it was a windy day on thanksgiving. She ran around, played ball and loved swimming in the ocean. If your dogs love the run and swim this in the #1 spot! She was so worn out the rest of the day. But next time we go, it will be when it's not so windy and the waves are smaller. She did have a limp the rest of the day, but I take it was from the waves crashing into her. Great park and can't wait to take her back!

I went mid-September with my girlfriend. We both got 4 bones. She got porto fries as her side. I got corn chowder.

I cannot say how much I LOVE that they offer more sides than the standard, oh-so boring barbeque sides.

And there are the pickles!! I got three spears, and they're just so good!!

The ribs were great, chewy, no fall off the bone here. I ate most sans sauce, but I did try the coffee sauce and the mustard sauce.

The coffee sauce was great. The mustard sauce was too totally mustardy.

The corn chowder was creamy good with snappy kernels of corn, and appropriately hot. It had a bit of a kick to it. It was earthy, so I would say cumin.

My girlfriend's porto fries were Portobello mushrooms cut like steak fries, breaded and deep-fried. They were made ON THE SPOT, exactly when she ordered them, and brought to the table.

She shared one with me, and they were fabulous.

A lot of interesting sides were available this day, and I had trouble selecting just one.

I took home half of the corn chowder, two ribs and three pickle spears, which made for another glorious meal.

TO NOTE: There is now a BIG sign over the appropriate entrance door. The sign reads: ENTER. So, I got it right this time.

Evenso, we did witness many folks entering through the exit door and making their way backwards through the cafeteria line to get to the order area. Arghhhh!

I would like to patronize other Sugarfire locations, as I understand the sides are different, depending on the location and the chef's flair.

The service was very professional and the bartender was both easy to talk to and extremely knowledgeable. We received some bread which was slightly stale and was disappointing. I ordered the Short Rib Mezzaluna with a side of meatballs. The meatballs, super tasty. I loved the sauce thay came with them. The short rib pasta, while unique, didn't seem worth the price. I really hoped the food would be on another level and blow me away.

The restaurant is very noisy as the atmosphere consists mostly of hard floors and walls around a bar causing sounds to echo very easily. I found it hard to hear my partner sitting next to me let alone the music that was playing.

I am absolutely loving Rebar Coffee. Matt Christianson, the brain behind Union Ale and American Ale, has hit it out of the park with this adorable cafe. 

Rebar serves delicious drip coffee, lattes, and cold brew. They have an assortment of bottled, cold beverages, as well as, local beer and wine. They also offer fresh squeezed orange and tomato juices. 

On a hot day, I usually opt for the cold brew. It is rich, bold and tasty! When I'm looking to warm up, I tend to order an Almond Milk Latte - sooo good! Or an Almond Milk Vanilla Latte, made with a touch of their house made Vanilla Bean Syrup. I am so delighted that they make their syrups in house rather than using the ordinary Torani brand syrups. 

Rebar offers breakfast daily, fresh baked pastries and lunch items including massive, gourmet burgers with fries, pizzas and salads. 

I've had the Sticky Bun multiple times and it is the dessert sweet dreams are made of! Imagine a cinnamon bun but better, doughy on the inside, crispy, perfectly caramelized crust on the outside, topped with candied nuts and a sauce that trickles down the outside ridges of the crust, mmmm good! 

I also highly recommend the Ricotta toast which consists of an extra thick slice of fresh baked bread, topped with a generous slather of hand pulled ricotta cheese and finished off with a layer of jam of your choice (Blueberry Strawberry, Strawberry Rhubarb, Peach or Honey). I had it with Strawberry Rhubarb and it was fantastic! Not too sweet and very filling. It could be a light meal on it's own or order one to share as a little amuse bouche for your table. 

The Avocado Bacon & Egg Sandwich is definitely worth a mention as well. House made Brioche bun, baked to golden perfection, sandwiching a fried egg over medium, several slices of thick, smokey bacon, smashed fresh avocado and topped with diced chives. The sandwich comes with a Chipotle Ketchup that I've heard is wonderful, however, I love a combination of sweet and savory for breakfast so I substitute the ketchup for house made jam, usually Strawberry Rhubarb. It's heavenly! If you've ever had the breakfast sandwich at Renaud's, this is reminiscent of that (only slightly different ingredients), and served with a much better bread in my opinion, because the brioche does not tear up my gums like the bread at Renaud's does. Just try it, it's worth it!

It would not be a complete review without mentioning the ambiance, decor, location and music. Rebar feels like a respite from the hustle and bustle of State Street, even though it's located right on it. Walking into Rebar is like stepping back in time to the Prohibition-Era. Natural wood, metal and steel accents, the greatest jazz humming through unseen speakers and beautiful large windows to people watch. 

There is also a huge, dog friendly outdoor patio with plenty of picnic tables. They'll even bring a water bowl for your pooch(es). I know because I've brought my two loves. ;) 

The staff is warm and friendly. They all seem very well-trained. There is free wifi, password: 214union. 

Parking is easy in their lot adjacent to Rebar, or if necessary, you can park across the street in the Amtrak lot where the first 75 mins are free.

The only note I have of constructive feedback is regarding the bathrooms, which are located next to the patio and across from the kitchen doors. They are often dirty and need regular attention. I suggest having an hourly or bi-hourly schedule for the staff to check the bathrooms and do any clean up necessary. It is very off putting when a bathroom is in disgusting condition at a restaurant because it gives off a vibe of uncleanliness. Something I would not associated with my restaurant if I owned one. Other than that, I'd say Rebar is close to perfect for a little cafe.

What a great selection of trees, flowers, decorations, etc. to choose from to beautify your yard! Waaaay more options than your average "box store" (ex: Lowe's). The associates were very helpful and knowledgeable. While we walked away with only a couple of unique but lovely flower pieces, we may be back for a tree or two once we make a decision on which kind we'd like (fruit or not). If we decide to go with a fruit tree, we'll have find another place as Allisonville Nursery doesn't sell fruit trees; however, if we opt for something other than a fruit tree, they will be where I go.

I really wanted to love this place.  The place is the former Warsaw Cafe location and is super cute on the inside and out.  The service was a bit slow, but the owner/waiter/food runner was extremely friendly.  The restaurant was relatively full but they only had 1 waitress and the owner who functioned as a waiter/food runner.  I heard the owner telling someone that his wife makes all the food and she only makes one dish at a time...which doesn't seem like the best idea.  This may also explain why the food didn't come out piping hot.

Appetizers: Fried tofu- good, but could have been crispier.  Thai papaya salad was pretty good as were the thai basil meatlballs, but I felt like it could have used some kind of dipping sauce or something since they were a bit dry.

Entrees: Pad Thai- super super al dente.  Some of the noodles were basically uncooked and the pad thai was a bit dry.  My friend got the panaeng curry with duck which was actually delicious.  

I will probably give this place another try.  It is relatively new so perhaps they need some time to work out some things.

I really wanted to like this place, but when you hand my a soy cappucino (litterally ALL FOAM) when I order a latte, we have a seriously problem here. Did I mention the fact that the espresso was literally ON FIRE hot? oh I didn't? well it was. and that made me quite sad. I have always been curious about the good karma up on 22nd, passing it constantly when driving over to see the West Philly folks. I've never had reason to stop because I was always headed somewhere, however, when this one opening up so close to my house, it was clear I could take it in for consideration. 

I stopped by on a walk with my dog and bf. They let me bring the dog in- massive props. The space is really lovely. It's got great high ceilings, lots of sitting room, (but all tables and chairs like a cafeteria, no cushy seating) They are open late, which is nice, but still, it's just not quite what I'm looking for. If I leave my house and walk south instead of north, I end up at Chapterhouse, and while GK is certainly nice, I also need my beverage to be on par with the aesthetics of the place, and at least at my first visit, it was not. It burnt my mouth and was 3/4 foam and 1/4 espresso and not a latte in any form of the word. 

I'm sure we'll try it again and at that point, I'll give it a second chance and second review, but for right now it would be my last choice for a coffee fix. Sorry guys.

What a cool place! 

Came here with some friends on a Saturday night with some friends who are "board members" (aka regulars who pay a membership fee to get some awesome perks!). The Thanksgiving weekend caused for it to be a not so packed evening - great for our benefit, our party of four was easily able to find a table.

Loved the woody atmosphere, the great attitude of all the employees, and most importantly the menu! Rincon carries a variety of their house beers, as well as guest beers or Coors Light (lol). I had the IPA and LOVED it. Different than the Sonoma County IPAs I've been used to lately, but so fresh and delicious.

The table shared pretzel bites with a beer jalapeño cheese dip.... YUM. The only bad thing about it was there wasn't enough! I could've eaten it all on my own and I had to share... ugh! Luckily we also had the sriracha hot wings, enough for each of us to have 3, and so good and perfectly spicy!!

I can't wait to go back to Carp to not only visit my friends, but to go back here! Excited to see how their business grows.

This is my new supermarket and I'm pretty pleased with it at this point. I grew up going to shoprite in jersey and I was pleasantly surprised to find out this was the closest supermarket to my new home. This location is pretty clean and well maintained. Prices here are generally good and they offer decent perks to card holders, like a free ham or turkey for $400 spent during the 6 weeks before Thanksgiving. After getting all my deli meats at BJ's the past 4 years, I can't say I love these prices, but it's comparable to most supermarkets deli prices. Not the biggest store but a good selection. Oh, and their Chinese food compares favorably to many take out spots. I'm happy with our experience so far, but not just ready to bump up this rating that high yet. See it for yourself.

I know FOR A FACT that I will be eating at this place way more than I "should." 

I just moved in a mere block away from this excellent spot, and discovered it's epic happy hour last week. 

Blown-away isn't even the right terminology. I just moved back to Saint Louis from California, land of top-notch fresh fish BUT inflated pricing. Cafe Mochi didn't fail to disappoint in any way - taste or otherwise. (Granted, I was there for happy hour, but whatever...they have it from 4:30-6:30 Tuesday-Friday and that's AWESOME in my book.) The two of us ate VERY well and walked away with full bellies on five rolls. Our total pre-tip was around $16. That is crazy-fantastic!

As far as the rolls we divulged in: we immediately chose the Bagel Roll because it sounded all kinds of deliciously unhealthy. I don't really remember what was in it, but it was one of those fried rolls that also has cream cheese in it. It was good, but very....creamy and filling. We also got a tempura asparagus roll (because we're primarily veggies and had to see what this place had to offer the full-blown sect) that was very good. The Futomaki roll tasted "healthy,"  but it was a great balance to the fried goodness of everything else. I think we may have also gotten a fried shrimp roll, though by this point I can't remember if it was fried or not. I do know one of the rolls had avocado and it was -awesome-. Our favorite was the Spicy Octopus roll. Seriously, words cannot describe the tasty tango happening in my mouth. Chewy, but zingy - loved it!

We didn't get anything to drink, but we were being cheap and that's how it goes. I don't know how  "all about it" I'd be if I were paying full price, but the happy hour option is always available. 

When we first got there, service seemed a bit lackluster, but I don't remember getting angry about lack of water or anything at all throughout the meal. The decor is cute, but a little weird, considering they have lawn furniture inside for some of the tables. I like the pink, though. Pink is fun. The spray-painted chandeliers are a nice bonus. 

I know we'll come here way more than we expected when we first walked in. This isn't the best sushi I've ever had, but I've had a lot of sushi all over the world and I wouldn't expect St. Louis to fulfill all of that. However, this place is great and I didn't question the quality of the fish that we ordered at all. I have no idea how they manage to support the business with such a killer deal, but I will attend this fantastic mess until the end of my tenure on South Grand or they stop offering it - whichever comes first.

I really wanted to love Hillbilly BBQ, I don't want to say I didn't like it but, I'm not sure it was love at first bite either.  I'd give it THREE &  HALF STARS if I could.

To do the fair review I felt like I bought the joint out.  I ordered a combo (beef & pork with two sides) along with a couple of ribs and a couple more sides.

First, the staff was very friendly and helpful.  When torn between the traditional BBQ sauce & sweet sauce he put two pieces of beef on a slice of wax paper and handed me both bottles of sauce.  Both were good (and I took both).  On a side note, he did tell me they are moving to Hickory and I think there might be a temporary move between where they are now and Hickory...so if you are going to try this place CALL AND FIND OUT WHERE THEY ARE LOCATED!

On to the food.  The beef was good...maybe a little on the dry side.  The pork I thought was better than the beef, the ribs (the dry type) were ok, not a ton of meat on the one I ate and it did have a good bit of fat on it.  I thought the meat was very smokey.  I like smokey but, I like to actually taste the meat too.  If I had to rank the meats I tried I'd say the pork was best, followed by the beef and then the ribs.

The sides I ordered were corn salad, potato salad, baked beans & slaw.  The corn salad wasn't what I was expecting...I was thinking more along the lines of the corn stuff from Voodoo BBQ (which I love!) and this was a cold corn salad with tomatoes and a little kick...it was good.  The potato salad really had some kick...it was good.  The beans were ok.  The slaw was not creamy like most places but, I think it was a vinegar based...good stuff.  I think those were their four normal sides.  

One thing I have to stay about everything was it all had a lot of Cajuny (I'm making up words now) kick to it.  Sometimes I think places can go a little too far with the Cajun seasoning...this might be the case here.  I don't own any Tony Chachere's and it's really not something I want to taste when I'm going out.  Just my personal taste here.

Overall, I'd try it again.  I wanted this to be my "go to" BBQ place and it isn't it.  I know a lot of people don't like Voodoo BBQ but, I do it because it isn't overly smoked and always solid (I thought The Joint was a little too smokey too).  I think Hillbilly BBQ was good and I'd try it again but it's not my #1 BBQ place.  

I'd give it THREE AND A HALF STARS if I could.

Hubby and I just moved into the neighborhood. We've been looking for our local 'spot'; a nearby dive with great and low cost food. Well, we found this in Lincoln Square PH. I love the quality and amount of food for the price. I love the pancakes, as well as the Lincoln Square skillet (bacon, hash brown, cheese, onions, etc) -- ooooo so yummy. You get two large pancakes with those! Everything was seasoned well. The OJ is freshly squeezed. I also love the service here, which is quick, friendly, and my order is always right. The manager comes around each time we have been there to ensure everything is going well. Its never jammed packed, but they stay busy. They close everyday at 4PM so no dinner is served, but they do have lunch. Hubby and I are mainly breakfast folks. 

The place is very new and remodeled. I don't not go for the decor, tho. I love the food and service, which makes this place our new spot. I love going here and we now regulars.

So many great deals!! So little time!!! But really, it's easy to accidentally spend several hours in here an not even be half way through the DVDs. Such an awesome treasure hunt of a time!

Friendly staff make this wonderland even more spectacular. I love the adventure that McKay Books always delivers!

I had the lucky opportunity to try Marrow out for the first time the other day during our NYE progressive dinner in Fountain Square. I had heard nothing but lovely things about Marrow and it had been bookmarked for quite awhile. So, I had high hopes! And I was not disappointed.

We started with drinks and I opted for their Miso Mule, which was filled with mogul vodka, coconut-miso reduction, lime, ginger syrup and soda. I've always been a fan of Moscow Mules, so I knew I was in for a treat with this one. Delightful. They also had several great beers on tap which several of the people at my table took advantage of and they all seemed very pleased. We then moved on to the food - which, to be honest, I at first found a little daunting because a lot of the options were brand new to me and my taste buds. I view this place as a restaurant for those that are open to trying new things - I mean, this food was quality food. Just new to me. 

Because it was NYE, it seemed appropriate to take a shot! So we landed on their Oyster Shooters - oysters and champagne migonette. We were all pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed it. It was hard to not order another round - my recommendation is to just go ahead and order that other round. ha 

One of my favorite dishes we decided on was their Gnocchi - butternut squash, oyster mushrooms, brussels sprouts, sage brown butter, truffled parsnip puree and parm. I couldn't get enough of it! 

It was fun to experience these new dishes with this particular group as each and every one of us were down to try something new. I was fortunate that I was sitting with others that had been there before - so they could give their own personal recommendations before ordering. 

This is definitely a nice addition to Fountain Square and I'm VERY glad I finally was able to check it out.

I really love Coffee EVI. I have only gotten two things here, but both are so good I don't want to branch out! I love the protein pancake sandwich (made with egg whites and turkey sausage, hot sauce on the side) and the iced coffee (served with coffee ice cubes). The protein pancake egg sandwich keeps me full for the full workday if I eat it for breakfast, which is amazing. The owners are so friendly, which makes the experience all that much better. I did notice that the price of my two items was higher my last visit, so I assume they raised the prices a bit but the menu didn't reflect the bump yet. Highly recommend this locally owned coffee shop for fresh, healthy options.

I love trader joes - and this one is smack dab in the middle of down-town Media.  (With parking - yay!)

Same stuff as at my beloved Phillybranch - but pomegranate seeds were $4.99 in Media - just $3.99 in Center City.  Odd.

Great frozen meals, too.

LOVE!!!!

There's a reason that Babe's Pizza has been in business for around 30 years.  Their pizza is amazing!  I will never forget the first time that my friends took me here.  I remember driving up and seeing an old, strange looking building with "Babe's" written on the outside of it.  Um, just exactly where are we going?  Once I had a bite of this pizza I was a believer.  The double decker pizza is unlike any other pizza I've ever had.  Imagine a pizza on top of a pizza with gooey, delicious cheese and sauce crammed into most of the crust.  We order ours with extra sauce to make it even better!  You'll be surprised at how few slices it takes to make you really full!  While you're eating your pizza you can watch the model train that circles the entire length of the dining room.  I love supporting local businesses like this.  Babe's make it easy because the owners/workers are SO nice and the pizza is SO good.  If you're coming here on a Friday or Saturday night I would suggest arriving early because this place gets packed on the weekends.

Protip: Babe's has a very small parking lot.  They are located behind an Einstein Bagel.  You are allowed to park in the Einstein parking lot.  Einstein is only open during the day and Babe's is only open at night.  They agreed to share their parking lots.

It was cold and rainy but Grant's Farm did not disappoint. We visited on Opening Day, and they were more than prepared for a large crowd. The grounds are beautiful, the animals are incredible, and the staff is well trained and professional. I love the tram system that takes customers throughout the farm quickly with loads of information from guides along the way.  The baby goats were a personal favorite of our group on this particular day, but there is so much to see and do, we cannot wait to go back again soon to spend more time when the weather is more cooperative. An absolutely amazing experience and a St. Louis treasure!

So I have been here a few years now, and every time has been great. 
This evening, my partner and I came here for dinner.
She had her favorite dinner, the snow crab dinner, with the caramel cheesecake afterwards. She loved her crab; said it was fantastic and full of flavor.
Her thoughts on the service was the same as my opinion. We both had been checked on 6 times before our food even came out, (which was 40 minutes). It was not busy at all, and it was way to many times to check on us before our food was even there. 

I had the crab cakes with cole slaw. The cole slaw was better than the crab cakes. The cakes lacked flavor. I tried putting lemon on them to spruce them up, but it didn't really work. I was very hungry so I just ate the crab cakes and ordered a brownie after wards. The ice cream on the brownie was nice and creamy.
So apart from the over-bearing service and the mediocre crab cakes, I will return to try the scallop dinner, and so my girlfriend can have the awesome snow crab dinner again!

I've been dying to try this place. It's one of the new restaurants at the Fishers Yard in with Sun King. I saw on their Instagram page they were running a special on Thursday's, a single burger and fry for $6.00 so I finally made it there last night and it definitely did not disappoint. 
 
I ordered my single patty with cheese, shredduce, tomato, pickles, mustard, and ketchup. All the vegetables were crisp and fresh, loved the pickles they are thick and they put several on my burger. Also love that the lettuce is shredded (hence the word shredduce). If I had to do it over again I think I would order a double though because the patties are thin, go with the less is more on a single. But don't let the thin patty fool you it's full of flavor! 

The fries were absolutely amazing as well! Hot and crunchy! Everything is made to order so it's all hot and fresh. 

Definitely recommend OTP if you've got that " I just need a good cheeseburger and fry craving"

I love this pet store for grooming! We get the Spa Package for our dog once per month and I'm extremely happy with it. They do a multitude of things with this service besides the usual bath. It only takes about 3 hours when you make a appointment in advance. 

My Sawyer comes out happy and pristine. He is white so you can see any dirt on him easily...sometimes this is a curse rather than a blessing:)
He is always very happy going and coming home so I know they treat him right.

Oh Mel's, how do I love thee? Let me count the ways.

1. You let me go into the Casino and get a $2 Bloody Mary and bring that in to drink with breakfast. 

2. Your waitresses are real authentic working gals, attentive and sassy, saggy and snappy. 

3. $7 steak and eggs. Decent steak, delicious steak, delicious eggs. Did I mention the steak was really good? 

4. I'm with "my kind" at Mel's. You don't laugh at me like people in CT do when I use coupons. I am surrounded by Old people on a budget, disabled veterans on a budget. Working class folk on a budget. 

5. No basic bitches here.

Yogokiss is another frozen yogurt spot to check out on the north side.  Jeez why are all the yogurt spot up north?  Somebody please open a shop closer to my hood (south side), I promise I will be a devoted customer!  

Yogokiss is the first fro-yo spot I tried in Indy 2-3 years ago.  I didn't think much of it because it wasn't that great at the that moment.  I love the decor of the place though, really adorable and cute.  Their flavor have definitely improved a lot since I first tried it.  They play a lot with their flavors changing it every 2-3 weeks or so.  One time I got the chance to try their taro flavor, I love love taro so to me it was pure bliss.  When I went back a week later it was gone, guess it's not a popular flavor but I wish they would bring it back.  They have the biggest variety of toppings out of all the frozen yogurt shop I tried in Indy, and it's usually pretty fresh.  

My only complaint about this place is the original flavor, sometimes it's very bland and sour.  I love the tart original flavor but at Yogokiss it's just straight up sour sometimes.  I usually have to ask for a sample to see if they got their original flavor right that day.  They have a really great thing going on here and deserve a visit from all you fro-yo lovers out there.  The texture of their yogurt is just wonderful...creamy and perfectly frozen.  A great treat even on a cold winter day!

I had a great experience here! Yes, the space is tiny, but the atmosphere, service, and food were awesome!

We went before a Pacers game during Devour Downtown, and their deal was incredible! It was 2 people for $30, which included an appetizer, massive entree, and dessert. The drinks were also reasonably priced. 

We started off with this chorizo/queso appetizer dip that was very tasty. I am a big chorizo fan and I love dips, so this was the perfect combination. 

We didn't have an option for the entree, they just brought this massive tray out with 4 kinds of meats, and any type of taco ingredient that we could have wanted. I enjoyed the customizable aspect of it. Churros were the dessert, and they were good. 

This small preview made me want to come back and try other things! they had college basketball on the tvs and you could probably get a max group of 6-8. I also saw that the owners also own BBQ and bourbon which i will have to try out soon.

I've been dying to try this place for a couple of years now.  My family loves biscuits and gravy and biscuit sandwiches, so this place was bound to have something for everyone in our family and it did!
We ordered online to go since we're a big group and it's a small place, but there were a few booths that could have accommodated our family of 7.  There was a decent amount of outdoor seating as well.
2 of my kids got the Reggie and it was great - awesome biscuits, flavorful chicken, great gravy.  My daughter who had the Chatfield felt the apple butter was too sweet for the sandwich, but liked the rest of the sandwich.  My wife really liked her club sandwich.
One of my all-time favorite dishes is shrimp and grits, so I had to get that (knowing my kids wouldn't finish their biscuit sandwiches and I'd be able to try theirs too!).  The grits were creamy without being too heavy and I really enjoyed the shrimp, bacon, and onion mixture on the top - good flavor to go with the creamy grits!
We tried the beignets for dessert and liked the caramel sauce, but prefer a lighter beignet dough rather than the biscuit dough.
Definitely would come again for brunch in the future - especially on a nice day when we could eat outside!

Agno is a great addition to the Rittenhouse lunch options (although, they've been around about a year now, so the secret should be out!). It's so fast, so it's worth the walk from my building, because I'd rather spend my time outside and eating than waiting in line.

This is fast-casual eatery, meaning it's a build-a-x (bowl, wrap, or salad) place. It's completely gluten-free, but it doesn't beat you over the head with it, and I think everything is tasty, and the vegan options are well marked.

My go-to is generally a rice bowl with falafel (it tastes a little healthy, but otherwise pretty good) and the toppings are great -- love the carrots, beets, cabbage ... well, all of the vegan ones for sure.

There's also plenty of seating, so it's fine to bring a couple of friends along for lunch, no competition over just a couple tables like other Rittenhouse lunch spots!

Our family loves BarkSuds! The appointment process is very easy and so is check in and pick up. We've had a membership since they've opened and love the convenience and cost of the service. We use to bath our dogs on a weekly basis ourselves which took about 30-45 mins with each dog (wash and dry) and now we've gained that time back in our lives for a minimal cost. BarkSuds is a Godsend and not sure how we survived without it. Also, the cost of the cuts are very affordable as comparison with other local rates. We are definitely happy customers!!!

This is really a 3.5 review but no halfsies and I mulled over it a while but just couldn't go with 4. 

That being said I really really wanted to love this place, it's close, it's brunch, new, ample parking. So you walk in they are pretty friendly, they have a "bar" but no drinks... Tea, coffee, it's cute but lacking. Note this is not a byob either.  What is also nice in the waiting area they have self serve coffee/tea while you wait. It is extremely bright inside, which is a bit much. The staff is pretty nice from the front desk to the servers.  I didn't like the fact that they were swiffer-vacuuming while I was eating.   
 
On to food, to I ordered the NY pastrami omelette, it was good, but I probably did the place an injustice by doing so since there is a near by diner that has one that I am in love with.  It didn't measure up.  I will say the food was very fresh, kind of a silver diner feel.  But I didn't really see any real brunch options, nothing that wowed me.  I also had one of their hot chocolate specials that I was sure was going to be a slam dunk, I went with my servers recommendation, I got the smore's , the concept was great, the first few sips were amazing, but no way I could finish it, I was on sugar overload.  Nothing was bad, it was just ok at best good.  I will likely try them again, I mean they are so close and more importantly right next door to the massage spot.  Hopefully I can update to a 4 star review, but as for now it is what it is.

I was so looking forward to the opening of this establishment and have been a regular ever since. 

This brewery offers a great variety of fine craft brews that are bar none-no pun intended 

I usually ask the bartender to get me a flight and just surprise me. No disappointments with any of the brews provided. 

Excellent service, very spacious indoor and outdoor seating. 

Highly recommend to anyone who loves a nice cold brew.

We are from out of town so did a Yelp search and stumbled across this GEM! In part of an old shoe factory it had charm with old wood and exposed brick. We were greeted warmly and shown our table. Our server Sara was delightful, knowledgeable, and not afraid to share her real opinions on their food and wine. The salad of the day was fresh (they grow their own vegetables in a hot house around the corner on another of their properties). The food was inventive and delicious! We had Grilled Salmon on a bed of garbanzo, sun dried tomatoes, jalapenos, mint, and creme fraiche. My wife doesn't usually like salmon and loved it. And we had the Wild Boar Ravioli which was fantastic. It's in a tomato vodka cream sauce which paired perfectly with the boar. Over all an excellent experience. On the way out we had a helpful conversation with the manager. 

GARBANZO BEANS, SUN-DRIED TOMATOES, JALAPENOS,

I enjoy Baltimore Pet Shoppe primarily as a place to pick up some toys and treats for my 3 pets. Staff is friendly and helpful in locating items when needed, too! Living just a few blocks away, I pass the store window frequently, and always love seeing the adoptable cats hanging out in the window. 

The store offers a nice selection of natural pet food options, though they don't seem to carry the more economical/basic brands. I would love to regularly my buy pet's food here if they did!

Amazing food and the tasting menu is a great value, but they seemed under staffed as service was poor. Our waitress was inattentive and just bad.
Lovely seating outside, but can be quite dark. We got seated and it took a while to get our menus. Slowly, we got a free appetizer bite (delicious fig on Rosemary shortbread), though no silverware or napkins. Eventually, after a long time we were able to order. 
We all did the tasting menu.
The sweet bread special was cooked very well and was tasty. Octopus was a salad, which I hadn't realized beforehand. It was just okay. Shrimp appetizer was okay (one shrimp).
The gnocchi was excellent- wow probably the best dish. Fluffy gnocchi with mint on top, which was a great layer. Squid ink with calamari was just okay. The lamb ragu special was good, but forgettable.
The ribeye was very heavy, but very delicious. Loved the egg on top. Cooked well. Buttery.
The salmon special was cooked well and was very delicate and flakey.
The magi stew was just okay.
Chocolate tort was thick and delicious. Panna cotta was well executed. Very smooth. The tiramisu was not my fav- they had a fruity take on it.
Overall, the food was great and we got tons of food. We were stuffed. Service was seriously off. Insanely slow start. We were there 2.5 with the first 45 minutes just ordering and getting our table set. They also accidentally threw out two of our leftovers!

I loved this place!!

The shop is really quaint and cool.
The town is the same.

I got a chocolate loaf cafe and a butter cake for Christmas.

The butter cake is similar to a cake my mom makes. It was a big hit for everyone that had some of it.

All of the bakers/employees seemed very friendly. I will definitely go back for all of my dessert needs.

They coming to my job and in south Reno!! It's so good I love the soup it's so flavorful and beefy with sweet French bread and butter it pairs great I will get extra next time!! It's the second time I've eaten at this truck and it can be a little pricey but with flavor like this the money is well spent!!

Loved this place--spooky and welcoming at the same time! Staff were warm and helpful, letting us know about all the products. And such products! Specimens skeletal, mummified, preserved in alcohol, and artistically redesigned; spooky and/or cute art prints and enamel pins; books; and generally delightful decor of all descriptions. Prices were quite reasonable for excellent quality items--a definite French Quarter must-see!

Tangier has a weird vibe.  It's a dive bar but it makes some stab at something bigger.  it's not really successful in that so I think they should wholeheartedly embrace the dark and go all the way divey.  They have pretty cheap options for beer, but they also have some good microbrews. I'm not sure about the food because I've never had it but I've heard it's pretty bad.  

Best yet, it was the first place I ever tried Knappague Castle which is a small batch Irish whiskey that is just lovely.  In fact, they carry a wide variety of small batch Irish whiskeys, which is unusual in a place that is definitely not an Irish pub.

Wow... just wow. I'm speechless right now so let me gather my thoughts. I'm moving to Philly so I'm out here visiting the city finding a place to live. Met up with some college friends and this was their recommendation. It can be a bit difficult to find since the main entrance is down a side alley. Walking in, I've never been to Morocco, but I feel like they probably did a good job with the resemblance with the decor. You're seated on couches around a metal table. They begin with everyone's hands out over a basin and rinse them with rose water. Towels in everyone's lap, which was nice since it can get a little messy. The courses are all set and the serving size was based on the number of people. First course was probably my favorite. It came with a large platter of cucumber/tomato salad, roasted vs braised eggplant, and cooled/marinated carrots. It comes with unlimited pita. I love loved loved the cucumber/tomato. Great texture. The flavor of the eggplant was amazing, as well. The next was this crispy pastry shell stuffed with almonds, eggs, and some other spices covered with powdered sugar I think. Great mix of sweet and savory. There was a lemon chicken dish next. I'm not sure if it was baked or made in a tajine. Regardless, it was ridiculously tender. There was a lamb or beef course next...we chose lamb and it was ridiculously tender, as well. The couscous course was amazing, as well. It was like eating pillows with a roasted carrot, potato, and grapes topping. A bowl of fruit came next...more just to cool everything down. The baklava was amazing at the end...seemed like it was made with rosewater and honey. 

It is cash only. Apparently, we asked them, and they had a large party a few years back that gave them fake credit cards and they lost out on several hundred dollars. Don't worry though. If you forget, there's an ATM down the down the street. I'm moving down in July, and this is definitely somewhere I'd take friends and family.

Tony and I went to Publix Super Market to pick up a few groceries. We were in the area and decided to shop here. 
We absolutely love the fact that this is a VERY CLEAN store..and we both agreed that the CHAIN of Publix are always the most clean stores we have grocery shop in.

We noticed all the employees carry a cleaning cloth with them. We noticed that there is always so many employees to help out.  They are so helpful.  The groceries are so well stocked and I love the flow of the stores 

The prices are a little more expensive. A few pennies here and there, and some items about .30 to .50 more but they have a lot of Buy ONE GET ONE FREE items.
I love the Bakery section, The Deli section, well actually all the sections.

The store chain could give lessons to other chains on how to keep their stores this clean and they Rock on Customer Service...
Others like Kroger's ((( which I love by the way)) should learn from them..

Great store..!!!!

Ezquidio is the hair master! This guy knows style because he loves what he does and is aware of today's trends and fads. 

Sometimes I have to settle for Supercuts and Cost Cutters but  when I come here, I know I'm going to get what I want and more for only 15 bucks.

If you want to get your cut by him personally, make sure you call for an appointment. 

I'll be back for sure!

From the start I had such a wonderful experience.  The store is bright and feels exactly what you'd expect for a high end bridal gown experience.

Amy did my initial visit and I lucked out because I was the only bride in the shop at the time.  It is common to have 2 brides at a time which, would have been totally fine with me but if you'd like it solo maybe ask if that can be accommodated.  She was very respectful of my price point and pulled dresses that really flattered my shape.  I didn't feel rushed at all.  Now I fit in most sample sizes, so I do think that helped my overall experience.

I ended up falling in love with a Michael Christopher gown and bought in January so I ended up getting a discount because it was their anniversary special!  I was also excited to learn that you can rent the beautiful stoles and covers that they have.  I'm so glad I did because it really added to the day of pictures!

Susan did my alterations and she was a rockstar.  My dress was very form fitted and satin so any little imperfection looked glaring.  But she made it look like perfection.  I got so many complements on the fit.  Also, side note, she let me in on some amazing advice that saved the day... BRING A MAGIC ERASER!!  After we did pictures I had some dirt on the dress and it cleaned everything up before the ceremony!!  I am forever in her debt for that little nugget alone.

Thank you guys so much for making me feel so beautiful on my wedding day!

I used Jennifers for my 11/16 wedding.  **So my experience was in the shop before the renovation into the new space.  So as a precursor, some of my experience may be a bit difference from the newly vamped shop.  But knowing Jennifer and Amy I'm sure it turned out amazing!**

I think I have a crush on my eye doctor. He smelled like cologne and bubble gum. Actually the combination of cologne and bubble gum is a good description of Dr Bryan. He's like a grown up kid.. he's a doctor but wears vans.. my kind of dude. Dr Bryan is so nice and patient I would tell everyone and their mother to go visit him. You can tell he loves what he does (as he is the co-owner of the store if I'm not mistaken) and it's expressed in every aspect of the shop. Everyone who works here is super nice and patient. I went in on a saturday afternoon when I could bring a friend to help me pick out a new pair of glasses. The woman working with us, Beth, couldn't have been nicer. She made me feel like she was another one of my friends just having fun trying on glasses. I never felt like I was keeping her from something more important or that I was being silly for wanting to try on.. "just one more...". I picked out a pair of glasses and couldn't be happier with them. Also a big shout-out to John who helped me on the actual day that I bought the glasses who encouraged me to try on "just one more.." to make sure I was 100% sure I wanted the ones I was going to buy. I think that modern eye might be a little pricier than your four-eyes or america's best but you're getting designer glasses - it's worth it! I don't think you over pay for what you're getting, they have quality stuff here. Also they couldn't have been better about getting me every discount with my vision insurance - which I appreciate to the max! If you need glasses or contacts get your butt down here quick! You won't regret it.

It really IS ALL THAT. Yes, it's small & loud - so if you come on a weekend call in advance and STILL be prepared to wait.

Chef RED did his thing tonight.  As did Steve, our server.
In fact, all the staff were "on point".  The sweet lady who gave us the marvelous bread (infused olive oil with a blob of lemon ricotta in the center) and kept our water glasses full is a doll. The hostesses even helped to clear plates.  Everyone pitched in and ran their asses off!  A great team.  We noticed and we love ya!

One warning - this meal is a diet-breaker.  Nothing we had was "light 'n healthy".  They should have an MD onsite to perform emergency angioplasties.

I had heard of Modo Mio for a long while - but when I tasted the Mozarella en Carroza at the "Taste of Philadelphia" event in July, I knew I had to come here.

Our party of 4 had the 4 course menu and everyone LOVED everything they had.  The house-made pappardelle with brussels sprouts, the bistecca, the skate wing - all of it.

Chef RED even sent out a platter with 6 glorious desserts on it.  Standouts were the flourless chocolate cake, tiramisu (theirs is light and wonderful), pumpkin bread pudding and home-made crusts, cookies, cremes and panna cottas of all sorts.

A near orgasmic experience at Modo Mio tonight.
Only one complaint, at 8:50 PM (We had a 6:45 reservation and were seated closer to 7 PM), they made us leave to seat the next table.  Politely.  Overtly.  But I only had like 2 sips of that wonderful coffee I wanted to enjoy.  Ah well - next time we will come on a weeknight.

WOW!!!!

Can't wait to come back. Can't wait to try Paesano.  (You do own that, right??)

Just the mention of the name Buffalo Billiards takes me back to the early-mid 90s when every summer weekend night ended up with a foray down 2nd Ave.  It typically ended up at Buffalo Billiards or the upstairs Havana Lounge where the cigars smoked and the swing band played.  Ah college!

After moving away for 11 years and getting a little above the age of the usual suspects down on 2nd Ave I could barely believe it when I heard that they were still open.  A friend decided to get togther at BB this weekend and I was pleased to "party like its '95" again!  

Thisplace has changed considerably from the old days but not in a bad way.  Downstairs is now a Dick's Last Resort so gone is the huge room full of pool tables and cute boys.  Upstairs where the Havana Lounge was is now the entirety of Buffalo Billiards.  Don't worry though, it is still a pretty sizeable bar!  The huge round bar still exists and these great big Samsung HDTVs are all around the bar.  (Bonus - they had the one in front of me on the NASCAR race!!)  Tables are also available on the left side of the bar.  In the back is another bar and two rooms with pool tables.  Note that you can reserve one or both of these two rooms for private parties (as I have for my December birthday)!  

They had good 90s rock playing (Soundgarden! Pearl Jam!  Alice in Chains!) which will take you back ,again, in a good way.  The vibe is chill and you can actually hear each other talk.  Drinks were strong - they were not playing around with these.  And all the bartender/bartendress staff I saw were good lookin, so you can have some eye candy with your drink.  Also noticed a dart board in the back too so you can challenge your friends to a duo of bar games (maybe a trio if you play quarters or something?  No?  But it's 1995 man!)

So yeah, I loved the vibe and the whole feel of this place and am glad I have it reserved for my birthday in a few months.  Give it a try if you are downtown and want to get away from crazy tourist traps and Irish-pub-dance-club places!

There's no question that this place is a little sketchy sketch on the outside...and while the interior is no gem either and little to no English is spoken here, and the kitchen is separated with a curtain, and both times I've been our server has been a minor and placing an order here is like picking a number out of a hat, and the most descriptive words on the menu are "three shredded stuff,"  I'm intrigued. This is not your typical Americanized joint. Is it fast? Yes, but that's as American as it gets. Portions are definitely generous and you won't find sweet and sour chicken on this menu...unless I read it wrong. Yelpers in the know of the legit Chinese food directed me CPH. I wouldn't have made it through my first experience without their guidance! 30 shrimp/pork dumplings, 1 pork bun, and 1 order or fried rice later, I got a good taste of MSG free Chinese Cuisine. While China Pasta House literally is a noodle house with most dishes resembling Pho or Udon dishes you can also enjoy Century Eggs, Gruel, rice dishes, Hot Pot and more. The noodle dishes are really soups and portions are huge and spicy here mean spicy, like a level ten spicy. While fellow yelpers broke a sweat over their noodle dishes I peacefully enjoyed my fried rice and Pork Bun. I'd never seen anything like it! So if you love spicy food then this place is for you. You're bound to run into Chinese students and families at this spot. For sure check out the the specials as they feature several soups that are on the regular menu and it's a good way to taste something new and not commit to full-sized entree.  
-If you're not super familiar with Chinese food, it's ok! I'm not either....read the Yelp reviews first!

When I think Chinese food this is what comes to mind. A huge menu of Thai, Japanese , and
Chinese cuisine. The amount of food you get for $50.00 is unreal I'm still digesting ! I love their Lo Mein. For apps I always get the vegetable Gyoza , vegetable spring rolls and for my meal i get the vegetable Lo mein.   Their sushi is awesome too. My girlfriend got the California roll, spicy tuna, and she got pork dumplings which is the only spot she eats them from. I prefer sitting down and eating here it's a nice feel and their waitresses are great. Def a great place for a cheap satisfying date or to take a big family.

One of the things I miss most about Indiana are automated carwashes. We don't have them in the Lowcountry. I went home looking for Mike's carwash. Well, they are no longer Mike's, but not much else has changed. This car wash is da bomb! I love the way my car looks after going through, and I love how they presoak your car before going through. This is an amazing carwash - a little pricey, but so worth it.

I have been going here for about a year and have have been very happy with my hair. My former stylists at a different salon was in a bit of a rut and kept giving me the same cut and escalating the price. I go to Jessica and she listens and provides guidance. I am always happy with the end result. I also love the shoulder massage. The price for a haircut and shampoo is a really good value. Bonus: they are neighbors with Goose the Market and you can get a post-haircut gelato.

My friends and I frequent this bar often and it is one of our favorite bars. They play good music and the bartenders are always friendly and fantastic! I love their Mexican candy and pop rocks shots. They also have seasonal shots, like the lucky charms shot that was available for St. Patrick's Day. It is outdoors, so it doesn't get stuffy and humid.

Five stars for Trader Joe's! This weekend I shopped without a mask on and the experience was easy breezy. 

Truth be told I shop at Trader Joe's because they are the only place I know of to get organic tortillas made with olive oil. I also love their organic wine choices for under $5, how do they do it? 

Now that I live super close to TJs expect to see me there often!

A 2013 update is in order.  

Basically, everything I've said in my last review of this place has held true.  I come here 2 or 3 times a year just to see how they are doing.  I love Indian food, but I tend to go to their competition up the street far more often for various reasons.  

I do think they've improved since my last review.  They've renovated the place.  It's much nicer now.  They still have the best naan I've had in the area which comes straight out of the oven perfectly buttered in a basket to your table.  I still think their dishes can be hit or miss, but lately they've hit more often than they've missed for me.  Still some great Tandoori Chicken they're serving here.  

I will knock them on one thing.  I'm noticing that some places try to do this.  They charge you the weekend buffet price, which is two dollars more, on Friday.  Now, I know of one Indian place not too far that puts out a bigger spread for that extra money.  This place does not seem to do that.  Or if they do, I sure don't notice it.  Because I went two days ago on Friday, and it was similar to what I always see here.  

Every time I want to like them more, they do something that irks me.  And again, this is why I only come here a couple of times a year as opposed to weekly to their competition up the street.

We stopped by here our first night because I found it was opened the latest. As we walked in a band was playing and there was a decent size crowd. Seemed like mostly locals in casual wear - some just bathing suit cover ups from earlier in the day I imagine. The service was great - drinks were pretty good and the music was good - 70's Rock. I'd love to go back.

Neat little spot on Freret. I knew I couldn't miss it after reading the cocktail menu online. My gf and I came here after a late night flight on a Friday. We got there around 10 and it wasn't too crowded. We sat on the adorably lit back patio; very cozy and clean! A great spot to go late night that's not a drunken mess. 
My girlfriend got the Pimm's Cup and I got a bourbon cocktail. Easily the best drinks we had on our whole Nola trip. 
Also, order the pimento cheese because whoa.
Removed one star for cost being slightly above what I'd expected for the area, and for the service being slower than expected for the size of the crowd. Still overall loved it.

I'm a known frozen yogurt addict but do love gelato! The galeteria is quaint & has a great variety of flavors! My favorites being amaretto & banana. Fresh, natural ingredients, yum! With no buttermilk like icecream, the gelato is a great sweet treat!

I go to Fleming's about once a year.  I know that while it will be expensive, all the food will be good, the service will be friendly, and the atmosphere will be clean and comfortable.

My friend and I sat in the bar - first at the bar for cocktails, and then moving into a bar booth for dinner.  Our server was efficient, although a little slammed with all the tables she had going.  Great deals for happy hour from 5-7 - they offer 5-$6 drinks, and 5-$5 appetizers.  

Taking advantage of the discounts, we shared the pork belly and tenderloin carpaccio to start with.  The pork belly was just okay - the best part of that plate was actually the creamy goat cheese grits that accompanied it - yum!  The sweet onion chutney was just not enough of a contrast with the rest of the plate.

The carpaccio was excellent.   It was a generous portion, sliced extremely thin, with capers and a creole mustard sauce on top,  with cheesy crackers to put it on.  My one wish would have been more 'bite' to the sauce.

For dinner I had the French Onion soup and the small plate of New Bedford Scallops.  This was one of the best French Onion soups I have ever had.  It was baked with both gruyère and parmesan cheeses, with a nice crispness to the bread inside.  The cheese topping was incredible, and the broth was flavorful without being too salty.

I liked the scallops, but didn't love them.  The sauce had flavor, but the scallops didn't really seem to.  I  know, I know, only eat steak in a steakhouse, but I'm a seafood girl!

For dessert  we split the carrot cake.  Since I am a carrot cake connoisseur, I will rate this one 6/10.  Very moist which I love, it did not have even close to enough frosting on it/in it.  I guess that's why they serve it with a side of homemade whip cream - there needs to be some sweetness to contrast the non-sweet flavor of the cake part.  More than just a tiny drizzle of dark rum caramel on the side was needed, too.

Final thought - GET WIFI!  Sheesh - close to the airport, close to many businesses - enter this century and make the upgrade - thanks!

Recently took the hubs to his first ever pro football game, Tampa Bucs versus the Philadelphia Eagles.  It was quite the game (Eagles won in the LAST TWO SECONDS of the game) and very exciting for someones first game.

The reason I gave the stadium three stars?  

It needs a facelift desperately.  It's an utter bummer that most of the games are blacked out in the Tampa Bay area due to the almighty dollar.  Even with the games being blacked out, the seats are not full to capacity for the Bucs games which I think was their plan.  Hmmm...if we black out the games, it would force fans to COME to the games.

But this is definitely a case of, "if you build it, they will come."

The experience of watching a game live is a tough one if you are only used to seeing them on television.  There are no commentators to guide you through the action on the field.  But, in other arenas I have been to (shout out to Giant's stadium in New Jersey -- Go Big Blue!) there is an ENORMOUS teleprompter that you can rely on for replays of the games action.  

Not the case in Raymond James.  The teleprompters/jumbotrons are decades old and in desperate need of renovation.  While the overhaul of the new stadium lends itself well to new food courts, the game atmosphere itself was not well thought out.

There is nowhere near enough parking.  We found ourselves having to head over to Hillsborough Community College to park in their lots and walking nearly six blocks to get back over to the stadium (buy a parking pass if you frequent the stadium often).  On the ground themselves, there is a lot of well tended grassy areas, so if you get there early enough to tailgate, there is plenty of room to spread out and have a picnic or even barbecue on the grounds (they allow that so long as you adhere by some of their policies -- see the website for guidelines of what you can and cannot bring onto the stadium grounds).

The new stadium though is lovely compared to the old one.  My daughter used to work in the food court of the old one and it was definitely dilapidated and run down compared to this one.  Expect to pay upwards of $7.00 for a beer and $4.00 for a small bottle of water.  

Overall, its a great place to go and cheer on your team, watch a concert or attend a soccer game.  Really not a bad seat in the house as the field is very visible from any angle in the stadium.

The 1 page menu is made up of several courses with the third course being the main course. You can select the $85 tasting menu, or order a la carte. 

Overall I enjoyed the experience, but I think that I prefer high end meals at other Philadelphia restaurants such as Tinto, and Bibou more. For the price I think I should have been blown away by more than one dish. However I decided to rate Laurel at 5 stars because my preference is based largely on my love of rich flavors rather than the skill of the chef.

The chef is a master of texture. It was interesting to have cauliflower that was puréed and more granular on the same plate. The gnocchi was the best of my life, and the hands down best dish that we had. Even without the pancetta it would have been amazing because the gnocchi could not have been lighter. I had the skate wing, but liked my sisters duck much better. The texture of the skate wing was perfect, but I didn't enjoy the way the flavors blended together because I felt that it was boring. If you appreciate light flavors that are seamlessly blended to create something new, you will enjoy the skate wing.

Service was top notch. Our server was extremely knowledgeable and personable. There was never a moment where we wanted for anything.

The atmosphere was intimate, and felt like we were dining in someone's elegant, and tasteful home.

If ever you've been confused by a review of mine where I gave a popular restaurant with high ratings a low star review... then come to Tito's and see why!!!

So far I've only tried the CHURRASCO SKIRT STEAK PLATE ($14) with yellow rice, but I honestly don't know if I will ever try anything else because it was SOOOO GOOD! Seasoned by angels and cooked with such perfection that I will absolutely crave this for the rest of my life! THIS, my dear Yelp people, is EXACTLY what I mean by "flavorful" seasoning. They have completely ruined skirt steak cooked by anyone else because I can't go back to anything less than this level of satisfaction! Even the Strawberry Banana Smoothie ($6) is excellent!

Tito's is currently located in an empty lot next to the Citgo Gas Station on the corner of North Jones Ave and West Waters Street, but this is also the location of their soon to be brick & mortar restaurant. So if you love New York style Puerto Rican cuisine, rush here as soon as possible and taste heaven on a plate!

2021 / 91

*Mobile Review*

Came here with NYU ADEA faculty and student doctors

Decor: 4/5
-indoor and outdoor seating (mostly outdoor)
-lovely weather but leaves may fall onto your food

Service: 2.5/5
-Service was average.
-Servers had missing or gold teeth
-overhyped, not impressed

Food Presentation: 4/5
Taste: 3/5
-BBQ Shrimp: did they put BP seasoning in this? the shrimp tasted rubbery
-Veal: not what I expected. small portions for the price ($30) and wasn't that great
-Banana Foster: the amount of brandy was too much. I have a sweet tooth so the banana and vanilla ice cream was yummy
-Pecan pie: warm and soft yet not too sweet. This was good

The average rating says it all. Don't expect much from this place. I wouldn't come back.

My favorite fried chicken anywhere, anytime. 

The chicken is crunchy, hot, and fresh. What makes it stand out is that the batter is seasoned so perfectly. It's not too salty or spicy, but has enough of a kick to keep things interesting.

I love the old-school vibe of the restaurant too. Simple, intimate, and always crowded, it's the perfect place to dive into the deliciousness on your plate.

I LOVE COSTCO. 

I have always loved this store, how could you not?! Not too long ago, I bought a sofa from here. It was my first time purchasing furniture from Costco, and I could not have had a better experience!!
I ordered my couch online since it needed to be delivered (if you buy furniture in-store, you're responsible to get it where you want it). Only one day after I bought my sofa online, they sent me an email to set up the date and time that they could come deliver. Turned out that they could deliver it that same week! 
From the time that I ordered it online to the time they delivered it to my apartment was a total of 6 days. For everything that my couch offers, leather, leg recliners, head recliner, USB charging, and embroidery stitching, it came for a GREAT price. The couch leather quality is stellar and the recliners worked perfectly. I'm in love with my couch and overly satisfied by Costco's customer service.

I'm not an expert on CHEESE STEAKS however I know when it's not good. 

I've come here ever since I was introduced to the restaurant. I love that it's been around for ever and they even serve the Grandmothers special peppers. They are seasoned peppers and I love them. 

The food here is superb even the hoagies but I'm here for the Philly Cheese Steaks!!! Trust me they are the best. The steak is tender and fine. The cheese is American and it blends well with the steak. I add onions and mushrooms and it's complimentary to all the ingredients. Oh I must mention how soft the bread is...I guess it's not gluten free but that's not a bag I carry. Anyhoo, I will say, be aware the meat isn't seasoned so ask for it.
