However, I feel like this dessert went down. Tried it again this past weekend and I didn't even finish it. I don't ever leave Bakery Bar goods on the plate either. It used to be stuffed with the fluff and now it just sits on the outside and the flavor was just lacking compared to the previous times I have had it. Still giving a five star review because this is one of my favorite spots, but disappointed in this one dessert!

This market is awesome! I'm a fresh food lover and love to support local businesses. You're going to find a variety of fruits, veggies, breads/pastries, cheeses, and seafood.

Reason I'm only giving it 4 stars: some of the stands are a little aggressive. Listen, I've worked at a farm stand and understand you need to sell, but not to the point that you're making potential customers feel almost forced to buy something.

Remember to bring cash!! Haven't seen anyone take credit cards.

Will be back to enjoy fresh produce.
Enjoy!

I'm in the market for a device. My usual spot doesn't have the one I was looking for so I called Primal.

Immediately, I am impressed with Anna, the voice on the other end of the phone. She tells me she has the exact product I need to solve my problem.

Her impressive sales skills (as someone who has spent their career in sales and marketing I am always impressed with those who do it well since far too many suck) as well as her knowledge about the unit. 

In fact, I drive almost 40 minutes just to get this product.  I was sold.

When I arrive, she shows me two choices from this company. She works hard to upsell me into higher priced $119 unit . She tells me ...it's her product of choice for her personal use AND almost every other staff member in the store.

So, you might think this was an out-of-the-park home run, right? Wrong again vape breathe!

I bring the unit home and read the ridicuolusly poor instructions. I realize Anna never really explained  very well HOW to operate the unit. But with the internet, I figure I could find a video or two which does a far better job.

The problem is the freaking unit is DEFECTIVE! I know I NEVER should have bought the floor model! The battery AND charger were beat. WE ARE TALKING JUST TWO DAYS AFTER I HAD IT!!!!

But the thing that REALLY made me change my opinion about this place was the experience I had in bringing it back

I had to give up an uneccesary 80 minutes of my life driving there and back because the damn thing DIDN'T WORK as promised! Hell, it didn't even turn on!

The woman behind the counter the day I bought it was there to greet me(I believe she is the manager)

It's obvious I'm not happy as I had the unit in the packaging with me.

HER: You having a problem with the unit?

ME: Nah. I just like to take this piece of garbage out to visit it's original home.

HER: Give me a minute - I'm with thirty five other customers and my co-worker is new.

I wait until she is freed up. 

She analyzes the situation and, after using a different plug, concludes the battery AND charge cord are not working.

THEN she says she will do the warranty paperwork BUT next time that will be my responsibilty.

ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME? I HAVE THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE  LESS THAN A WEEK AND YOU ARE DOING ME A FAVOR BY WARRANTING IT?

Then, she says : I CAN SEE YOU ARE ANGRY?

ME: Angry? Moi? 

OF COUSE NOT!

I just love spending $119 on a defective piece of crap that hasn't worked even a week. I love a company like Primal that doesn't give a rats behind ONCE the customer has bought a product but seemed so damn interested BEFORE the purchase was made.I LOVE a company that doen't stand up for it's customers AND I love a full dish of bad attitude and smugness served on top of it.

She handed me a new battery and cord LIKE THATS A BIG DEAL but then tells me next problem is on me to address with the company! And she adds, what do you expect, its from China!!!!

TOUNGE HELD!

See ya Primal!

You might have a great store but as long as THIS is the way you treat customers, I will find someplace else that appreciates my business!

If you enjoy waiting in line at amusement parks you will love the wait at MacDintons. Wait to pay your cover, wait to get your drink, wait to get into the bathroom... this place is a zoo! The $10 happy hour is a great deal, but by the time I manage to get my bracelet and stand in line at the bar for a drink I am lucky to get 2 drinks. Not to mention the happy hour rum & cokes taste like rubbing alcohol!  My suggestion is to skip the bracelet line and just order a beer. 

MacDintons is a great scene for the poor college student, but I have outgrown this crowd. There are so many better bars in South Tampa for young professionals.

I LOVE Time Market. For So. Many. Reasons. This place is truly excellent and quickly becoming one of my favorite places to spend time. Yesterday I enjoyed a glass of white wine ("planeta," a chardonnay blend featuring tasting notes of papaya and peaches; delicious) with their daily special of steak focaccia while sitting in the patio, enjoying the Tucson sunset. The afternoon/early evening vibe was the perfect way to end a slow Monday. The steak (I don't recall the cut, but I would guess skirt steak) was cooked to perfection, with each bite not overly chewy or fibrinous. Steak with chimichurri sauce can sometimes be a played out combination, but when executed this well, it's hard to complain. The focaccia was freshly baked, soft, warm... the perfect vessel for umptious protein.  

In general however, Time Market is great for so many other things. Obviously, they feature a variety of fresh organically grown produce, in addition to other artisan products (think cheeses, meats, etc.). Their pantry selection features nice arrangement of all sorts of goods, from different hot sauces, to spices used in any global cuisine you could think of. They also have an excellent wine selection, and is one of my go-to locales to purchase natural wine in Tucson (DM if you want to have a conversation about natural wine). 

Time Market is a gem in Tucson, serving as a great place to share a coffee and catch up with friends, do your weekly grocery shopping, or enjoying a nice meal on the patio. It has it all.

I recently left a Yelp review that voiced my disappointment in Chinese food here in the Old Pueblo (I believe I compared all Tucson Chinese food to Panda Express) and several Yelpers came to my aid and suggested some places I might try. A few nights ago, I tried one of them (thanks for the tip, Toni M.!) and I'm happy to report that I now stand corrected. Tucson does have delicious, authentic Chinese food, and it can be found at China Szechwan. 

There are two menus - one, which looks like the typical fare you'd find at many other Chinese restaurants, and a smaller menu full of magical items - like water boiled fish.Don't let the name of this dish fool you - the "water" that the fish is cooked in is anything but bland.  I like spicy food and have a pretty high tolerance for heat, but I'll admit the first bite of the water boiled fish caught me off guard. This dish was spicy! But once I got used to the heat, the other flavors easily came through - and boy, there were a lot of flavors. Garlic, cilantro, cloves, ginger, green onion, and plenty of smoky chile. I'm not sure what kind of fish was used (some variety of mild white fish) but it was delicious and soaked up the flavors of the broth along with the cabbage. The portion was enormous, easily three meals - and at $9.95 it was a bargain. I also ordered the green onion pancake, which was fresh, hot, crispy, and did not disappoint. I fully intend on revisiting this place and working my way through their enticing menu. 

The restaurant itself is clean and functional, but nothing fancy, so if you're looking for over-the-top Asian ambiance you won't find it here. What you will find is yummy food, huge portions, great prices, and friendly service. I highly recommend!

I'm so ashamed of myself for not yet reviewing this location! I LOVE the Brandon location ever since it opened. So when my parents moved away from Brandon and to Town n Country, I was glad to have this South Tampa location also.

Just as I (probably) said in my Brandon location review, Green Island boba is THE BEST and my favorite! I always compare other places to Green Island, and rarely do the others ever win. They just know how to cook the tapioca just right and make the drinks with the correct flavors.

The only thing is that this location does not have frozen yogurt like Brandon. So you don't get to add some fro yo to your smoothie to make it creamier. They also have separate rewards cards, so you can't use the Brandon punch card at the Tampa store and vice versa.

I feel bad for the girl who is all alone on her shift when I come in because I always roll in with friends and family aka almost 10 people. So she gets bombarded with our orders. Poor girl needs help! We always have to wait, so it's nice to have the games to entertain us.

Great little boutique with a nice selection. 

My mother has been frequenting this shop since the '90s - or maybe earlier. It's one of her favorite places in Santa Barbara. I remember coming in with her before the salon area had been added. I'd always been intrigued over the unique variety of merchandise along with how clean and orderly the place was. These both still hold true to this day. 

Skin Deep may appear to be a ladies' only place to shop, but the reality is that they do have a selection of mens' skincare items along with a good variety of unisex items. I love their Jack Black line and feel that this place has the best selection of their merchandise in town. They also offer an impressive selection of candles - I'm a fan of the Voluspa brand and you can find many of their scents here. 

I was in here not too long ago to make an exchange and felt that the customer service was unparalleled. The woman whom had assisted me was friendly and knowledgeable, and really made the process a smooth one. Skin Deep is open during Covid but is taking extra measures such as providing a credit card sanitizing machine which I felt was a smart idea. 

I'll be back!

This was my second visit to Ted's and once again, it did not disappoint! I was lucky enough to have Lance as my waiter again. He is an absolute hoot! He loves his job, which makes your dining experience so much fun!

The complimentary, freshly sliced cucumbers, mildly pickled were a great start to our meal. As for the burgers...um hello? It's bison. It melts in your mouth and is absolutely 100 times better than just a simple beef patty. I chose George's Cadillac. A bison patty covered in melted cheddar cheese, smoky bacon and BBQ sauce. It came with a side of fries and lettuce, tomato, pickle and onion to dress the patty.

Ted's has a number of different burger combinations, from the simple Naked burger to the Avalon, a burger with melted Gruyère with a hint of Bleu cheese, crumbled bacon and sweet caramelized onions, roasted garlic aioli and baby arugula. Let me tell ya...you can get pretty fancy up in here. 

OH! I almost forgot. If you're an ice chomper like myself...ask for their crushed ice with your drink. Da bomb.

This is my favorite store!! 

 Love the selection and choices of organics and health food items here.

The Deli is awesome. The choices for sandwiches and breads are varied.  I really like the meat department. I have placed orders for trout etc. and they call when my order is in. The butchers at the meat department are very knowledgeable and friendly. 

I love that there is a coffee shop inside this store. I also enjoy the famous quotes on the walls. The store has a nice feel to it. 

Raley's has eCart too now. I haven't used it yet but am dying to try it. eCart lets you order your food at home and a personal shopper inside the store does your shopping. Then you set up a time to go in and pick it up. You can even pre pay for your order. Your service fee may be waived if (A) this is one of the first five orders on this account, or (B) your final amount meets the requirements of a specific promotion. For more information https://www.raleys.com/www/promotions/promotions.jsp?contentid=4690570

I really like this place. Here's why:

The staff are great, and friendly, and pay attention that your beer glass is never empty, and are helpful with welcoming new additions to your table (always nice- they were accommodating on two occasions recently and I really appreciate that).

The beer list is extensive and has lots of local brews (Yards, Stoudts, Victory, Flying Fish, and Troegs seem to be the usual suspects so far), and it gets switched up enough to keep it interesting. A wine-drinking friend approved of their wine list , though I haven't examined it in detail myself.

The bar snacks are tasty (spinach dip on Yards pumpernickel bread? yes please! and fried pickles! oh my), and the full menu has a great variety (try the Mediterranean chopped salad- delicious and big enough to share), including a dish or two with ingredients from that morning's farmers' market... I love that!

Plenty of tv screens to keep an eye on the Phillies (or the Flyers or whoever else, I suppose), so it's a great place to watch a game... though I can't recommend sitting at the bar unless you're off in the corner, it gets crowded and people shout in your ear as they try to order drinks.

Swift Half gets two thumbs up!
I have never had anything but good experiences at this Walgreens. I love the drive up Rx pickup/drop off. I even got my flu shot at Walgreens. Everyone working there is very helpful and friendly

I love ramen and have been struggling to find a ramen home here in St. Louis. Thankfully I found Midtown Ramen. 
Their paitan style broth just makes me smile even as I type this review. 
For starters we tried the tempura vegetables and and a specialty roll of sushi, I forgot the name but it was delicious. 
I got the traditional hakata ramen with extra boiled egg. When I tasted the pork belly I wished I had gotten extra pork belly! They smoke the pork belly here and the smoke adds so much umami I almost can't handle it. 
They also have a nice selection of sake, and the cocktails were on point. Our waitress was awesome too, she kept our glasses full, table cleared of empty dishes and didn't even judge us when we slurped down the last remaining tidbits of yummy broth. 
You're missing out if you haven't checked out Midtown Sushi and Ramen.

A nice upscale New Orleans restaurant in the city center. I made a dinner reservation for 5 on the balcony but it was chilly in the evening. When I asked to be relocated indoor the staff had no problem with the change. Everything here that we tried was delicious, from the brown butter gnocchi, the maison salad, the pan-roasted duck breast, the grilled pork chop, the chicken tableau, but the most memorable dish was the mushroom risotto and I'd highly recommend you get that when you come here. It was very light and flavorful for it being a risotto and honestly I was very impressed. 

The only dish we were not impressed by was the millionaire tart dessert which was very heavy in the chocolate department. The chocolate ganache was very dense but if you love chocolate, this is the dessert for you!

I stopped in for lunch yesterday with my hubby and have zero complaints.

They're located on Maple very near Carrollton and in addition to the squeaky clean interior, there's ample covered outdoor seating. We chose to sit inside as we we had to get back to work and it was in the 90's yesterday. 

Our waiter let us know that we could sit anywhere we liked and brought over menus. Our drink order was taken and delivered right away, and we placed our food order at that time. I went with a small pepperoni pizza and my husband chose their chicken and portobello lavish. 

After just a brief wait our food was delivered and at first bite I knew we both had made excellent choices.  I loved my pizza. Really, it was that good. I love a sauce that's on the sweeter side and theirs fits the bill.  I know that lots of people have a crust or cheese thing, while I'm definitely all about the sauce. This one's a definite winner. All of the other components were top notch as well, and it was big enough that I had a couple slices remaining to bring home and snack on later.  My husband's lavash was delicious as well, and it was a very generous size.

Other info - there's a full bar and there are TV's around for those who might want to tune in while they dine.

Nice spot.

Summary: Beautiful space with friendly, attentive staff and deliciously flavored meals. A great concept for a restaurant in this generation--no tipping required. I love the idea that the owners are giving their staff a living wage and benefits to boot. (Tip anyway! Everything is great!)

I visited with a party of three others on Girard's second night open--11/22/14. The entire place was running like a well-oiled machine, which can be suprising for a place that just opened. 

The only hiccup of our visit was that there seemed to be some kind of misunderstanding for my friends order with the waitress... But I have to chalk it up to it being the restaurants second day.

I ordered a prixe fix meal because it was a great deal-- App, meal, dessert for fair price. I had celery soup to start--the flavor was amazing and not what I was expecting. It tasted like amazing thanksgiving day stuffing somehow. There was not a drop left in my bowl. I had the roast beef as my main--very tender--and the horseradish sauce was amazing. For dessert I had the chocolate tart. It was very good! But if you're not a huge fan of chocolate, I would either share it or get a different dessert as its one of those chocolate desserts that leaves you full after a few spoonfuls.

The rest of my party savored and  enjoyed their food as well. We all tried  a little of each other's. The avocado toast was sooo good! The flavors are so tasty--it was even a little spicy. The burger was amazing and the potatoes are so so good! I've been craving the burger and potatoes since we've been there. The philly muffin the burger comes on is so nice and crusty. I also tried my wife's pumpkin creme brûlée and it was amazing. It was smooth and light. We all also shared a charcuterie plate--amazing!!

I can't wait to return to try their breakfast foods--they're served all day! 

The atmosphere was lovely: the decor is modern--I like the yellow and black color palette. The space is cozy, but you don't feel like you're sitting on top of other diners--which I hate. The vibe is chill, but fancy. The staff is knowledgable, friendly, and attentive. The owners and lovely--the chef comes up with the best flavor combos! 

MAKE YOUR RESERVATION!

Love the new location! So much more space and less congested. Still has the adorable fairytale atmosphere.

Make a reservation and appreciate how it's expected to enjoy your time and not feel rushed to turn tables. 

Lots of white (compared to the pink OG location). Out door seating and so many twinkling lights. 

Order to-go at the bakery. Like the bakery set up. Easier to navigate through.

Got the brownie cheesecake it was AMAZING. Must try, and totally worth $6.

This place is totally groundbreaking. Without a doubt, my favorite lunch place in Santa Barbara and maybe the world. 

The menu may seem limited, but trust me, it's got everything it needs. The chicken crack bowl is so addicting once you try it, it probably is like crack. I assume that's why they named it that? The only issue I take with it is that the quinoa to kale ratio is a little off. No one needs that much quinoa, especially not in one sitting.  Also, the kale has been a little too salty lately, hopefully they will fix that. 


Their prosciutto open faced sandwich with goat cheese and arugula and onions and other amazing flavors is also a favorite. Also the avocado meets toast is absolutely incredible! Ahh I love this place, I miss it so much when I'm not in Santa Barbara. Everything here is good, I really want to try their chia dessert. I want to try it all. If you're in SB/Carpinteria area, you absolutely have to go to food liaison. They also have an incredible salad bar. 


The one downside here is that they are only open for lunch and only during the week. Please please please extend your hours and days

I love following Apocalypse Burger on Instagram because their posts always make me laugh AND make me hungry so I was excited to order some carry out the other day and give them a try. They open at noon on Saturdays so earliest order is ready by 12:20pm. By the time I picked up my food and drove home, it was almost one and I was SO HUNGRY!! I wish they opened at 11!! I was so hungry that I didn't pay too much attention to detail. It was a good burger and good fries. It was also probably overpriced for a burger and fries that were now lukewarm in my bag. I wasn't super impressed but also didn't have any complaints. I'll want to give them another try when I can eat the food as soon as it comes out and when I am up for trying other menu items.

I love The Eddy. It's one of my favorite places to have a group of friends hang out outdoors and it's dog-friendly! My only issue is one from a serving standpoint. I was here with a group on Friday afternoon at 4 pm and it was crowded, which is great I love when this place is packed because the energy is amazing. However, at the bars, there are always lines at the service stations. I understand that you can walk up to anywhere at the bar to get a drink but when there is only one bartender serving guests and the bar back is just prepping fruit the service timing is still the same. Just as someone who has worked in bars my entire life I remember getting in two hours prior to service in order to prep for the night that way all my attention can be given to the guests and I can make the most possible tips I can while I'm there. Also, the lack of servers on the floor at 4 pm when it's a Friday afternoon is not beneficial to the common goal of the bar making money and people wanting to drink after a long week of working. 

So this is just a long way of saying, that they need more staff and bartenders be a little quicker.

Red Lobster is a place I love to go to spend special occasions! Their lobster is simply the best & most fresh lobster around.  Their seafood is always cooked to perfection & never has a fishy taste. The Garlic shrimp was delicious, I love the garlic sauce that it was in. It was a pain to get into the crab legs, but the taste made them well worth the struggle of opening. My husband enjoyed his Lobster Alfredo, although not as much as he liked my meal!  Service is always top notch. It seems like there are lots of servers on the floor to keep things running smoothly. Everyone helps each other out by running food, delivering drinks, etc. My husband & I have spent our wedding anniversary & my last 2 birthdays here. The complimentary Cheddar bay biscuits are the "cherry" on top at this place! I always look forward to eating the yummy biscuits while I wait for my meal to arrive. Thank you Red Lobster for being a family favorite & a place that we always find ourselves coming back to!

Came here for a birthday dinner for one of my girl friends with a party of 10+! The space is small but we somehow managed to fit at a table along the window, which was great because we felt like we had our own little nook all to ourselves! Not to mention it was christmastime, so there was a huge wreath in the window which was great for pictures! 

The food here is amazing. In fact, I would have been satisfied with just the first two appetizers we ordered, which were the crispy brussel sprouts and the mushroom platter. I love homey, earthy food and this was just that! Warm, rich and savory, and melt in your mouth delicious. The American Wagyu was equally as satisfying (the crispy rice cakes really make the dish), but the pork chop special was somewhat of a let down.

Overall the service was great, the waiters really patient and knowledgable, and the food AMAZING! Definitely a must while in Philadelphia!

2nd visit - weekday lunch

This placed was packed again but no high school kids like last time (must have been a school day off last time we were here). 

Another good visit! This time I ordered the regular Cuban and a side of Tostones (smashed green plantains lightly fried). Cuban was good and loved the Tostones - never had them before but found these crunchy discs dipped in their Havana sauce (similar to ranch) totally addictive. BF also got a regular Cuban and fries - fries were the skinny shoestring type fried to a perfect crisp and seasoned with Lowrys - num!

Planning on trying a platter next visit (Arroz con Pollo or Lechon Asado have caught my eye). 

Same great waitress and great value for the price ($5.50 for Cuban + 1 side lunch special).

Dear T.M.,

Salsa is red, the Gulf of Mexico is (sometimes) blue -
I love all your shrimp tacos and your sweet potato fries (try it with the secret sauce on the table) and your turnip greens too.

Ok, a horrible Valentine but whatever. 

xoxo, EA

The greatest spa ever! I went here with somebody else. Walked past the Salon but I just used the Spa services. 

Located downstairs it is a beautiful place. Once you get out of your clothes and get into a robe you wait in the lobby area with comfy couches and a star lit ceiling. There is a big ball with water flowing out of the top of it in the middle of the lobby area. All of this is very relaxing. As you wait they offer you homemade Ginger cookies, water (with either cucumber, orange, or lemon slices in it), wine, and other refreshments as you wait. 

The first thing I got was a facial. It was very soothing and relaxing. Once the lady specialist was finished she wrote down on a card everything she used on my face and gave it to me. I had the option to buy them later when I left. 

Next I had a relaxing soak. It was a 20 minute soak and the water was very warm/almost hot. Very  soothing. The water smelled of lavender and other soothing fragrances. After that was over I finished with an hour Swedish massage. They really concentrated on spots that I wanted them to focus in on and they asked many questions before to make sure everything was okay. 

Once that was over I returned to the lobby and they told me to drink plenty of water. I felt so relaxed and I slept like a baby that night. This is the spot to be. This is where you will forget about everything and just relax. If you don't like their music just bring your iPod and you will be just fine.

These are just the things I received on my . They have many other massages, facials, scrubs, soaks, manicures, pedicures, and other things they can do to pamper your body. I would tell anyone to go here. If you want to go alone, with a buddy, someone you love, girls night, or for the bridal party this is perfect for anyone!

The smell was the first thing I noticed when I walked in the building. It took me back to middle school when I would go to the "all nighters" at the local skating rink ( you know what I am talking about Britt S). The smell of sweaty feet and popcorn. We were lucky enough to go on a night when they had  "Winter Wonderland" skating- lights off and a few Christmas trees scattered on the edges. Its about $10 per person and you can skate for as long as "free skate" is available. The actual rink was much colder than I expected and I wished I would have brought gloves. My date and I went around a few times and then called it quits. I think we were there for a total of 30 mins. Overall it was a good time and I am glad we can mark it off our winter to do list.

I love pho. I really do! Came here on a whim since we were in the area. You'd think that with a name called Pho Palace that the atmosphere would match the name, but it doesn't! Don't expect anything fancy,, but the space is large, clean, bright, and comfortable. Cash only is a bummer, but there is an ATM on site.

For the pho, you can choose Med or Large bowl. In other words, are you hungry or super duper hungry? The difference is only a $1! Luckily, I ordered the medium bowl ($6.75) because that large bowl was HUGE! Today, I felt like eye-round, brisket, and flank! At our table, we also ordered the house special pad thai (small portion, but good!), and a few orders of the spring and summer rolls. Our pho came out before the appetizer rolls, but I'm not complaining. I was excited for my hot bowl of pho! The pho was average at best, but the summer rolls were very good!

Decent place for pho, especially in this area.

Very good pizza! It's more like an upscale Pizza King. The breadsticks are okay. I don't think I would order them again but I truly loved their pizza! I also got a brownie oreo dessert and it was phenomenal. So good for you chocolate lovers! Good quality service. Will definitely have it again.

My first time here and already love it!!! The celiac selection is limited but still awesome. The staff are very friendly and really helpful. I love that they have the flat screens with all the information on the selections. We got a Groupon for a flight and a pint. It's a great deal and the staff are really helpful with helping select. Really clean and has great, comfortable seating. I love the butcher block tables. If you like craft beer, I would fully recommend checking them out.
Finally...a no fuss, non-corporate, cozy salon complete with great conversation with a stylist who's been doing his thing for a while. I love my haircut & I love this cute place.

The downtown art crawl is so fantastic for so many reasons.

1. Location: downtown but not near Broadway. You can enjoy being in the thick of the action without the tourists and the smells. The vibe of the lofts where some of the galleries are is so unique and fun.

2. It's free: yes, free! Also a free shuttle to take you from gallery to gallery.

3. Food/drink: some of the galleries have snacks and wine out for guests strolling through. 

4. Art: the art itself is so diverse, you can go to this event 4 Saturday's in the same month and see completely different things each time. It's not mundane or repetitive, it's new and fresh each time. Some of the art is available for purchase if you are in the market for a different style piece for your home or apartment. Some crazy expensive, but some absolutely affordable!

5. Culture: there are so many people who come out to the event, it's a great way to meet people who might not normally cross your path. 

All in all, a unique event and a lovely way to spend a Saturday night in the city.  Wear your walking shoes!

Why come here?

1) $16 dollars a month ($10 to start IRC)
Most gyms have monthly plans from $40-60. Other than an extra fee a few months into it, this is the most economical gym membership you can get. Technically, the USF gym is cheaper but I m not enrolling in class again there just for the gym lol.

I''ll be honest. I've tried other gyms close by like the old Gold Gym in City Plaza or Lifestyle Gym on Amberly (That one changes identities more than most folks change clothes. IIRC it's Captain Crunch now?). The problem with those places was lack of cardiovascular  machines. A lot of people would socialize there and hog the machines. Lame. (Also my wallet was stolen there many years ago and they were very apathetic and unhelpful in retrieving it)

2) Youfit has a boatload of treadmills,stationary bikes,ellipticals, and steppers. It's rare that one would ever have to wait for one. 
As you enter , there are cardiovascular machines on the left , weight machines in the middle, and "free weights" on the right. There is a group exercise room towards the left side that has been added in the time that I've joined(I haven't taken any classes there so I cant comment on them. Melony R's review goes into detail)

3) Another thing I like is that there are multiple hand towels/sanitizer stations around. I've only used the bathrooms a handful of times but they were mostly clean when I did. 

4) This is purely subjective, but as a comic book fan, I love the purple/green motif inside. Joker, Green Goblin, and Devastator would LOVE it here!
5) They are open during many national holidays (at reduced hours) 

Since this branch is close to USF, its mostly populated by a diverse crowd. . Regular or bigger folks attend without worry about feeling out of place with stylish soccer moms like those aforementioned gyms. 

The only negatives would probably be the parking lot. It is shared with a Hertz rental place and MD oriental market. I have had a hubcap stolen while working out once (Jokes on them. It was a plastic Walmart one)
While its not dangerous, I would use caution at night.

Overall, whether youre hardcore or softcore, its a great place to work out.

We got some to go for an office lunch, each of us ordering our own entree with a couple of appetizers.   I placed the order around 11:30am for pick up at 1:15pm and the food was just going into the containers as we were walking in.  I really liked that it was ready as close to the pick up time as possible to be as fresh as possible.  

I ordered the Classic Gyro with feta and fries; man-oh-man, it was BOMB.  The meat was tender and flavorful with the right balance of feta, lettuce and onion.  The pita was warm and pliable though I had to grab a fork about 3-4 bites in because of it's size.  The fries were pretty good considering they were in a styrofoam container for 15-20 mins.  I was a little upset that we didn't have ketchup at the office, but OPA saved the day by including some in my tray.  The Tzatziki was amazing.  So flavorful and lots of it.  Get some extra pita to go along with the order, they give you so much sauce.  The hummus was good too; very garlicky and I love that.  Over all I really want to have a dine in experience very soon.  Especially before 4:30pm because they have lots of lunch specials.

All hail Iron Chef Jose Garces!  I made a same day reservation - dinner for 2 at 9:30 on a Saturday night.  Top notch atmosphere, seemingly effortless service and bold food.  If you read nothing else, know that they are selling autographed copies of Garces' book Latin Evolution for $35 (what a steal!!).

We sat in the front dining room - cool yet dark in its color scheme, with shutter-lined walls for added perceptual depth and large high metal ceiling fans spinning slowly overhead.  I love the contrast between this room and the warm reddish-orange glow of the back dining room (mostly for larger parties). 

Francesco was one of the best waiters we've had in a long time!  At once his friendly disposition and knowledge of the menu made us feel at ease in his capable hands.  He informed me of special vegetarian options (tofu buns & red curry without crab) and made excellent drink recommendations (white sangria with heavy orange flavors for my date).  

Of the many dishes we ordered, the Red Curry Del General and Arroz Con Pato were our favorites.  Both portions were fairly large.  Only the Chupe was disappointing.  It had a slow poached egg inside which gave the dish a runny consistency - something that my boyfriend didn't enjoy.  The Yuca fries would make a great bar food, just be sure to stir up the dipping sauce in the bottom of the cup.

In general the dishes were mildly spicy, surprisingly sweet, less salty than Tinto and larger portions than Amada.

OMG! I think they add crack to their ice cream, it so darn good! 

Whenever my grandson comes over and stays with us, we must go to Twistee Treat at least once.

The ice cream here is of course sweet and very smooth, lots of vanilla. We like their hot fudge Sunday's, but my grandson loves Oreos mixed in to his. It's all good. 

Check them out, you won't be disappointed.

I stopped in today and thought this was super cool! This is my first experience at a place specifically dedicated to poke. I've had it a million times but wasn't sure what to expect here!

It's kind of like Chipotle or Port of Subs in that you choose a couple items and they mix it up for you. There are several base selections like rice or mixed greens (I went with mixed greens to stay a little healthy). Then you choose your protein like salmon, tuna, tofu, yellowtail, shrimp, etc. (I chose salmon). Then you choose your sauce like shoyu sesame, spicy mayo, and there's a couple others (I chose shoyu). Then you get to add toppings from a big list. The crab salad was stupid good, I could have eaten a bowl of just that. There's little veggies, seasonings, ginger, and so much more.

I loved almost everything about this. Service was speedy and super friendly, price was very reasonable, fish was fresh, toppings and mixed greens were fresh and tasty! My main complaint is the counter for guests to eat at was a little dirty but they were crazy busy with only two employees so I can't really fault them there. The food was picturesque, I had a hard time mixing it because my bowl was so full (YAY). My only other comment is just that I prefer when my fish has more time to marinate in the sauce which is more of a personal preference and isn't feasible in this set up.

Other than being super busy and a personal preference issue, I loved this! GET CRAB SALAD ON TOP ITS AMAZING! (Honestly, I'm on a diet and I think I was just all about the mayo)

The reason I love El Burro Loco so much is because it is good Mexican food.  It is also one of the few places that I can get a hard shell taco.  It's a pretty neat place and they also have a traveling mariachi band to entertain you.  Parking is tough but there is a garage around the corner or a parking lot around the other corner.  

We went because we really needed some margaritas.  He ordered the enchiladas and I got two ground beef tacos with rice and beans.  I have no idea why their rice and beans are so good but they are.  My tacos were great and it also came with some pico de gallo (sp) and sour cream.  I was going to ask him how his was, but when I turned to look at him, his plate was licked clean.  We thought about dessert but we were both so full.

Would I come back here?  You know I will.  If you see me there, come by and say hello.

Very disappointing.. I think my expectations were way too high! We sought this place out because it was on Diners, Drive-ins & Dives. Of course, Guy Fieri loved it. I, on the contrary, was very displeased. 
You walk in, and the atmosphere is fun and casual. There's bright colors, signs all over the walls, long picnic tables, and smaller tables for seating. You order at the counter. If you get a soda, or any other non-alcoholic beverage, they give it you right there and you're welcome to grab a table. If you order a beer, you have to walk to the next counter. There, you have to wait for someone over the age of 18 to serve your beer. It took several minutes. We stood there going, 'are we at the right counter? I see the beer. There's just nobody around to get it for us.' Finally, someone came and asked, "what did you have?" They entered the order into an iPad. Everything is in your system, and yet you have no idea what beers to give us. 
When your order is ready, they call your number. Most people walked up to the counter and grabbed their tray. We assumed our food would be delivered to our table, so when they called our number, we stayed seated, and they brought it to us. 
I ordered the Kid Brother Sampler: 4oz pulled pork, 4oz brisket and choice of 2 sides. I liked the pulled pork. That's the best I can say. The brisket was only 3 slices, with a 1/2 inch strip of fat running through the middle. By the time I trimmed the fat, I was left with very little meat. I chose hushpuppies and corncake for my sides. Both were terrible. The hushpuppies were very dark brown in color, and they tasted dry and overcooked. The corncake was different than what I expected. It was a pancake made of cornbread batter. Had it been executed properly, it probably could've been pretty good. It was not! It, too, was burnt, overcooked and dry. 
I will not be be giving this place a second chance.

I went back for an appointment last week after a year hiatus.  I was so taken aback by just how friendly the entire staff was from the front desk to the Eye Dr.  I got compliments on my earrings, and they were all just so happy and friendly!  Everything was explained every single step of the way.  I absolutely love the glasses that I got here 2 years ago, I drive to the other side of town to continue coming here!  It just truly struck me how incredibly sweet everyone was.  I had a last minute situation come up, and they even offered to waive the cancellation fee.  The best of customer service ever!

I LOVE the vegan section of Circle Food Store (off to the left after walking in the front entrance). They have AMAZING vegan donuts, pizzas, and sandwiches with a chill cafeteria seating area. They get adventurous with their vegan food which is always fun :) I highly recommend a stop here - Go find this hidden historic *vegan* gem!

All vegetables (not fruit) are 50% off from Jan 1 - March 31 every year!!!
It is a terrific deal and we now buy 95% of our veggies at Linvilla (includes tomatoes which technically are not a veggie).

Love the winter veggie sale!

Also in 2016 apples (many varieties) are 69 cent per lb!  Stock up!!!!!

If you're from NYC and are visiting New Orleans, GO to this bar. This was hands-down the favorite among my group - kind of has an East Village feel to it. Sure, the bars on the heart of Bourbon are a spectacle to experience, but if you walk a little further down to the quieter area, you'll find this place, which is kind of deceiving from the outside. It actually looks like a blacksmith shop! We came in around midnight on a Friday and there was a solid crowd there - late 20's, early 30's, non-obnoxious crowd which was a nice switch from most of the other places. Bottom line: cool scene, good crowd, friendly service - love, love, love.

Holy CRAP! We need one of these back home.............well then again no because I will be 400lbs.  I look forward to trips because we hit a lot of the places that we only see on tv commercials and it is so worthy of spending time and money at.  

Cold and sweet and half off after 8pm? oh yeah!!  Everything else is ok........I take that back I love their dogs and tots.  NICE!

I'm a fan!

I love Trader Joes- their prices for snacks and frozen foods is so great, and the quality of the food that I buy here is to die for. I love the free samples you can snag from the counter. I'd recommend the cocoa dusted toffee truffles- they are so good! And for some reason, I am addicted to their brand of string cheese- it's so good! Will be coming back here in the next day or so. 

The only reason I give them 4/5 stars is the parking- it's really difficult to bypass those who don't look when they back out of spots. It gets a little dangerous over there.

Ah, I see I have been beaten to this review by the other fellow Yelpers that I had my meal with, Alan L. and Joy W, but here's my two-cent anyway!

Decor: Small, intimate cafe-style.I went for dinner and I could see how this could have been some lively spot for lunch and then they immediately transform it to something a bit more intimate for dinner. Seating is limited to that one room and for that Wednesday night, most tables were filled.

Service: Our waiter was nice and accommodating. But I have to emphasize how LONG we waited for the food- one hour plus?! Not okay. If you had better food, you would have (maybe) been forgiven by my taste buds, but my stomach and brain did not like the wait at all! And there were tables who got there later than we did and got served first (though they still had to wait a substantial amount of time.) Not a fair policy at all.

Food: 
- I got the beef linguine special, which I found nothing special at all. The pasta, I could tell, was homemade because of the nice chewy texture, but the beef, sauce and the toppings were very so-so. The goat cheese was also overpowering- goat cheese, being such a pungent cheese, needs only a small amount or else it would overpower all the other ingredients. And since the pasta had no taste and the beef didn't have a flavourful sauce, the goat cheese drowned it all (I had to push it all aside). 
- Wine was only $3! Granted, it wasn't great wine, so don't get all your hopes up, lol. I wonder if the wine was (relatively) local too...?

Overall: I'm so disheartened by this place, because I love supporting locally-owned places that, even better, serve locally grown food. But Local Harvest, oh, how you disappointed me so!

This might just be my favorite cafe in New Orleans. Amazing coffee and treats, as well as a calming atmosphere with rustic decor. There are a few seats in this dreamy little nook of coffee heaven, but it's mostly just a grab and go spot. Great vibes all around and I will most definitely go out of my way to grab coffee from here. Love.
Seafood lovers unite here and enjoy wood grilled lobster, shrimp, and salmon! The portions are perfect for the price. The menu is wide and satisfies my seafood fix!

So I had it again with fresh onions.

Compared to Tony Luke's roast pork (my favorite), 
1. it's juicier
2. it's bigger (more meat)
3. it has much better bread (sesame-crusted and crustier)
4. the wait is much less painful than Tony Luke's which can take about 20 minutes to get you the sandwich on a crowded day (really not sure why it takes so freakin long).

But I prefer the Tony Luke's roast pork taste. John's Roast pork sandwich has very heavy pork smell to it; not sure if they use less spices to kill the smell...but I guess to some folks who love the porky smell, they'd like this aspect of the sandwich. Be sure to get rabe and fresh cut onions which helps to cut the smell down a bit.

This truly was one of the best dining experiences of my little life so far. The turtle soup is as good as everyone says, the pecan encrusted fish was dreamy, and the souffle was puffy and chewysweetspicy and I could eat it every day. The champagne and wine recommendations were crazy good. 

Most outstanding and noticeable of all is the quality of service at Commander's Palace. Nothing compares. Everyone who wants to work in service should train here. Every single person we walked by who works here in any capacity gave us an incredibly warm welcome like we were dear old friends and beloved regulars. Every person at our table of 10 received personalized recommendations and considerate, focused, attentive care. The way each course is served, with synchronized, balletic precision, is breathtaking but then the moment your plate is placed in front of you, your waiter checks in with you to make sure you have what you need in this distinctly Southern, friendly, unpretentious way that makes the choreographed moment so much sweeter. 

The design of the original dining room took my breath away, and the garden room was lovely too. I'd love to eat at the table in the wine bunker someday, but since the president sat in the garden room I can't imagine who this even-more-exclusive room is reserved for... Beyoncé probably. I can dream.

Such a treat to eat in such a charming and historic place on the river. The staff is wonderful and the food is delightful. We ordered the 
Grilled Portobello Sandwich with was amazing , Mini Cheesesteak Spring Rolls- so cute and yummy , Crab dip with fresh hot soft pretzels .... I loved that .

Please enjoy the river views and views from the old charming windows in general. It's a cute place. Sweet old charming historical art.... and old antique till. The bar area is so cute and cozy. Good for chats with your pals. Nice for a cozy date too. 
I wanna go back.

A friend of ours told us he had the "best burger of his life" here. That's a statement, so we had to check it out for ourselves, especially since we recently committed to a vegetarian diet. 

I concur that their lentil walnut burger is the best vegan burger I have ever eaten (and I've had a fair share!). They truly make it "gourmet." The innovativeness of beet ketchup, coconut cheese, and chickpea mayo blew me away. Even their bun was tasty and didn't feel like a cheap filler. It satisfied me to the depth of a real burger. 

Service was a little blasè, and I was disappointed their kombucha flavor was coffee based when I was craving something more fruity and refreshing. Luckily their burger is good enough to keep me coming back, and I love that vegan ice cream is the next shop down!

Location, location, location. Loved this hotel for concert (or hockey games). Park in the hotel garage, party in your room or in the hotel lounge and head across the street a few minutes before the show. A lifesaver in cold weather or rain. The hotel had great decor and friendly staff in the lobby. But agree the rooms can use a refresh.

My favorite pho restaurant has now opened its second location! I love this place!  If you have never had oxtail before...you are missing out on tremendous flavor! The Vinh Special has oxtail, meatballs, and thin slices of beef.  It's very flavorful!  My go to appetizer is the Shrimp sliders! It has fresh, pickled veggies.  The shrimp is flat topped grilled.  I love having jalapeños on this!  The creamy Cajun aoli gives the slider a touch of spice.  I liked the lemongrass wings but I didn't love it! It was a bit salty for me.... 

Overall, I will be back over and over and over again! Best thing is I don't need to go to New Orleans to eat at my favorite restaurant!

Chef Bye has crafted something incredible with Ampersand 27--a stylish and unique concept that feeds off a family dining experience, variations in texture, and edgy menu items that offer just the right amount of daring. I came, I ate, and I was charmed.

There's nothing quite like walking into a stunningly decorated restaurant and being presented with two plentiful charcuterie boards: wooden platters overflowing with an abundance of Ampersand 27's specialties. Cheddars, bleus, chevres paired with mounds of your favourite salumi: chorizo, prosciutto, genoa--accompanied by pickles, mustards, grains, and the most decadently creamy duck and chicken liver pate you'll ever taste.

As part of their media event, I was subject to a flurry of tastings from their menu, as per below.

Beet Texture: A dainty salad of roasted, gelled, and crisp beets, served with sous vide and goat cheese ganache. Beautifully different for those who don't usually eat beets, or who generally think all beets are served pickled. I thoroughly enjoyed the sweet and savoury flavours of this dish.

Confit Parsnip: Sliced parsnip served with gremolata, pine nut, red pepper dust, and jam. A creamier take on the average parsnip and one that combined flavours together that were completely new to me. A nice dish, although I did prefer the Beet Texture.

The Living Salad: Ah, The Living Salad. Order this and you'll be presented with a mini tree trunk hosting a plant pot of local micro greens and a jar of cold pressed canola emulsion. And scissors, so that you can harvest your own salad. It's a really cute concept, especially for those who think the novelty of cutting your own salad at dinner is exciting. For $15, though, it's a fairly pricey novelty--especially for just a handful of micro greens.

Maple Butter Pork Belly: It's pretty difficult to screw up pork belly. Add some maple butter and Chef Bye's inimitable talent, though, and you've got a winner of a dish. A true homage to the south, the pork belly was served with southwestern mesquite corn, baked beans, green peas, and fritters. Lovely and savoury.

Pastrami Pork Cheeks: I feel like this dish is Chef Bye's sharing menu's understated pièce de résistance. Coming out under a glass dome (reminiscent of the one covering the rose in Beauty and the Beast), the pastrami pork cheeks are unveiled amidst a heady, charcoal-scented haze of smoke--the smell of which will incite memories of barbeques, smoked meats, and everything good and smoky and tender. Served with braised red cabbage, rye spaetzle, and sauerkraut creme, this dish is delicious and exciting. I strongly recommend giving it a try.

Seared Albacore Tuna: Almost every restaurant in Edmonton has a version of seared tuna or tuna tataki at the moment. It's become a popular dish, particularly for those who aren't quite ready for sashimi but want the flavour and texture of not-quite-cooked tuna. Ampersand 27's version takes the seafood aspect a little more seriously than most, serving the tuna with pickled hearts of palm, citrus, seaweed, and cashew puree. The result is a seared tuna dish that's a little more fishy than I'm used to, but that combines some interesting textures and flavours together that will surprise even the most veteran of seared tuna-goers.

The Seashore: This dish offered scallops, prawns, smoked trout brandade, and sea asparagus. A lovely option for seafood-lovers, The Seashore combined some of my favourite under-the-sea items and made them taste spectacular. Scallops. I'm always for the scallops.

Rocky Road: For dessert, we were treated to a taste of Ampersand 27's Rocky Road, a selection of "rocks" that have a hard shell and liquid interior and are served on edible "moss and sand." In continuation of the restaurant's attention to textures, this dessert is unique and delicious with a beautiful presentation. The "rocks" come in chocolate, mint, mango, and lychee flavours.

Neaveau Misu: The restaurant's most popular dessert is a modern take on tiramisu--a toffee pudding served with coffee caramel, amaretto, hazelnut, and brown butter, topped off with a side of macaron and ice cream. Bring me any kind of toffee pudding and I'm satisfied, but this one was exceptional. This was my favourite dessert of the evening.

Citron Bleu: The Citron Bleu is a light, delicate serving of lemon buttermilk mousse alongside a portion of blueberries, earl grey gel and milk crisps. Lovely and sweet, this dessert is a must-try for those who like fruity and tart flavours.

I was very impressed by Ampersand 27. I strongly recommend this restaurant with one small word of warning: it isn't cheap. A single charcuterie with two meats, two cheeses, and a few accompaniments can easily shoot past the $20 price range into the $30s and $40s, depending on what you order. Sharing plates range from $11 to $19 and the full meals start at $23. It's not overpriced, by any means, but be wary of those charcuterie boards if you're on a budget.

I waited a good 5-10 minute wait for someone to notice me at the counter. This is so pricey for the portion of food. I ordered a soy sauce ramen with no vegetables with teriyaki chicken on the side and karaage chicken. Also a sprite which was like $3 for a clear party cup filled with ice. In all, my total came to be $20.52 including tax. 

The karaage chicken is worth it to be a meal of its own since they give you a giant portion for $7 along with a kind of vinegary soy sauce. Very crispy and not good if you keep it for leftovers later. 
The soy sauce ramen was probably the saddest ramen I've seen. Even my instant noodles had more noodles and soup than that bowl. The noodles looked exactly like instant noodles, but at least the broth was flavorful and light enough to drink. 
The teriyaki chicken was so good! So tasty! It was somewhat sweet and vinegary and the chicken was tender. I loved it!
When I had leftovers, I tried so hard to chase them down for a bag, I really thought they were avoiding me as I walked towards them!!
The best corn chowder ever !! I also love their sandwiches! Sooo good :) I can't wait to come back! Portions are big but they are so good just take it home !

This is a very nice special occasion place to take groups and loved ones.  We started in the lounge upstairs which had a nice relaxed ambiance with jazz music playing in the background.  The French martini was very nice.  We were seated in a nice spot in the main area of the restaurant.  We ordered the cream asparagus soup, mussels, Rockefeller oysters, whole fish entree and the special of the night - rack of lamb.  The portions of everything were rather large, including the appetizers.  All of our dishes were cooked nicely and well prepared.  Our server, Steven, was extremely attentive and interested in how our experience was through every course.  We loved the live music even though it was hard to keep a conversation going at times.  We would like to come again for another special event.

Love this place! Second time here. Today I was in the area and remembered how good they were when i went last time. It's situated in a little strip mall next to Marshalls and HomeGoods across from PJs. I came here after I had a poor experience somewhere else which left some of my nails damaged. They listen to your needs, they are pleasant and don't talk amongst themselves in a different language which can be uncomfortable at times, they don't rush through the job and they are reasonably priced. Got a gel mani today. Will definitely be back even if I have to travel a little farther out.

The portions at Nitallys are so big! My bf got a burrito and he literally received two burritos when he got his meal. My pad kee mao was easily two meals. I love the flavor of the noodle dish that I got. I got to try the burrito too. We put lots of the house hot sauce on our food! Other than the food, the restaurant is decorated so boho style. There's Dream catchers and paper lanterns. So quaint!

I have nothing but praise for Joe Strauss my sales associate. He was very knowledgeable and polite. I looked at a 2015 mustang for my wife. The price was substantially below retail and still under warranty from the factory. I brought my wife to to look at it and she liked it but didn't think it was right for her. I emailed Joe and let him know we wouldn't be doing the deal. Two days later he says the car is ready for pickup. I tell him we weren't doing the deal. He was good with it. My wife decides she wants the car because we can take it back if she doesn't love it. We get the car and two days later she doesn't want it, so I call Joe to,let him know we're bringing it back. He's fine with that. Anyway, I decide on the way back, that I'll give them my car and keep the mustang. Joe is, of course, good with that too. I go back on Monday and they had to do all the paperwork over again but they did it and Joe even came into work early just to make sure everything was good. He is absolutely one of the best salespeople I have very dealt with. 

Now, about that missing star. When you advertise a car as looking like new, it should look like new. New cars don't have wheels that aren't spotless. New cars don't have door cards that haven't been at least wiped down to remove marks. New cars don't have dirty rear windows, dust on the tops of the back seats and a rear view mirror that was so dirty, I thought it was condensation. These things might be acceptable at the local $5 car wash. Not at a place that says the car will look like new. 

Step up your game, just a bit. OK?

I've missed having a Baton Rouge location so of course when I had business to take care of in New Orleans this was going to be my go to lunch spot. I had the really damn good nachos & my husband and I split the 4 taco order. The shrimp with chili glaze is my fav. He had the beef brisket and the Carolina. All perfection! Even the rum punch with all the fruit garnish. Waiter was super nice & very attentive. Parking was on the street of course, but not hard to find a spot. Lovely place with great food. Thanks for a wonderful lunch.

Great new healthy food concept, decided to give it a try while visiting family in the area.  Decor is bright and inviting.  Menus available as you walk in.  Ordering was pretty straight forward if you choose one of the suggested menu items, they asked if we wanted everything that was designed to come with it, much appreciated.   The ingredients on display looked fresh and appealing.  I loved the creamy tomato soup made with pureed cauliflower, really rich without the heaviness of a traditional cream soup.   My salad was mixed thoroughly so that the dressing coated all ingredients.   Hard to see the menu beverage board, I think this is just how the building was designed, but not good from a selling standpoint.   Overall it was a really positive experience.  I think to make it better, more attention needs to be paid to the dining room area, there was several tables that had not been cleaned up and debris on the floor.  Also, as a new concept, it would be nice to be greeted and asked if we had been there before, it is an opportunity to better explain how the menu and ordering work.

I love going to the zoo but the best time is during the Xmas lights at the zoo!  Hot chocolate, holiday lights, and of course, the animals!  The dolphin show and dome are one of the best stops. The rhinos are my favorite though.  The zoo is starting to do more special events but I would love to see them continue to grow these adult only evenings like some other nearby cities are doing. I haven't made it to see the sloths yet but hoping to make it there soon!  Looking forward to seeing what they do with the land they just bought nearby.

United Cab has restored my faith in mankind and cabbies everywhere!!! This review is about TWO experiences. My boyfriend and I were in New Orleans for Mardi Gras 2014. We were having a great time partying, foodie adventuring, spending time with old friends & seeing the sights (it was his first time in the 504). It was Lundi Gras, we were determinedly weathering the brutal 30 degree winds coming from the Mississippi River while enjoying downtown festivities. I had only consumed 2 beverages and somehow managed to lose not only my photo ID, but later that evening upon arriving back to our friends home, my boyfriend reluctantly informs me that he doesn't have his phone. (his iPhone 5 with a life-proof case and all the photos we had taken the whole weekend- he is not tech savvy and up until recently did not have his iCloud enabled, which means 'find my phone' feature was also disabled). Ughhhhh. Talk about frustration. He told me he had it in the cab. So it must've fallen while exiting.  
Let me rewind a bit and preface our frustration by saying that in all the rush that comes with parades, it took us nearly two hours to find a cab, and when we finally did we were so excited and exhausted that we literally didn't notice the cab company, drivers name or car number. Yikes! Picture me on my phone at 2am frantically calling every NOLA cab company I could find on yelp. All I could remember: male driver & black/white striped minivan. The dispatch operator assured me she'd send my info to any drivers on duty that night. And even gave me a lost & found number to call the next day. Well come that morning (Mardi Gras morning), I still hadn't heard anything. And my call to lost and found proved fruitless since pretty much EVERYTHING Is closed on Mardi Gras day. I forgot that it's a friggin national holiday in these parts. Feeling defeated and irritated about losing so many memories AND having to spend another $500 on a phone, we decided to just stay in. Avoid the cold rain. Straight up drown our sorrows. As we're sitting on our friends sofa, catching up on 'The Walking Dead season 4, we hear a knock at their front door. I was hesitant about answering since we don't live there but my boyfriend's curiosity got the best of him. He answered and I turned to see him walking out the door to follow this man. This peaked MY curiosity so I got up, ran to the door, and what do I see???  The cab we rode in the night before sitting in the driveway. THE CABBIE BROUGHT OUR PHONE BACK. Apparently he had our address in the GPS and said another passenger found it and gave it to him. WHATTTTTTTT!???? I have never heard of anyone ever ever ever having an iPhone returned to them, especially while on vacation.  Thank God for the cold rain that day, thank God we decided to stay in!!!
IT WAS OUR MARDI GRAS MIRACLE!!! We tipped him generously, but again, forgot to get his name. Wahh Wahh. 

Our second experience was on our way to the airport heading home. Our driver's name (we were sure to get it this time) was Nancy. She's been with the company for like 20yrs. She was lovely and chatty and so personable. She even gave me her cell number to call her next time we're in town. I definitely will! Thank you Nancy and all of United Cab! Amazing service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

PS I never did find my ID, but replaced it soon after. About time I invested in a Florida ID anyway. ;-)

ZolliKoffee is a great and welcomed addition to the Jackaloupe Brewing company.  I love the opportunity to have a different brew under the same roof.  Plus, whenever the food trucks are posted in front of the brewery, you are guaranteed for some exceptional cafe fare.

First off, the iced coffee is my favorite.  They use Klatch coffee which is amazing.  The coffee is cold brewed and is not acidic to the taste.  My second favorite is the Chai Lattes.  They make their own blend so it is very unique.  I like a Chai that does not overpower the taste buds.

All the pastry treats are homemade.  I love the rice krispy treats with chunks of chocolate and the chocolate muffins they have on hand as well.  When I am not binging on chocolate, the sandwiches are also a favorite of mine.  I love the Turkey, Cheese and Habenero Pineapple Sammy.

This is a great place to go if you want to entertain guests that like both beer and coffee.  It is literally the best of both worlds.

Also, I belive there is a $4 credit min on cards.  Bring cash if you just want a cup of joe.

I've been to the 12 South location several times and have loved it. So when I heard they had a second location, I had to go. The new location is on Charlotte so it's much calmer than 12 South. I recognized the building right away because it very much resembles the 12 South building. The best thing is they have a big parking lot! You should have no problem finding a spot. 

When walking in, it's about the same setup as the other location. You grab a menu, walk up to the register, and order your food/drinks. You order individual tacos so you can try several different types. They take your name and then you sit wherever you like. I love the interior of this place. Very clean and simple but beautiful. I especially love the patio area. It's heated in the winter and it looks like in the warmer weather they can open the windows. 

Within 5 minutes of sitting down our chips and queso came. My favorite part. Their queso is soooooooooooooo good. I dream about their queso. 2 minutes later, our tacos arrived. I always get the brisket tacos. So juicy and delicious. My boyfriend got the Memphis taco and an enchilada. The enchilada is smothered in a red sauce and cheese. Yum. Everything was so good and it's all at a great price. The staff is always really friendly and the owner has greeted us at both locations. I love love love this place and will for sure be a regular.

Love hamburger Mary's and although my home one is in Chicago, this place was no exception to my love affair - great atmosphere(if you love the drag queen scene), good food(can't go wrong with all the different types of burgers they have) and good show. 

Only difference between this one and the one I normally go to in Chicago is that the crowd is a little bit older which makes sense as it's in a suburb of Tampa and not the heart of one of the prime gay neighborhoods in Chicago. I had a great time and even got called on stage to 'twerk it'. Free shot too!

#winning

Out of all the restaurants I visited in Clearwater, Columbia was definitely one of my favorites! We had a group of 12, so a friend called ahead to make a reservation. Fortunately, it wasn't too busy and we didn't have to worry about not having a table. I do wish we had been seated on the porch next to the water because the views were so beautiful! 

We had one server at our table and she was outstanding. Our group started off with two different sangrias. I LOVED the white wine sangria. You can order a pitcher that has enough for 4-5 glasses. It was the perfect mix of sweetness and I love that our server mixed it in front of us at the table. It definitely had tons of alcohol, but you could barely notice it.

The menu was had a variety of options. The first few pages had tapas, then moved to entrees. I am a huge fan of croquettes, so I got the special lobster and crab croquettes. They were absolutely delicious. The inside was warm and the outside was very crispy. It was a huge hit at our table. Someone ordered an appetizer of tomatoes and I was pleasantly surprised at the flavor of the dish. There were a few other tapas plates that I tried that I can't remember off the top of my head, but I don't think you will be disappointed with any option.

Everyone who tried the paella raved about it, so I chose the seafood one. I'm not a huge fan of paella, but I actually liked it. WARNING: this dish is huge and probably good to share between 3-4 people. Unfortunately, I was so full after the tapas that I felt like I barely touched this plate! My friend had one of the fish dishes, and I loved that the fish was soft and easy to break off with a fork.

Definitely a must try in Clearwater if you're looking for a fancier dinner!

My first time at this venue was to see Alabama Shakes in their courtyard. At first I was miffed because it was standing-room only, but it really worked. The setting was intimate, making this one of the best concerts I've ever attended! I was definitely not expecting to be standing so close to a band that I absolutely love. 

They had outdoor bars set up, so drinks were easily accessible albeit expensive.  The restrooms were inside but unfortunately, they were leaking this night, so the floors were sopping wet with ladies in there trying to mop it all up, making for an overly crowded mess. Despite that, the place has a lot of character inside and it was so nice to enjoy good music al fresco. I will be excited to attend another concert at this venue in the future.

This review isn't for the golf course, but for the lodging.

  We rented The Casitas (thanks to the positive reviews from Yelp).  Our 2 - bedroom with a kitchenette for 2 adults and 3 kids under 11 was definitely worth it's weight in gold.  
The views from our second floor room overlooking the golf course and surrounding areas were astounding. The workout gym was decent and the pool /hot tub was even better. They even have a machine for people with body movement issues available for lowering in the water. 

   Everyone from the cleaning staff to the security guard at the front gate seemed friendly and in good spirits. 

What I didn't like:
- The bugs. I understand; it's near the mountains, nature and all of that.
It wasn't anything too bad, just a few spiders and some ladybug-sized critters. The room provided bug spray and we took advantage of that.
- Streetlights, or the lack of them. I also get it's an exclusive club; maybe streetlights bother some, but at night especially out there, it would've been nice. The parking lot also, but that gets a pass because  they provided lit walkways.

What I loved:
The digital thermostat; high tech, just like on TV and the movies!! (Sorry, I geek - out at the littlest things!).

Overall, we had a great time here. Highly recommended.

I know I shouldn't judge a place for something they're not known for, but I'm about to do it. My boyfriend and I went to Lafayette Square for a house tour yesterday and wanted to get brunch beforehand. Square One's brunch menu sounded really good, so I made an OpenTable reservation the night before. We were seated quickly, and the service was generally stellar throughout the experience. Unfortunately, the food was not. We ordered a Belgian waffle to share which was okay, but not outstanding. I don't know if it needed more butter in the batter or what, but it is not often that I am dissatisfied by a waffle. The real trouble came with my main dish. I ordered the Irish Skillet (I think that's what it was called) which was supposed to be corned beef hash with eggs. I am a CBH aficionado, so I was very much looking forward to it. Upon taking my first bite, my excitement dwindled. I kid you not...the hash was so spicy my nose was running after two or three bites. I have no idea why it was so spicy because the menu mentioned nothing about heat in the dish. Granted, I absolutely LOVE spicy food and the idea of hot corned beef hash is kind of intriguing, but this was so spicy that it was painful. It was the kind of spicy that you regret, and I did. I asked our waitress what made it so hot, and she said it normally wasn't and they must have over-seasoned it. Even before we got up to leave, I knew that heat would haunt me during our house tour, and it did. I had heartburn and indigestion for most of the day which really sucked. I have rarely in my life wasted food, but I didn't even take my leftovers as it was just too hot and my stomach was already upset. Generally, if I order really spicy food, I know there is a possibility I will suffer for it. What sucks is I didn't order spicy food, at least according to the menu. I will be back in the future to try the beer, but I will most certainly be skeptical if I'm ever ordering food again.

My fiance purchased my engagement ring from Zales summer 2018. We are big Disney fans so when Zales released their Disney Enchanted collection, he was all over it. He proposed to me with the TinkerBell ring and I love it. Fast forward to a few weeks ago. My fiance wants to pick out a band for himself. He finds a beautiful tantalum ring in his size and looks great on him. Last night, on a complete whim, he says "let's go to Zales, I forget what that ring looks like." We get there and the store is so brightly lit, the diamonds are sparkling like crazy! The girls who were working, (I am completely blanking on their names but the date was 10/15/19) were amazing. They showed us his ring and I got to pick my band, another from the Disney Collection. One of the associates persuaded us to sign up for a Zales account. I was approved so I was able to purchase both rings with warranties and no hassle. The girls showed us the Marilyn collection, which is stunning by the way! They had so much info and answered all of our questions. Thanks for your help!

TruFusion is the gym I've been looking for! I love premium group training classes and heated yoga but struggled to find a gym that provided both variety in classes and affordability. I've practiced Bikram yoga for several years and was heartbroken when my gym closed this past year. I wasn't thrilled with the other Bikram studios in town and they were far more expensive than what I had been paying so it just wasn't a good fit for me. I also enjoyed boot camp type training at places like Shred415 but again, the price point was just too high to justify going often or buying a membership. 

I read about TruFusion and asked my friends about it but they had never heard of it before. After researching the website it seemed to be too legit to not have hidden costs somewhere but I committed before the gym even opened hoping it would be everything it seemed. The gym just opened on Thursday and I've been to two classes so far. It's everything I had hoped it would be! Don't judge them by the nondescript exterior that it shares with Wine and Cheese Place in Clayton. As soon as you walk through the door you feel like you've entered a big city premium gym. Everything is stylish, clean, high tech, and looks like they spared no expense. The locker rooms have great lighting, showers, hair dryers, etc that help you fit working out into your busy work life. The soul hot yoga studio has energetic lighting, great music, and fantastic instructors. I had never tried a yin class before but I left today feeling great and looking towards when I can be back in the gym. And to really seal the deal all of this is offered for $95/month UNLIMITED which is far better than other premium class based gyms in town. They also reward fire responders, nurses, and nonprofit workers with a discount to $72 which as a nurse I'm really grateful for!

Side note, if you love Revel Kitchen they are opening their second location right inside the gym! You can have a great workout and stay on your diet all in one place. I heard they will have an ordering system you can use before your class and your food/smoothie will be waiting for you when you're done. How awesome is that?!

I may have found love in the form of frozen yogurt. And endless choices of frozen yogurt flavors and toppings. While I'm a grown woman, I couldn't help but feel like an 8 year old on Christmas morning when making my creation. 

The business model/gimmick is genius: tons of flavors, tons of toppings, charge by the ounce. Give people huge cups, and, just like the salad bar syndrome, they will unwittingly fill their cups with so much fro-yo and toppings that it ends up being an $8-9 dessert. I'm not saying this is a bad thing, it's just how it is (and brilliant business on the part of Yogo). 

So if you want to maximize the bang for your buck, stick with toppings that don't weigh as much. Fruit? $$$. Sprinkles or Reese's Puffs? $. It's all in the weight, people. 

That being said, I don't mind dropping dough on an indulgence once in a while, given how delicious it can be.

PS~Come to Chicago and I will be a happy woman.

I might ordered the least popular menu here but I loved it. I was wondering about this place since I see always long line of people waiting outside even during wkdays. 

I had beet salad and hub got the burger. And side of mac and cheese. I really enjoyed my beet salad. The portion of beet was very generous. Also they gave me a lot of goat cheese which was so yummy. Greens were fresh and dressing was delicious. He said burger was just ok. He wished he got the French toast or pancake. Seems like everyone getting them and looked really good. 

I will definitely go back there to try their best sellers.

If you have love for art come here.  This is Tampa/St. Pete's treasure, where you can come see work of a master and for the time being 2 masters with the inclusion of Escher.

They offer audio tour which I recommend for those first timers with museums.  I have been to museums such as Metropolitan and Smithsonian.  Our Dali isn't nearly as big, but it stacks up in experience.  The design of the building is so whimsical and playful.  The smaller space feels more intimate and the building design seems so loving to me.

The smaller collection is the right size for one artist.  You're not aching for the bathroom or the exit.  And if you truly love the work, you could sit and look at a painting as long as you want.  Dali loves to hide images within images, which makes it  particularly rewarding to take your time.

This place is incredible. A must-go while in New Orleans, especially if you love live jazz music. The appetizers, entrees, and desserts are all incredible: in my party of 7, every single person loved their food. We tried the hangar steak, the pasta with shrimp added, the market fish, and the shortrip. All delicious! The restaurant also has a great ambiance and terrific service. Our server, Nate, made excellent drink recommendations based on each of our tastes. We all loved the cocktails we received. He provided some of the best service I've had at any restaurant. Don't hesitate to eat here while in NOLA!

Came in here purely because we were so impressed with how well they changed the signage from the previous business. Seriously. It's impressive!
