I usually don't like flowery drinks, but the Fleur Des Lis was really refreshing, especially with the cucumber. The Monteleone cocktail was whiskey based, and I was reluctant to try it because I'm not a huge fan of whiskey, but you could actually barely taste it!

ahhhh. I love you shake sugary! Cute, intimate bakery. We used them for our wedding cake. 

Let me tell you, it was so hard to find an affordable cake that wasn't super sweet. We had a few other cake tastings before this and while the cake was delicious, I couldn't handle the frosting. Dawn was so sweet and helpful. Our first visit we got to try a good amount of flavors of cake and filling. Dawn gave suggestions of different cake flavors and fillings that go well together. We left feeling great about Shake Sugary. A few weeks later...we forgot what exact flavors fiance and I had liked best. So, Dawn let us come back in to try our top two again (berry chantilly and strawberry cake with passion fruit filling). She even put these into cupcake form with filling and all...which made us MORE excited and happy with our decision! Our guest count was also larger than we thought, so Dawn gave us a cost efficient idea to add two dozen cupcakes to our two tier cake instead of adding another layer (which was more pricey). This helped out a lot! 

They worked with our planners on getting the cake to the venue, have cake stands if you need, and ideas on decorating cakes with fresh flowers. I wanted a semi-naked cake with fresh flowers and it came out exactly like the photos. Loved it. Working with them was easy. Emails and online or in person payments. 

I also got to try their biscuits and gravy once for brunch during another visit. I got the maple bacon biscuit. AMAZING. The gravy was different, I think vegan, but SO GOOD. I believe they also have a gluten free version of the biscuit.

Cure is about a 1/2 mile from my house so I drive by all the time.  And the crowds of glitterati (or what attempts to pass for it in NOLA) made me think Cure wasn't my sort of establishment.  Well, it turns out I was wrong.  I know shocking.

I went on a weekday after work for a benefit for a New Orleans charter school.  The after work crowd was friendly and a good mix of ages.  I had a glass of their fall sangria (because I got a free glass) and it was really tasty and delicious.  My friends sampled a variety of cocktails and deemed them all well made.  Well, except for the unusual presentation of the Old Fashioned which should have been labeled a New Fashioned.  What no muddling?

And I LOVE the building and that it is no smoking indoors.

Great restaurant in the CBD! While I have only been for happy hour, I keep coming back for the delicious pizzas and drinks (both half price from 2-5 for happy hour EVERYDAY), the cauliflower with whipped feta, and the upscale atmosphere. I love going during happy hour because you get the feel of being at a fancy restaurant without paying fancy restaurant prices. 

The pizzas are thin crust and delicious! My absolute favorite is the clam pizza and everyone I introduce it to loves it as well. This past weekend I also shared the margherita pizza and the zucca pizza with a group and I liked them both but wasn't as obsessed with them.. The clam pizza was the clear winner! The cauliflower is also amazing! The whipped feta it comes with really makes it incredible but it is definitely pricey at $20 for the dish. The salads I've had from Domenica have also been very yummy! The best part is that you leave the restaurant full (and usually with leftovers) and for much less than you would pay at other restaurants! Also, the little cookies they give you with the check (I refer to them as ugly cookies) are a delicious treat to end the meal! My only real problem with Domenica is that it can get really loud, which makes it difficult to hear the people you're eating with. 

Food -- 5 stars
Price -- 5 stars (for happy hour)
Service -- 4 stars
Atmosphere -- 4.5 stars

I've been here twice and I really like this place. It's like an upscale sports bar and you have to take it for what it is. The decor is nice and they have TVs all over the place. I haven't had too much of their food but I've tried their seared tuna and tacos and they were both pretty good. They do have the TN fries and those are lovely and you must try them. They come with jalapeno ketchup. Good place to go when you want to catch a game and don't feel like going to a dive. Oh yeah, and the people that were there on both nights were beautiful. So good eye candy.

I've been shying away from this place for a while now because of all the mixed reviews. However, whenever I do get a hankering for some take out close to my work place for lunch, there are only fast food restaurants around, which I actively avoid (when I can). A co-worker changed my mind about going to Phat Bites - claiming they have the best hummus. Being a pescatarian/vegetarian, I do love my hummus (especially trying out different, homemade ones). So, since the first visit, I've been here at least three times - and all three times, I loved it. I tried their Tuna wrap, their caprese sandwich, and their selection of hummus - my most recent ones being chipotle and pumpkin (not together - separate hummus). The chipotle was delicious and the pumpkin was surprisingly yummy. It shouldn't work - but it does. It doesn't even taste like hummus - it tastes like pumpkin pie filling. They give you sugared pita chips to go with it - it's like having dessert in the form of protein for lunch. I'm hungry just thinking about it. The tuna was good - but it wasn't AMAZING. I loved the caprese sandwich though - that added balsamic touch puts it over the top.

The atmosphere is pretty funky. It's a converted garage with graffiti and creative canvasses of art displayed everywhere. There is a small stage for live music (which, I'm assuming, happens at night because I never see anyone perform). Best of all, they play underground, "indie" music. Just yesterday, I heard them playing a song from Under the Influence of Giants - a band that dissolved but still remains a favorite of mine to this day.

Service is always served with a smile. There has been a couple of times where they forget to bring you something that you ordered but as long as you remind them, there shouldn't be any issues.

I haven't quite forgiven them for doing away with their homemade lavender syrup, but the fig one is still pretty good! I love that they carry oat milk - it's so good and they do a really good job with it! Kat's da bomb

Royal India is home to the tastiest Indian food in Reno! To me, it feels like I am walking into someone's kitchen when I arrive. The staff are so friendly and welcoming and the service is awesome. As soon as we sit down someone is there to greet us. I love that! 

I typically will go with one or two others for their lunch buffet. What I love about the lunch buffet is that they are always switching out the dishes, but they also always have the same top picks for returning customers. They have the thali trays so you can try many different types of curries and sauces. The food at the buffet has been fresh and hot every time I have come in, and I have arrived at varying times of the day. 

My favorite dish they have at the buffet is the Chicken tiki masala. It is so flavorful, creamy, and the chicken is moist. The naan is served fresh and the chai tea is a perfect cap for a delicious meal. 

Thank you, Royal India! You have filled many Sunday afternoons with great memories for my family and I!
Simply the best! I love Sid. She is quick and cheap. I always leave her shop feeling pretty.

I've always been a fan of Steak 'n Shake and was glad to see Reno had a location.  I was quickly greeted, seated and brought a glass of water while I perused the menu.  I ordered the Bacon Double Cheese Burger with fries and a mocha shake. The food made it to the table in under 10 minutes and the server checked up on me about 3 times.  Their burgers are classic east coast diner style burgers, meaning they are very thin (as they should be for this style).  So to the customer this means a double is more like a single at other fast food restaurants like Wendy's or Burger King.  If you want a more traditional "double" you need to order a 3 patty burger.  I already knew this, but I see several reviews talking about how thin the patty's were.  Overall good location and still love seeing the 50's retro style decor' and my meal came out to be around $13 with tip.  They do not offer a military discount, but I was glad to see that they removed the "No guns allowed" sign to allow concealed carry customers to exercise their rights again at this location.

Another gimmicky burger joint, when you first walk in you see boxes of raw potatoes. The prices seem a little high, but worth trying them out. I got a double cheeseburger with onions with a medium fry. Hope you like fries, they give you a ton of them. Just my order of fries would have been enough for my wife and i with leftovers. I know the new thing is to make fresh homemade fries, but to me they usually taste slightly burnt or over cooked. The burger was really good, i loved it. Lots of flavor and very juicy. I got a milkshake to go, it was really good, very thick and taste great. The tea was weird, not sure if it was brewed or like that nestea crap. All the workers were nice and quick, they cleared our table as soon as we finished.

So much to love about Brasserie Saint James. The building has great seating options, both inside and outside, and I love the hanging "carnival" lights. The menu is varied and all five people in my party found several things they wanted to try. I had the Blue Lemon Jefferson cocktail (so good!) and we all split the poutine appetizer and the crab and artichoke skillet. My entree was the arugula and gruyere flat bread. Everything we ate tasted fresh and yummy!  I really appreciate the eco-friendly straws. Save the turtles!
I will say I was disappointed that we were not able to enjoy their rooftop seating. We asked but were told they didn't have enough servers to support that area. A little surprising for lunch on a Saturday but sometimes things like that just happen. If I could change some things about this experience Brasserie Saint James, it would be to let your customer enjoy their appetizers for a few minutes before bringing out the entree, and fill the water glasses to the same level. Petty? Maybe. But five already-filled glasses were brought to us each had varying levels of water in them. One was overflowing, one looked 1/2 full, one had no ice, one was almost all ice, and, well, you get the picture. 
Will you also publish your menu on your website?  Is it there and just really well hidden? Pictures of food draw the eye but it's odd to not find the menu. Knowing the owner's and investing partners biographies is thrilling, but what can we eat?!?

Burrito Eating Contest! If you can call it a contest, lol. That young lady who one put those big boys under the table. I swear she was done in a minute or less! Anyway, let's talk burritos. They have some big, delish burritos! I chose carnitas, and OMG am I glad I did. Seasoned to perfection, tender, juicy, and a ton of it. It for real should be called burrito bus. And, to top it off, they have empanadas on special on Thursday. So of course, being the food lover that I am, and the fact I had hungry kids at home, I had to get some. Let me tell you, they do NOT disappoint! Choose from ground beef, chicken or portobello mushroom. I got all three! You MUST try these! Cooked to perfection, Crunchy little pockets of love. It's a must on your list for Tampa! And I know El Jafe personally, so I'll make him body slam you if you don't

Last time I was in the Pure Fare restaurant, I mentioned to the cashier that I wished the place was closer to my office in University City. She let me know that they were opening a food truck, hopefully in September. I got the news last week, from the U City facebook feed, that they were indeed opening on Wednesday. 

I made it out here on Friday at 12 just before a bit of a rush of people. They serve the same salads and sandwiches, pre-made and ready to go. I liked that the salad dressing was on the side, because I was picking up two salads to share for dinner later that night.

The salad with zucchini "noodles", edamame, bell peppers and grape tomatoes was delightful. I think it was the salad dressing, a fresh tasting light lemony dressing, was what made it really special. The second salad was a bed of arugula with fresh beets, goat cheese and red onions. I had buyer's remorse at first when I brought that one home, because I usually can't hang with the peppery arugula. I was surprised that I loved this salad as well. Again, the dressing was what made the arugula bearable. The goat cheese was a little bland, but perhaps it is a lower fat version than what I'm used to.

I'd love to give them five stars, but I think they're still working out some food truck basics. If you're going to sell from a food truck, please charge an amount that is divisible by a quarter. My total bill came to $15.12 and I had to dig for change at the bottom of my purse! 

I will be back. Probably twice a week because it's a 5 minute walk away, hooray!

Get the carrots!  These are not the "Have you ever seen a rabbit wearing glasses? No?  Well then finish your carrots or you don't get dessert!" carrots from your youth.  These are the kind of carrots that once finished, you shed a small tear because you think the deliciousness is over...

...but it's not!  Of the small plates, the beets and the sweet potato are also quite lovely.

Medium plates?  Octo all the way!  I wanted to take a bath in that congee.

Large plates?  If you are deciding between the pork shoulder and the lamb, go pork shoulder.  It was incredible and I found the lamb to be a bit dry in some areas.

Dessert?  Despite finishing (read: devouring) my carrots, I didn't get there *sad face* Maybe next time (and there will be a next time).

Can you award more than 5 stars?? This has quickly become my favorite restaurant in the city. I've been three times and the service and quality of food and beverage has been excellent every time! Their Oyster Bed Roast is easily my favorite oyster dish I've ever had. In addition, both the Bombay Shrimp and Tamarind Shrimp are delicious! The Bombay Shrimp come with a great dipping sauce on the side and the Tamarind Shrimp have a lot of onions (delicious for onion lovers) and are incredibly good. We also never skip the Truffle Naan! For those of you who may not love truffle, never fear! They have garlic and plain as well! From the main plates I've had the Khyber Lamb Chops, the Lotus Root Kofta and the Chicken Biriyani. There is no bad choice but my favorite would have to go to the Chicken Biriyani, served in a small cast iron pot...delicious!! The cocktails don't disappoint either, the Anti-Inflammatory and the Saffron NoLa Old Fashioned would be my top picks! Highly recommend this to locals and visitors!!

A lovely oasis in a major city. It isn't so much the diversity or uniqueness of the plant as it is the quiet pleasure of this place. There are a pricey restaurant dedicated to locavore and sustainable eating, a gift shop and two exhibit spaces. The chairs and benches distributed in the grounds provide wonderful spots to sit and read or contemplate.

I got an excellent massage here yesterday, from Lynn. It was a treat to myself for my birthday. I absolutely loved that I could get a 30 minute massage for both timing reasons and because it was a great way to spend a little less. 

I would definitely recommend checking out Hummingbird for massage! It's a little hard to find. Once you turn into the building address parking lot, go around to the back, and enter one of the doors. Go down to the L2 level. It's a lovely, relaxing space with tranquil fountains and some really great hot tea.

Stumbled upon this place since it was next door to Dim Sum Garden, which I had tried out the previous day during my 2-day trip to Philly. This place is decorated with Zagat awards. Trust me you can't miss the fact that this place is highly recommended.

You get your choice of hand drawn or knife shaved. I love knife shaved noodles, but ignore that this place is called Nan Zhou Hand Drawn Noodle House, so I opted for the hand drawn beef brisket soup.

The noodles were fresh. The broth was very light, not as rich in flavor as one would desire, but all in all not a bad place.

Service was prompt and polite. 

TLDR: Bang for your buck, pretty good for what it is.

Had a large group go out to eat here while at Indian Shores Beach.  This restaurant is HUGE. Several different rooms and some outdoor space also.  Decor is of course beachy, fishes on the walls, cute sayings...everything you want in a beach restaurant, they got.
Complimentary pineapple bread and coconut butter. OMG so good. I kid you not, so frickin' good.
I ordered the hogfish sandwich and I was extremely disappointed. It was really dry. It was a piece of fried fish, cheese, and some sauteed onions between bread and that's it. I asked for tartar sauce and it didn't help at all.  My husband tried it and also didn't like it which is surprising since he eats everything.  For drink I had a frozen house margarita and that was delicious during the crazy got summer heat.  Service was ok, not superb. She did charge me for an extra margarita and when I told her about it, she said ot may have belonged to someone else on the table but didn't offer to fix it until I told her that it was wrong.
I want to note that everyone else on table (total of 5 adults) loved their meal, so maybe it was what I ordered. I wouldn't make a priority to come back... then again, that pineapple bread and coconut butter may make me do it.

Let me preface by saying I love a good tapas restaurant.  In fact, I think tapas should be the restaurant go-to for all women.  Let's face it ladies, you don't need the massive portions being served up at these BYO Italian joints.  Unless of course you like men who like their women thick. 

Anywho, on to the review...

Tinto is all-around fab.  Much needed in the Square, if you ask me.  I love the atmosphere/decor here, and they have some fantastic wines by the glass.  Oh, and service is impeccable.

As for tapas selections, coming here without ordering the bacon-wrapped figs, short-ribs, or the duck confit should be considered a cardinal sin.  De-lish.  

Perfect spot to catch up with old friends or flirt on a hot date.

I'm withholding the 5th star b/c I've been spoiled by too many visits to Cafe Iberico in Chicago and Alta in Manhattan.

Birthday dad wanted to eat here. He loves the winning pork ribs. Surprised to find all tables busy when we arrived - on a Wednesday. I knew I could expect great pulled pork and beans, but wanted to see if the waiter's suggestions are believable. I decided to order the 12 ounce prime rib - it was very good, but not the best in treasure valley. Onion rings appetizer was enjoyed by all, including my impatient toddler. I even put some of the dill ranch dip on my steak fries. We also like eating the steak fries without dip. Potato salad and cole slaw are great. The birthday man got a free brownie dessert, shared with everyone at the table. What's the greatest food of all here? Would have to say the key lime pie... better than Marie Callendars, Edwards, and Perkins. This is a man who used to eat key lime pie for dinner every night in Memphis. Our bearded waiter seemed to have wits and smiles to spare.

A truly luxurious, full service Aveda salon in the most unlikely of places!

I've been a client at Celeslie's for several years now. I've tried the high-end salons in Clayton, Creve Coeur, Town and Country and Frontenac. Celeslie's can rival any of them.

I've had several stylists color and/or cut my hair over the years, but Jamie is my favorite! She really listens to me, never pushes anything on me and seems to intuitively know when to encourage me to try something new and when to leave me be in my comfort zone. I've come to trust her without question and for me, that's priceless. Additionally, I really like Jen for dying my eye lashes, facials and microderms. I also had my first massage here! For me, this was a BIG deal. I was never comfortable with the idea of a massage, but I finally gave in and now I'm hooked! So much so, that for our first wedding anniversary, I booked a Couples' Massage for my husband and me. It was awesome! We arrived, were taken to the spa area, had some wine, changed in to lovely, soft robes and sat in the dry sauna for a bit. Then we headed to a quiet, dimly lit room with soft music for an hour of heaven. My husband even fell asleep during his! Afterward, we had private time in the rain forest shower. It was a wonderful afternoon and we will definitely do it again.

Lastly, I want to comment on Jamie's skill and knowledge. I have a medical condition that has caused my hair to thin and for the texture to change. She has guided me through the maze of products to find the perfect Aveda ones for me. My hair is regrowing and has regained its soft feel and is stronger and healthier than it's been in years. The transformation is hard to believe! She also gave me a lot of guidance on how to communicate what I wanted with the stylists at the resort where we were married. I was worried they would overdo my make-up and hair and she walked me through what I wanted and instructed me on how to communicate it with them. It worked our perfectly! The next best thing to having Jamie do it herself.

I'm a total fan of Jamie's and Celeslie's. I will continue to go there for all of my salon needs.

Stopped by for a beer on a sunny afternoon. Love the space and the big garage doors. The food menu had good variety and they had about 12 beers on tap.  As a bonus they're on the ICW and have corn hole set up downstairs

Definitely the best rink in the greater Tampa area.

I'm in a men's league here and love it. Not only is it really close to my apartment, but the ice is high quality and the pro shop is top notch. The bar is solid and shows a lot of hockey.

My only complaint is their infrequent pick-up schedule. Usually only four a month - half of which are for 30+, all of which are during the week during the work day. For the time being I'm stuck driving to Oldsmar or Ellenton unless I have a game.

I'll say this first: I never crave Italian food. Call me crazy but it's the cheap as dirt Mexican food that holds a special place in my heart. But alas, my beau is Italian... so, uh... when in Rome?

I digress.

As a nice gesture to my boyfriend, I caught the special on Sharing Spree - $15 for $30 at Vito's and surprised him with 5:30pm reservations on a Saturday night. From the outside, it looks like a casual pizza joint. We walked through their patio area thinking we'd split a pie and toss back a few beers.

Not the case! They have pizzas, yes... but they have much, much more.

After finding out that they were out of vermouth (no manhattans for us) and several of their wine selections, I had the waitress go down the list to tell me what they did have. We settled on a bottle of cabernet and ordered caprese (so good!) to start.

For entrees: Chicken Florentine with risotto for me and Gulf Prawns Fra Diavolo for him. I probably wouldn't order the florentine again; WAY too much cream sauce for my taste, but the prawns? Out of control good. A little spicy with vegetables in a tomato sauce... LEGIT. 


The verdict? Tutto bene! Mi amore gave it a stamp of approval by saying he'd love to return and bring his family. So, if you go on anyone's word here, go on his.

My husband and I have been here twice so far and both visits have been good. The first time was the best visit. The first time I got the spinach fettucine alfredo and so far that is our favorite. When we went the first time the service was perfect and our waiter even boxed up our food for us before we even asked for a box. Like everyone has said the bread is very good. I got the minestrone soup which I thought was good but not the best I have ever had. My husband got the caesar which we didn't love because it has the thinner dressing, not the nice creamy caesar dressing we like. 

The second time we went was a little later in the evening. When we got there it wasn't too busy but by the time we left people were waiting for tables. Understandably the service was slower this time. We split the appetizer sampler and the sampler with the chicken parmesan.  The food was pretty good but not as good as the fettucine alfredo. We did really like the stuffed ravioli, I loved that it was stuffed with cheese. We really wanted to try the bananas foster but unfortunately they were out, so we'll have to try it some other time. 

Overall I really like this place. I definitely want to try the crab ravioli next time.

My friends and I were looking for a spot to get po'boys that wasn't too far from our hotel. NOLA Poboys' location on Bourbon Street is what initially caught our eye.

When we walked in, it was pretty busy but the line moved quickly. If you have at least one other person with you, I suggest grabbing a seat first. The main entrance has booth seating and stools near the door. There is more seating in the back but that was reserved for tours that come by. The man at the register was very friendly and patient as my friends and I figured out what we wanted to order. 

Between the three of us, we had the fried oyster, fried crawfish and fried catfish po'boys. We also split an order of the fried okra. All three were had perfectly crispy, fried seafood with a great spice. I'm not great with spicy food but I didn't find the heat on the fried seafood to be overwhelming. My friend ordered her po'boy Yankee-style, just to be safe. I didn't love the fried okra. It definitely could've used a dipping suace.

What NOLA Poboys lacks in frills, it more than makes up for in traditional po'boys. This meal hit the spot and is a great place to grab a po'boy if you're on Bourbon Street.

I love this location! The service is always fast, and staff is so friendly! I have been here many times with family and friends who are visiting and we all walk out with happy bellies. I love their crab cakes Benedict, and heovos rancheros. They have a pretty big selection and everything is categorized by food type. If you are "hangry" I'd suggest checking out their menu prior to getting their because you WILL get confused on what to order :)
I've had both Greek food and breakfast at Athens now and both are worth the visit! I love a good old diner that's open late. Oh, and any Greek food. I love that, too.

Go to Jessica! Hair by Jessica. She uses and organic treatment system. The color products do not have a strong or pungent odor. They styling products smell so good! You will not be disappointed.

I purchased her Groupon. It was such a great deal, $40.00 for a cut and color. You can't beat that. She was able to get me in for my appointment right away. She works around your schedule. 

I don't usually put confidence into someone who is doing my hair for the first time, but I had no reason to be nervous. She listened to my wants/needs and gave me a beautiful cut. I love the layers that she put into my hair. I chose an auburn red color and it turned out great. She was able to match up the color to my facial skin tone and I am so glad that I went with the color that she picked out for me. Outstanding!

We loved Otto! The sausages were fantastic and the sides were great too. We loved the croquettes and deep fried cauliflower. Also there is an incredible beer selection. The place was small and busy but the service was great and the evening sun and open garage door to the outside made for a lovely atmosphere. This is the kind of place you could  drink beer and snack on sausage all evening! We will be back!

This is the kind of place I just LOVE!!!! So adorable inside, it's downtown so you can walk around and stop in or grab coffee and walk around after. The coffee was great and the homemade biscuits we're delicious!! I don't know how in the world I have never seen it before or been to, but we will for sure be back there.

Not too bad when I'm used to fresh fish in Hawaii/California.

What I loved: 
**Mountain roll and ceviche roll! Great rice ratio and tasted fresh and proportions of everything was spot on. 

***Hotate and sake nigiri also on point. Hotate was melt in your mouth - must eat it with the thinly sliced lemon, they should put that straight on. 

**Cucumber salad - refreshing just super small

**It's loud! So with our three kids it didn't matter that they were a bit crazy! 

Not the greatest.....
Miso soup - underwhelming
Agedashi- proportions was sooo small and it wasn't crispy but soggy!

And the service unfortunately was so bad on a Tuesday night. We ordered ala carte and felt so rushed with our server asking "anything else??" And we waited a bunch of times just to flag her down.

Apparently everyone does buffet so the service is probably often slow.

Bill for 2 adults and 3 kids under 6 was $91 without tip :0.....wish we just did the all you can eat. We know for next time if there is a next time....probably with the wait for food we won't.

Early Dinner May 14,
  Acclaimed Chef Todd Hall is no longer there. No idea what happened.
  Concept seems great - Upscale farm to table style traditional Mexican Food with extensive tequila list.
  Food was good, but not blow your mind away food as I was expecting or for what the prices are! But also keep in mind that I am not a gourmet or connnoisseur of Mexican cuisine.  
  We all liked the Chips and 3 dips that came with it!  
  One diner in our party loved the seared salmon mole - thought it was excellent!  Another got the Shrimp & Avocado Salad and didn't like the pickled vegetables at all (felt it overpowered the salad).  Two of us got the Carne Asada Tacos.  They were okay, but at $16 for just 2 tacos, man that was way overpriced and honestly seemed crazy when I can go to Surf Shack & get their Filet Mignon Tacos for half that price.
  Perhaps they are having opening issues still, perhaps the Chef Todd being gone is an issue - but for what we paid for 4 people to eat was way way more than it was worth in my opinion.

One of my go to restaurants in downtown St Pete for a couple of years now.  I like it because it is unpretentious, on the small side (cozy with approx seating for 40-45), has good service, is priced right and some nights they have a piano player.  

One of my favorite dishes the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce fell flat last night.  Instead of tasting like tiny air pillows they were dense - I am hopeful it was just an off night.  The other dish we had was the cannelloni - if you love cheese and sauce this is your dish.  The bread was a foccacia style and simply ok, they could have warmed it in the oven at least.  

They have a varied wine list and a good selection of beers, no liquor.  

Because I've always enjoyed it in the past I will go again and fingers crossed they are back on track that night.

I just love the small Waffle Steak places. The waffles are the beat in the world.  $6 steak and eggs is a bargain, and the atmosphere can't be beat.

The only downside is the booths are made for people who weigh about 75 pounds.  Anyone who eats at a Waffle Steak on a regular basis would find the seating a bit tight!!!

Squeeze yourself in, load up on cheap food, and then hit the YMCA so you can fit in the booth on your next visit!

I love National Mechanics.  Before I even went there, I wanted to love NM. It's so cool looking. Also, when I first wanted to try it, they had Yards Pynk on tap.  Pretty awesome. 

But, then, one fateful day, I tried to go to NM. The story goes like this: I finally convinced a friend (the lovely Jill F.) to try it with me, and as we're standing, within the columns of their porch, reading their menu, a pigeon hits us! This pigeon must have eaten the worst food (and I assume some cruel kids had fed it laxatives). In one go, it hit my head and arm and my friend's arm! It was the mother-load of pigeon poo!  So we used their bathrooms to rinse of the green gooeyness and went home.

A month or two later, I hosted an Unofficial Yelp Event here (with the lovely George R.). We came without warning the establishment because we had no idea how many people to expect. The servers and managers were extremely helpful and friendly. The manager even came over and talked to me about Yelp and also told me that they put up pigeon guards since I was last there.   Then, the management gave all of the people in our party a shot on the house. Pretty awesome. 

Having been back several times now, I can say with confidence that the servers and bartenders are great, here. 

The food is tasty and really reasonably priced.

I just wish they were open for lunch on the weekends. 

And one more time for luck: Pretty awesome. 

Snag a seat. Grab a pitcher. Enjoy yourself.

Have always liked Boston Market.  Was a favorite for lunch when I was working.

I got the 1/2 chicken dinner with mashed potatoes and gravy and creamed spinach. It came with a piece of corn bread.  Cranberry sauce was a bit extra but who cares.  I love it.  All was quite good, as usual.  A really nice fast food alternative.  With a deal of $20 for 2 meals which included drinks and dessert, there was no feeling of being ripped off!.  Definitely will be back !

I've been to Nodding Head twice now, once taking a business partner for a couple brews and a debrief after a massacre of a client meeting, and then last night for late night drunk food with fellow Yelper Michelle C. and her sister after the event at Helium, where I had like 6 Bud Lights.  Nodding Head is pretty well-known as a local microbrewery staple, lauded by self-described true brew heads as a destination for heavy and unique tasting oat soda.

FIRST IMPRESSIONS:
I've been there when I was in the only table in the place, and I've been there when there's a full crowd at night, but both were on weekdays, so I can't speak to Nodding Head as a weekend spot.  It's gives just the kind of first impression you'd expect from a microbrewery, if not a little more earthly than most.  The clientelle and staff appear to be the kind of people who know their beer and come to Nodding Head for a reason, and that you wouldn't catch many of them dead in a chic martini lounge or wine & cheese bar...regardless, the mood feels jovial and welcoming.  Nodding Head can be a little inconspicuous if it's your first (or in my case, second) time, as it's accessed via a single door leading upstairs.  There is usually a sign there, but I completely missed it.

THE ATMOSPHERE/SERVICE:
Dark, very dark and warm, with all-wood furnishings, floors, etc., accented by the tall stainless steel brewing equipment.  The bathrooms are located in the center where the main brewery is implanted right in the center of the rear seating area, giving you the feeling that you really are drinking their beer in the middle of their brewery (a la Sam Adams commercials).  As I said, the clientelle appear to be pretty friendly, our waiter was able to accommodate us as relative brew newbs, so we all felt pretty comfortable.  I've been to other breweries where the staff was condescending and didn't do much to help us decide what to try, but in the case of Nodding Head, I feel they were just the opposite in both visits.

THE DRINKS/FOOD:
As mentioned earlier, most of Nodding Head's brews are pretty heavy, Grog and Monkey Knife Fight being the lightest, and Oatmeal Stout being on the heavier side.  Additionally, the menu gave no indication of their carrying other brews, which leads me to believe that they don't; even though I remember seeing a bar, I couldn't see if it was stocked with anything.  I got the Grog the first time, which was pretty good, a little heavy for my tastes, and the Monkey Knife Fight the second time.  Monkey Knife Fight is a bit clearer in my memory-- it is relatively light, with a heavy ginger flavor...definitely NOT the choice to compliment spicy foods, which is mostly what we had ordered, but it was still tasteful and enjoyable to me before we got our food.  The food was very good, although we only had appetizers-- the Pita w/ spicy hummus, a sampler platter, and their pub fries.  While the hummus didn't taste very home made, it wasn't bad, and the sampler and the fries were excellent-- I loved the texture and taste of the fries, with that spicy mayonnaise concoction they have for dipping (which I got to keep all to myself).  It was a little on the pricey side for some of the food, but I guess it was worth it.  Portions were very generous, and we all left feeling satiated.

THE BOTTOM LINE:
A cozy little microbrewery that is as tried-and-true to beer vets as it is accessible to brew newbies, they have good food and good heavy beer (if heavy beer is your thing), don't go there expecting to taste something you could try somewhere else, the flavors are unique and should be enjoyed and judged according to your palette and not your past experiences at other breweries.  Worth checking out for sure if you're curious!

What a great place! Nestled in the charming old town area of St Charles, this place has good food AND good beer! Sometimes, it's difficult to find both. I went with the amber ale and wasn't disappointed. Another member of my party ordered the stout and he liked it too. For the vino lovers, Kendall Jackson is available (Wow- KJ at a microbrew? Yep!). I had the ribeye with steamed veggies and a salad. The ribeye was just a tad fatty but had a great flavor. The burgers looked good (one was carried to the table behind us). If you want to get some steps in after dinner, the location just outside is fantastic to window shop. Also, very close to the Katy Trail for the bikers out there. Would definitely go again!

I had two objectives for my trip to Philadelphia: run the half marathon and drink lots of beer.  I happily accomplished both. 

If you are a beer lover, the Philadelphia Brewing company is worth checking out.  You get a tour of the brewery as well as six free tasters in the tasting room.  

So seriously, go and give this place a try!

Kalyra II - By the sea...with you and me AND our dog!!

How wonderful that this tasting room is DOG FRIENDLY (to those sweet socially adapted dogs of course)!!

My husband and I are wine club members or "Wine Thief's" with Kalyra Winery home based in Santa Ynez on Refugio Road. Yes the infamous winery used in the movie "Sideways". 

This location is a tasting room in the heart of Santa Barbara's Funk Zone. We love coming here for tastings and to pick up our wine shipments and always a few additional bottles of wine for ourselves or for gifts. 

The added bonus is it is dog friendly and we can bring our sweet old Great Dane inside with us. Note: we also bring in her own dog bed so she could lay there comfortably while we spend time tasting these amazing wines. They do provide a dog water bowl. 

Trevor, that manages this location, is simply the best. We are quickly becoming good friends after a few visits and we have the "Cheers" thing going on. Yes where everyone knows your name!

If you can't make the drive to Santa Ynez for their actual winery/tasting room be sure to stop in to Kalyra II and enjoy a sampling of many of their wines. You will not be disappointed. And their location is perfect. You can continue on with a walk out to Sterns Wharf, the beach or to walk State Street for a meal. Enjoy!

On my recent trip to Philly, I loved Frieda so much I came here three times. That is something I never do ever, as I usually try to experience as many spots in a city as humanly possible while traveling. But I was so smitten with Frieda that I genuinely looked forward to returning.

MISSION: Frieda is an intergenerational restaurant, community center, art gallery, bakery, and coffee shop. Its primary identity may be a restaurant, but they often flip the space for workshops, readings, and other cool classes. They sell amazing local goods by local makers, and I love their statement about their artists, bakers and employees: "And while you're here, know that any money you spend at FRIEDA helps us create fair-wage jobs for people of all generations - many of them retired, but still needing to work to make ends meet - as well as support our Outreach Community Program."

FOOD + DRINK: Reasonably priced and crave-worthy. The salmon avocado toast was beautifully presented, had delicious flavor and was very generous. As for bakery, my Mom and I both agreed their croissant was the best we've ever had. Thick but still flaky and melt-in-your-mouth chocolate. The London Fog and other coffee drinks we had were always well-made and satisfying.

SERVICE + VIBE: Nahir is amazing. I actually hugged him on my final visit! We had so many great chats about Frieda's programs, the menu, and just Philly in general. He went above and beyond. The vibe here is very white and minimal, but open and airy. You get a great feeling just sitting there and existing.

I wish this spot was in Cleveland because I'm obsessed with its multi-faceted approach to community and its inclusiveness. I can't recommend it enough! It is such a pleasant surprise that you can feel good about supporting.

If you like gourmet food this is the right place for you!!.. Personally I love it!! This is one of my favorite restaurants in Tampa. Everything there is Incredible!... Also, the service is great!.. If you are in Tampa you must go to this restaurant!!...

As I'm rolling through my Yelp, and looking though the suggestions of places to review, I realize that I haven't reviewed this Heaven Send!

MOD pizza is BOMB. No other words to describe it. It kinda reminds me of a Chipotle, but just for pizza. But it doesn't stop at pizza. They also offer salads and "stick" options.

They do have a menu with pizza selections that you can order from, but I prefer the Create Your Own for pizza. You can select ALL of the toppings you want at no additional cost. I think I might overdue it a bit, but I love veggies .:shrugs:.

They offer two size options - a 6 inch and an 11 inch. I get the 11 inch and eat the entire thing between lunch and dinner, and it's only about $9. Worth every penny.

Loved Salvos!!! This place has a bomb seafood boil, it's spicy just the way we like it ! I didn't know, I could eat this much until this place. It's very very casual, not fancy at all, so it makes you feel more at home and comfortable to stuff your face !

They bring out hot, steamy Blue crabs, Shrimps, Crab legs , Jonah Crab Claws, Crawfish, Sausages, Potatoes and Corn!!! 

The service can be a little slow at times because of how crazy busy they are. They do Table orders, not the get it yourself style. 

We had the Friday Buffet which is the best one! It has everything, they offer buffet during the week but it's always different and changes , there is tons of items on the menu to try for fried foods as well, but we were too busy taking advantage of the AYCE!!! 

I would totally recommend this place to anyone visiting. It isn't exactly downtown but well worth the drive for 10-15 minutes for this hole in the wall. 

Be careful when you drive in though , instead of rocks or pavement on their parking lot, they put rocks and Oyster shells ! Haha
Great margaritas! I didn't love the food though , unfortunately I think it was overpriced for what we got. Great ambience though !

Hugo's slogan is "We build sandwiches" well based on my recent visit they did not pass code with me!  I had such high hopes for this place as a 4 star rated deli and a ton of Elite yelper's giving it 5 stars. I have to fail them because or FOOD SAFETY 101 come on!! 

**Cleanliness- FAIL 
  Being in the food industry alooong time I go straight for looking at cleanliness of where I'm going to eat.  I notice the place is fairly dirty, floors, tables, and then I check the bathrooms.  As pictured the sink was gross and I dared not take a pic of the toilet, how is this possible though? They just had opened ... I was one of the first people in which must mean people are not trained in cleaning or just neglected it.  

**Food/Service 1 Star 
  I was helped quickly and navigated through the maze of confusing menu boards and price signs.  I opted for the French dip with no onion, it was made fairly quickly and served warm w Au jus. The sandwich it self was nothing special and the aujus had a tangy pickly taste that overpowered it.  My guess is too much peppercinni juice or left them in to long when cooking the sauce.   My service was good but I noticed many of the girls just standing and talking to each other and laughing, even with 6 girls when it came to lunch rush they seem to not be very efficient.  They share a 3 foot sandwich board and customers had to just stand while room was made for their sandwich to begin "construction".  
  
** FOOD SAFETY FAILS
   I did witness many hand washings and changing of gloves as required, sadly that all is voided by the fan blowing near the slicer and sandwich table.  (As pictured) 

   What was worse is the bacon tub filled with bacon sitting out, keep in mind I was there for an hour or more.  No way was that bacon temping hot or cold enough to fight bacteria, that is just gross and will get someone sick.  I ran into the same thing with a cream cheese tub that sat out at room temp the whole time.
